description:
Came here because Anthony Bourdain did. Will return because I liked it a lot.

Great burger served on a baguette, which is different and it works. The view of the bay bridge from the casual outdoor patio is awesome. Definitely come here for an afternoon bite or pre-game drink and snack.
author: Sara M.

description:
18.10.07.        FINALLY visited here

Ordered the Garic Fries ... Super crispy
    Gives it beautiful crunch

Burger was too lean ... Thus dry patty

There are restaurant tips for places like this ...
    Hotdogs
    French Fries ... Extra crispy
author: S.K. Y.

description:
VERY OVERRATED

Wow! I was shocked!  I was expecting something kitchy, but hella better. This place was pretty bad.

The $9 burger was a slab of meat on a hard french role. It was covered in pickles, and some type of dry sauce, and that's about it.  It was so bad.  It tasted dry and yucky!

My wife had fish and chips. The fries were quite good, but nothing special. The fish was edible and she did eat most of it.

The onion rings, about $6 were, clearly frozen.  They were not homemade, and certainly not worth $6.00.  

The tarter sauce had a dead mosquito, on the outside of the container, but didn't think of eating it.   

Thank God I didn't buy any overpriced drinks, hard or soft. I'm sure a can of soda would have been $3.50.  

You eat at outside places to save money on the "inside the park prices" but this was overpriced garbage.

NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!
author: William C.

description:
So I dropped by here for lunch after playing some Pokemon Go at The Embarcadero. This is pretty near the parking at the AT & T Center where the SF Giants are playing. I stopped by at this dive where Anthony Bourdain stopped by many years ago. 3 guys who are the host, cook and the guy at the bar are gracious, hospitable.
So I ordered the chili cheeseburger and a can of coke. The service was pretty fast - I didn't expect to be less than 1 minute. I guess they knew customers were coming in before the game starts. So the chili cheeseburger is with a grilled toasted Wedenbecker's sourdough bun, hamburger and their signature red coffee chili with beans which had a tangy zing to it. It is kind of tasty and you want to eat more of it. It is served on a paper bowl which is pretty hard to eat it and chili is sloppy wet. No doubt the Wedenbecker's sourdough baguette is off the charts and really good. But the chili was very underwhelming and burger was so underwhelming. I am not impressed by it and was rather disappointed. 
The crew here are working hard and serving a lot of their regular customers who watch baseball, and there are photographs from famous politicians, musicians who came from SF. This dive is pretty nostalgic in SF. This is probably a "humble shack" to enjoy food, drink and getting together for baseball fans and locals here. I would say the drinks and wine here are pretty cheap compared in the stadium.
I like the ambiance at this dive. Pretty cool in SF and a part of history in SF.
author: Jade M.

description:
I met up with a friend for (his) after-work dinner and drinks, along with several of his coworkers, at Red's Java House. I'd never heard of Red's before and was surprised when I saw it. This is a humble-looking "shack" on some primo real estate in San Francisco. You can find it on Pier 30 on The Embarcadero. Red's back patio faces the Bay and the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge. It occupies a tiny corner of what looks like a giant, stadium-sized parking lot. I later learned that this is (or was) one of the potential sites for the Golden State Warriors' new arena. Jeez.

Red's was originally known as Franco's Lunch in 1930. It was renamed Red's in 1955 and has been through multiple owners. How this small business has managed to stay open all these years - through a massive fire, earthquake, and, most of all, new city development - is beyond me. I think it's great they've managed to make it this long. Unfortunately, I can only see new construction, and the dollars associated with it, wiping this charming little place away. I hope I'm wrong.

The restaurant serves mostly unhealthy American breakfast and lunch foods like bacon, pancakes, burgers, hot dogs, and fries. They also have daily specials like corned beef sandwiches and fish and chips. For San Francisco, the prices are affordable with many plates under $10 each. My buddy likes their burgers (about $6-7) and their fish and chips (about $12) though he prefers onion rings with the fish instead of fries. Red's serves beer too. This is just a simple, very casual, comfort food/junk food, hangout type of joint.

The place is divey. The freestanding structure is old. The interior has creaky floors and is decorated with historic photographs and miscellaneous memorabilia. You can order food at the counter up front and alcohol from the bar in the back. The back of the building opens up to a chain-link-fence-enclosed uncovered patio. Most of the patio has a not-so-scenic view of the aforementioned parking lot. However, part of the patio has a view of the pier next door, Pier 28 (also not-so-scenic), parts of the Bay Bridge that peek over Pier 28, and a small part of the Bay itself. It's not a great view, but it is *a* view. The patio is lit with string lights at night and the tables have umbrellas. The covered portion in the back, where the bar is, has a TV used primarily for sports like Giants games.

Overall, I think Red's is A-OK. It's a chill little place that's good for meeting up with people. Despite the size, they can handle large groups and are also available for private events.
author: Daniel B.

description:
If you want to sit on a dock, off the beaten path in SF and enjoy some cheap drinks with baseball fans, Red's your man. 

My husband loves this ish, so this past Father's Day we popped in while our little one napped next to us. He quietly cheered for the Dodger's, I ate onion rings and a burger on a baguette. It's too much bread for me, but I just rip off half of it off and taco'd it up. The insides are of the burger remain greasy perfection, so this little modification ain't no big thing.
author: Evelyn A.

description: Beer in pitchers, burgers on fresh sourdough bread and breathtaking views of the Bay Bridge. Red's Java House is our go to casual spot. It's hard to beat on a beautiful sunny day.
author: Sarah H.

description: Great place for Bloody Mary's before a Giants game! Walk straight to the back if you're not getting food - believe food is cash only but bar in back takes cards. Awesome patio seating right on the water!
author: Eric N.

description:
This felt like a secret in SF, but looking around the place, you knew it was Home to the locals. We went here before the Giants game and it was relatively quiet, but I imagine it gets busier closer to game time. The cheeseburger on sourdough baguette is a must. Seriously. Don't even think about eating before you come here. It's a perfectly portioned single burger with cheese on a chewy, soury baguette. Onion rings are A+ too (and one order is enough to share between two people). I miss this meal already. And if it was good enough for Anthony Bourdain, you sure as hell know it's good enough for you.

(The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was because there were flies in the restaurant. Seems expected since the restaurant door was open, but still.)
author: Justine C.

description: Accidentally ate here because my co-worker called Red's Java House instead of Java House for a pick up order. So we walked a bit further to Red's Java House and upon entering, we had to dodge flies like Kung Fu masters. (Mr. Miyagi from Karate Kid should be hired there so that he can catch all the flies with his chopsticks.) Anyhow, we told the staff we were there to pick up our call in order. He said yeah yeah ok. Still nothing. So my coworker asked again and then he said they threw away our bacon cheeseburgers because we took too long. He said that they were going to make new burgers for us right now. I was excited thinking wow it must be great here, I've never eaten here but always see it and it's by the bridge and Anthony Bourdain ate here....we received our burgers and left the restaurant excited to see if maybe Red's Java House had better burgers than Java House, the location closer to our work that we meant to order from originally. We unwrapped our burgers to take a bite and... my coworker looked really depressed. I tried to make the best of it and enjoy the bacon and excess of pickles. The bread was hard, the meat very dry and there was only onions and pickles inside. She asked how can you be eating that? I said I'm trying to make the best of it and just eat the bacon and pickles....really a McDonald's cheeseburger is better than this which is sad to say. I tried to keep a positive attitude, but on the way walking back to work, we passed Java House. Not Red's Java House, just Java House, the one closer to ATT Park. My coworker was really depressed about the crappy burger that she paid for as a treat because usually she doesn't spend money eating out and today was happy cheeseburger day. She said she was gonna ask Java House for some lettuce and tomatoes and a real bun at least and that we would pay them. She explained our situation to the cooks there and they were accommodating even though they didn't have to. We explained that we meant to order from them and showed them the sad burgers that Red's Java House made. It was like looking at shriveled up dry mummified road kill. So they agreed to fix the burgers and give us lettuce, tomato, and bread you can actually bite into without breaking your teeth. Long story short, thankful that another restaurant tried to fix the sad burgers for us. Bottom line super dry and doesn't even feel like a real burger. Not sure why Red's Java House said they threw our pre-order burgers away, maybe the flies flew away with them or they were never made in the first place. I would rather bring a George Foreman Grill to work and make my own burger before EVER ordering from here again. Be careful when ordering over the phone, there is a Red's Java House and a Java House. Pick the one with the blue paint without the flies. Or if you want, I'll have my George Foreman Grill ready and will make juicy fresh hamburgers for you rather than some hard dried up meat that even your stomach knows isn't a real burger! Or eat here because it's closer to your work. I'm not here to control your life. I'm just saying.... big mistake to order from the wrong spot and to think it was a happy accident...felt punished by karma. Sorry I don't mean to be negative but it honestly was a big disappointment.
author: Angela O.

description:
Red's Java House is one of those "dive" restaurants that doesn't seem real outside of TV, movies or tourist magazines. The restaurant is located along Embarcadero (in the shadow of the Bay Bridge) and just a short walk from AT&T Park. 

This is a GREAT place to visit for breakfast and lunch. The food (burgers, sandwiches, breakfast, sides, etc.) is good in a "the way diners used to be" sort of way. It is simple and tasty. 

While the food is good, the views and ambiance is the real draw of this place. The views of the city, bay, Bay Bridge and AT&T Park are postcard worthy. You really "feel" the real Embarcadero here almost more than any other place. It is just slightly off the beaten (tourist) path elsewhere to make this place ooze with character and nostalgia. The food is really just a delightful plus! 

I'm happy that this place maintains the "feel" despite the fame that various TV shows and travel magazines have brought it. Fame hasn't changed the place at all. 

TIPS: Since you can bring food into AT&T Park for baseball games, this is a great place to great some food if you're not interested in the stadium's culinary offerings. 

Parking is always at a premium in San Francisco, but there are usually some meter spots available along the Embarcadero (and I usually park in front of Pier 26 to Pier 28). 

Red's is also just a 15 minute walk from the CalTrain station at 4th and King. In addition, the "N" MUNI has a stop (the intersection of the Embarcadero and Brannon) just a block away.
author: Chris M.

description:
Finally got here, a good number of years  after Anthony Bourdain's show first brought it to my attention. 1:30pm on a Friday saw a lightly-filled place, and we walked right up to the window.  Burgers served on a sourdough baguette, which was fresh and chewy. Beef was tasty, and complimented by nice chunks of onions, mustard and pickles (no lettuce or tomatoes at Red's). Shoestring fries could have been cooked longer, but still good and plentiful. Cold pitcher of Anchor Steam from the bar out back rounded out the lunch. Service was friendly and our burgers were done by the time we sat down w/ our beer. I'm a fan!

Cheers!
RS
author: Rich S.

description: On the way to the ATT Ballpark, there is Reds Java House, an institution dive bar where we consistently return to have a drink and a burger.  The prices are definitely cheaper than inside the ballpark! It has been around forever - food is OK actually just normal pub food and drinks are what they are....served in plastic glasses.  The real attraction here is sitting on the pier and looking out at the water and seeing all of the fans go by.  Great little place!
author: Ginger O.

description:
I was in SF for a few days for the 4th of July holiday visiting my friend and they mentioned this place was good and we were in the area so we decided to go.

They serve their burgers on a sourdough roll which is an A+ for me! Love sourdough bread, especially a roll. I ordered a cheeseburger and their onion rings, both really good!

They have an outside area which is right on the water. My friend and I didn't the to sit there since it was full but still enjoyed our meal inside. 

I will come back here for sure. The service is good and so is their food. I will say though the name made me think it was a coffee shop, I would have easily passed it up if I was hungry.
author: Evangelina B.

description:
Great location to take in the beautiful views of the bridge and the bay. If it's a nice day outside, you can sit out on their back patio area. They have a bar back there too. We ordered a single cheeseburger and the fish and chips. The burger is simple - cheese, mustard, onions, and pickles. The bun is a piece of sourdough bread. I love sourdough bread so I really liked the burger. I think this is the only place where I've seen this style of burger. If you don't like sourdough bread, you should probably order something else. The fish and chips had nice big chunks of fried fish. The fish tasted great and wasn't too oily. I like that they give you tartar sauce and vinegar on the side. 

There's a parking lot next door but there's also street parking. It's not too far from public transportation if you don't want to search or pay for parking.
author: Nicole S.

description: Haven't been here in years. Won't be back in years. Don't know if they're trying to make their burgers into a fad or carve a niche with them but it doesn't work. A meat patty smothered in mustard and pickles drowned out in a French roll is not a thing. $25 for a cheeseburger, tuna melt, fries and a soft drink and tea. Way over priced even for the view.
author: Dan C.

description: The manager, Carlos, is the man! Very nice and accommodating. His team took care of our team and not to mention the food was amazing!
author: Glenn A.

description: So we finally checked this place out and it was a huge disappointment. I went in to ask the guy what was their special and the guy said cheeseburger and a beer for $10. As we sat down I realized the beer was $3 and cheeseburger was $6.52 plus tax. Then the burger came and the patty wasn't fully thawed.. the only fresh thing was the bread that I was having difficulty chewing cuz of my braces. The beer was Rolling Rock and it tasted cheap. I would not go back
author: Crystal P.

description:
I had not been here in years.  I recalled juicy burgers. It's got a convenient location and a party atmosphere but I won't be coming here again.  Worst quality of meat and flavor I can recall.  Shameful by SF  standards.  Dry cardboard with mustard, pickles and onions.
Fast Food Burger ratings :
In & Out - 8.5
Super Duper - 8.5
Roam -7.5
Red's - 2 -and it's not even a fast food burger joint.
Some places can serve mediocre crap and last forever.
author: gary l.

description: My high review is merely Loyalty to Pops the ORIGINAL OWNER , i miss his 4door bbyblue Impala parked on side of building, taste has changed an not for the better, but what can we do , Kids took over, it is what it is, if i was visiting an had no clue of Pop the Original i would never come back, real rating is 2. LOYALTY&RESPECT MAKES IT 5 STAR, something todays generations have 0 clue about
author: Robert G.

description: (Was amazing this morning),  was hungover and got up at 5 am to feast on there double cheese burger with fresh sourdough bread. Pleasures or the morning, now I'm in my nice cozy bed all alone and lonely lol. Reds rules the day!!
author: Paul R.

description: I've been to Red's a few times now and it really is a cool little legendary spot close to the ballpark. I came here with several friends before the start of a Giants game and while they went to the back to get some drinks I ordered a double cheeseburger with fries. The reason why I like this burger so much is that it's on sourdough bread and the cheese is just sticking to it like some sort of miracle food! The fries have also been decent, but nothing to brag about for the most part. The service here is quick and since this place is on the docks it does tend to get a bit messy inside sometimes. Overall, a solid unique burger and one I'll definitely be back for!
author: James R.

description: As a SF native, anxious to try this place out on Sunday 8/12 before the SF Giants game.  Very short on staff. The person taking money touches food. The cook cleans up floor spills, no hand washing and goes straight to cooking.  Drill holes in the chairs to eliminate the wet/puddling of water on the  chairs.   Too much grease in the burger and old grease used for the fries.  Partner got sick on the food. What's up with no lettuce or tomatoes.  Dirty place. Their last review on the wall is 2010. Figures.  No recommendations from us.  Very disappointing to both of us.
author: Yelp A.

description:
Love this place for a quick bite, but got campylobacter here on 6/21/18. Symptoms lasted for over two weeks!! 

You get campylobacter by taking bacteria through the mouth-- usually from contaminated or undercooked meat.
author: jessica l.

description:
I really enjoyed the cheeseburger on sourdough.  But I was also ridiculously hungry as a nursing mom by the time I got that burger.  It did rekindle a love affair with sourdough such that I bought a huge round that weekend and slathered butter all over it.  I would have ordered the double cheeseburger if I had control over the ordering.  The chili cheese fries were mediocre.  The chili was very very bland.  But the cheddar out of a bag was nice.  

This is not a place for an Amlaw 100 firm to have their annual holiday party.  I do not care how broke the regional office is, by having the holiday party here, the message is that the firm doesn't give a flying lobotomy about the staff or associates.  The ambiance was simply cold waterfront pier, OUTSIDE.  Yes.  We had to sit outside and scarf down lukewarm burgers in the dark.  I wasn't drinking anything because I'm nursing and I needed to get home to my little one.  

If I'm looking for a dive, salt-of-the-earth kind of place, then totally nailed it.  But if you are looking for a restaurant to say thanks to your staff for the work that they do during the year, you might as well give each person a flaming bag of poo.
author: Christina C.

description:
Chili cheese fries is awesome, sandwich and hotdog are less impressive tho.
There is lots of bugs in store (hygiene is my biggest concern )
author: Miffy C.

description:
This place has history, I get it. It has a great vibe and I love supporting the smaller places on the edge of Fisherman's Wharf. We stopped by here because it was hyped by Anthony Bourdain, who appears to be getting a little carried away with the romance of it all these days and recommending places that have just ok food.

I'm not sure about the breakfast, which seems popular here.The burger is what we came for.

As mentioned by others the burger is a basic smash-burger on sourdough with cheese, onion, and smothered in mustard. These are the only condiments provided. I love all of these things but the whole thing was pretty dry and you can't taste anything but mustard and onion.

If you dislike sourdough order something else.

When I am in the area again I will try to stop by and see how the breakfast is. Until then, just two stars for being a local institution.
author: Ron R.

description: So we left the baseball game & we're starving, so we stopped here. The positives: the food was cooked well but bland & probably the reason it was out quick was bc the fries were frozen. And sadly the fish was just ok. There's only ONE bathroom here. The tables were dirty, as were the floors. No surprise the bathroom was dirty. The prices are comparable for SF, anywhere you go it'll be pricey. Everyone in my party of 7 agreed w/ this review. Save your money. Go elsewhere. Unless you're super starved, but don't say you weren't warned.  I'm kinda sad. I wanted to give this place a good review.
author: Monica L.

description: This is a great place to have a good simple meal with friendly staff.  Being on the water and views of the Bay Bridge gives you a different perspectives of the city then most. Enjoy coming here with my husband for breakfast.
author: Drew C.

description: Definitely has some great views of the Bay Bridge, beer, old SF charm, and is eclectic and charming, That is why I wanted to check it out and share it with a friend.  But the food was the worst I have had in a long time.  The hamburger came on a sourdough roll without lettuce and tomato; as stated in big letters on the wall menu. OK, but weird.  Naked burger?  And my fries with chili and cheese were just beans (no chili!) dumped over fries and a bit of shaved cheddar. Not even melted.  So disappointing. Luckily I was in good company and we just laughed about it. I wonder what their end game is because this is not how one stays in business in this competitive food economy.
author: Jana B.

description:
Was in town for a baseball game, and after reading reviews about Reds I was looking forward to stopping there.

Arrived around 11 am on a Monday and the place was pretty empty.  You order your food at the kitchen window and wait for them to call your number.  They may have table service when it's busy.  I did see a cook run some food out to a table, so I guess you could go that route as well.  I ordered a double cheese burger and sat out on the back patio.  I was disappointed that the bar didn't open until 2pm, but the cook grabbed me a can of beer so it was all good.

They serve their burgers on a French bread type of roll W/mustard and pickles.  If you don't care for mustard, have them hold it because they really load it on.  I am a mustard fan and it was almost too much for my taste.   Overall, the burger was ok.  I really had high expectations,  so I was a little let down.  Definitely get the double as the patties are small.

The patio is ok as well.  Nothing too special.  You get a view of the Bay bridge and some docks.

If it is a place you've wanted to try, go ahead and give it a shot.  Just don't expect anything above average.
author: James D.

description: Went in on a nice sunny day the guy upfront was supper supper nice!!!! I ordered double cheese burger combo (burger/fries/drink) 15$ the food looks delicious the bread is fresh and the meat is well cooked. My only issue was the fact when I walked in there is a bunch of flys !!! I don't want to eat at a place with flys everywhere! Advice for red java staff please please get a fly zapper lol .. other than that the customer service was excellent and the food was yummy. I live here in Sf this is definitely a spot I like to go to every once in a while when I make extra cash to dine out... THE BURGER TASTE GOOD HOWEVER $15 FOR A HALF BURGER WITH TWO SMALL PATTYS ISNT WORTH IT TO ME.. FYI I GIVE 2 STAR BASED OFF THE SIZE OF THE FOOD.
author: Lei S.

description:
Not too bad when it comes to price for the fish n' chips (seeing as this is in SF where most items are $15+). For $11+ you get two large pieces of cod and some fries.

Cozy atmosphere and customer service is awesome! They have a great sense of humor and have fun questions of the day. Just know they can be a bit tricky.

As for the food it tasted great! Fish was deep fried perfectly; crunchy on the outside and hot and moist in the inside. The tartar sauce is nothing amazing, just plain ol' tartar sauce you can buy at your local chain grocery store, but it's not bad by any means. Fries were lightly salted and had a crispy crunch to it, yet soft when you bite in. ''

Highly recommend to at least try the place out and enjoy the view!
author: Paul C.

description: Samuel was very rude. My family tried to go in to get food at 6:45pm on a Sunday and he wouldn't even allow my son to use the restroom because it was being "cleaned" despite the 4 people already in line.
author: Maria G.

description: Good steak but rude customer service dirty bathroom . I will not recommend to friends or family
author: Andrew G.

description: was gonna check this place out but with all the bad reviews. I don't think so. heard they have a major health food problem, and that the employees are very rude to customers. NO THANKS.
author: Scott S.

description: The fish and chips are perfect. Light batter with moist cod topped off with fries.  The cheeseburgers are fantastic with boudin style bread.
author: Wendy C.

description: A quick stop by reds for a hamburger ! Good cheeseburger served with minimal topping but the bread/roll they used was great. Just a tad too much mustard but still super tasty ! Nice stop on the way into town!
author: La S.

description:
I've been coming here for over 35 years and the food hasn't changed. Perhaps it's an acquired taste, but a fried burger on a hunk of sourdough with hunks of onion and only mustard just tastes so good.

One of the attractions of this place was always the price. It's not like a regular burger with all the trimmings, and there's no table service - that was always reflected in the tab. Not anymore. A few days ago two double cheese burgers (1/3 + lb. each) with fries and one soda came to $28. That's in sit-down restaurant territory and Red's ain't all that. 

The bottom line is Red's is gouging the clientele. For about the same price you can get a real burger (lettuce and tomato) with better fries at Hard Knox or just about any other diner.
author: Clinton F.

description: I'll get this place to start because of its location. I stopped off with a friend for late breakfast or early lunch on the way to the ballpark. The service was horribly slow and we waited for food forever. Numerous people were being served their food who were behind us in line. I have no idea how long our food just sat at the counter before I finally went up and was able to get someone's attention to retrieve it for us. And the food itself simply wasn't that good-to call mediocre diner food would be generous. I'm not quite sure what the attraction for this places and I doubt I'll return. I think there's better elsewhere nearby.
author: Robert C.

description: Great service,The gents that work here are real nice, Tasty food and drinks. I don't usually like onion rings but loved theirs! The spicy Bloody Mary is excellent! ^_^
author: Birdy B.

description: Hamburger, cheeseburger done with bread baguette. Beef meat are juicy. French fries are good. It's a honest cooking. Behind there's a terrace. It's close to dock and you can continue your walk and reach Mission Bay Area. It's not really a worse restaurant, it's "popular".
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Okay first of all if you like this spot you must have been spoon fed garbage since the day you were born. I've been goin to the pier close by for years so I thought I would try it out one time. 

Walked in and got attacked by a swarm of flies. I ordered a double cheese burger, apparently they outlawed lettuce and tomatoes here tho. And good cooks too apparently. Wtf! 

This "burger" (and I use that term lightly) was disgusting. Two nasty ass pattys in stale sourdough roll. With just mustard as the only condiment. Really? The meal was disgusting. The Coca Cola was the best part. 

If you gave this spot more than one star you need to seek mental health counseling right now, it's an emergency trust me
author: Guerito L.

description: Great waterside hole to fill your piehole.  Really good and cheap breakfast.  Great views of marina and ATT Park as well.
author: Steven K.

description:
Food is the same; prices are definitely not.

"Cheap" can no longer be applied to Red's menu, so they lose a star.
author: Niko Z.

description: Sourdough burgers, good fish and chips, bay views, jazz music, a bar, a patio, with parking around, and not too far from downtown.  Great photos inside and good prices.  Working class fare, not for snobs.
author: Stephen B.

description: Great food and drinks, reasonable prices, what more could you ask for?  Definitely visit before seeing a Giants game!  Plenty of places to sit, but the outdoor patio can't be beat!  Call beforehand; the hours of operation change due to events in the area.  Will definitely be back!
author: Keith J.

description:
This is an institution and as such it gets all sorts of passes. 

When you visit RJH you're visiting history so leave your expectations at the door and just go with it.

Having said that my experience was A-OK but unless it was terrible RJH gets the stars just for the historic value.
author: Oleg H.

description:
I grew up in San Francisco and still love visiting as an adult.  One place we make sure go to is Red's Java House.  It is a San Francisco classic that has remained practically the same since it opened.

Hole in the wall?? Of course!  And that's what makes it great.  If you want a simple, juicy and yes greasy hamburger.  You've found the place.  The breakfast sandwich is egg, cheese, and your choice of sausage or bacon in between bread (sourdough, wheat, rye, white, or French roll).  This morning we opted for a sausage breakfast sandwich with wheat bread.

But I also love the pancakes here.  Light, fluffy, and yummy!

As far as location, you can't beat outdoor seating with a view of the bay and Bay Bridge and a short walk to AT&T park.
author: Maria V.

description:
I guess when you're a legend with a spectacular location you can rest on your laurels instead of living up to the reputation. That's Red's, a spectacular fail.

Why? Well, why are they completely out of coffee, with no coffee being made, at 8 a.m.? 
Why do they burn the bacon to complete, inedible blackness?
Why do they not provide butter with their toast?

Feel proud, Red's management. Your staff perfectly fits the stereotype of the typical San Francisco eatery: lazy, inattentive, full of itself.
author: Yowz A.

description: Great time at Red's. Big pluses: Food, people and drinks. The only thing I would improve is the overall cleanliness. We came in when it was fairly empty and the outside patio area was pretty dirty (food, drinks left around). That might be a function of some really drunk people that were leaving as we walked in. If in SF, go to Red's!
author: Robert M.

description:
I really hate to leave a not-so-positive review for a place that has many positive reviews and that is considered a San Francisco institution.

But, just like the rest of my reviews, I have to be honest and upfront about my experience.  Ultimately, your experience may be different than mine based upon your personal tastes.  YMMV.

With the reasonable proximity to my work, I decided to venture out to Pier 30 to try out this place for lunch.  When I arrived, there was a long line and many people were sitting outside by the water.  This gave me a good impression and things looked promising.

Pros:

+ Basic, yet decent menu: they have hot dogs, hamburgers, cheeseburgers, french fries, garlic fries, fish and chips, breakfast, etc.  They also have a number of beverages, including craft beer, available.
+ Great views of the water and the Bay Bridge
+ Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating

Cons:

- Abundance of flies and even a few pigeons inside: somehow they managed to pass a health inspection with a score of 92 (per a sign on the wall), but this is still an issue that needs to be addressed.
- My cheeseburger came out in pretty much one minute after I finished placing my order.  When I got back to my office and sat down to eat it, there was no flavor whatsoever.  The mustard, cheese, onions and sourdough bun did not do justice either.  I wasn't expecting some serious gourmet $#!%, but for $6.44 I don't think it's too much to ask that my burger has some flavor to it.
- To further elucidate the above point, it appears that not everything is cooked to order here.  It seems as if they have a number of items already cooked up that they leave sitting on the grill to keep adequately warm.  Makes sense that my order was ready so quickly. 
- For some reason, they don't offer tomatoes or lettuce as topping options for their burgers.  Weird.

My experience was not terrible, but a lot was left to be desired.  I'm a big fan and admirer of Anthony Bourdain and I've heard that he swears that this place gets the job done.  Guess I just don't feel the same way.

2 stars
author: Michael F.

description: This place is incredible. Right on a pier, clearly hadn't been redecorated since the 50s, jazz playing in the background, perfectly crispy onion rings, and stupidly cheap beer.  10 minute walk from AT&T park!
author: Laura T.

description: I got a burger that was terrible , husband had chilli cheese burger he took one bite,, in the garbage.
author: Susie B.

description: Really good burgers on a sourdough bun with a great view of the bridge and AT&T Park. The outdoor seating on the pier is nice.
author: Brian R.

description: Worse place to come!!!! If you're in town for the weekend after going to a Giants game!!!! Bartender was being rude and assumed that we were just there to use the restroom. His attitude and his approach was very unwelcoming, so we decided to leave the establishment  (elder Hispanic male)
author: Luis V.

description:
I really wish I could have given it more props... but the food was not good.

I'm sorry to say, but you come here only for the view... and you're really paying for the view.  All that food you see in my photo was around 28 dollars.  Mini sandwich which left me wanting to get more food, and my boyfriend's corn beef hash was disappointing for 11ish dollars.  I can't even explain what the food tasted like.  It was bland.  The sausage and egg breakfast sandwich is just as it is - drenched in butter and eh.  The corn beef hash was lacking beef, but it had an abundance of onions. The coffee ended up having a ton of coffee grinds in it [of course they aren't known for coffee, I know]. 

The best part of this breakfast was the location - you sit near the water, look out into the sky and feel at peace.
author: Julie C.

description: Delicious!!! The cheeseburgers, fish & chips, beer, and the views are all wonderful. The burger buns are made from pieces of heaven.
author: Danielle V.

description:
Don't it always seem to go that you don't know what you've got 'til it's-- gone.  That's what Ms Jackson sang which holds true in the case of  Red's Java House.  

I found after eating at Red's that I take for granted the lettuce and tomato slices that I usually receive in my burgers.  I'm a manly man I think subconsciously, I don't need no stinking veg.  Do I look like a tree huggin', recycling conscious,  tofu eatin', yoga mat havin' guy to you?!  But then I took my first bite:

Double Cheeseburger:  it's about a five inch double patty burger in sourdough bread with onions and pickles.  The burger comes out instantly since the turnover of burgers is non stop.  There's no asking for a medium rare burger here, they come out well done.  But after my first couple bites I realized something was missing.  The burger was lacking a certain flavor and texture.  That's when I realized that this burger had no lettuce or tomato.  I didn't understand till those components were gone how important they are.  Don't get me wrong, the patties/cheese were tasty, the sourdough bread was awesome.  I would say 3.5 stars but just those two items would have bumped it up to a 4 star experience easily.

The fries were whatever as well.  The service was fast food-ish.  Order, sit, eat, throw wrappers in trash can and keep it moving.  However the location is a million dollar view right below the Bay Bridge on Embarcadero.  A real iconic location for this burger joint.

Never again will I under estimate the value of vegetables like lettuce and tomato.  Because you don't what you got till it's gone....  Now where's my yoga mat???
author: Michael L.

description: On Tuesdays and Sunday's they have corn beef. It's very tasty. If you come any other day get the burger.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
This place is a great place to grab a beer and enjoy a view of the Bay bridge.  I've walked by this place for years, and assumed it was your typical dive bar.  Looking for a  place for a quick bite, some person heard me and a friend talk about lunch,  and recommended this spot. 

We ended up finding a local gem, so we stopped by again today for the fish and chips special.   On our first visit, we ordered the double cheeseburger with garlic fries. Don't expect fresh ground beef, and a doneness request on the meat.  What you will get is a simple, but solid burger on sourdough bread with a basket of fries.  

The place is unassuming as you walk by, but step in and you'll find a great old school diner on a small pier with wooden floors.  The pictures on the wall vary from Ernest Hemingway chilling with Fidel Castro to Obama dancing with Sarah Palin.   The patio out back is a relaxing area to enjoy your food, but keep an eye on it if you go to order a drink.  The birds are waiting for you to slip.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I must say that chili burger I had was the worst ever. Cheap quality meat with processes cheese and completely tasteless chili on a sourdough baguette. No spices, whatsoever.

If it wasn't for the tourists, this place would not survive in San Francisco!
author: Maria P.

description: Coming from Chicago I am always looking for a good burger/hot dog place and this place fell short for two reasons: 1. The price of the hot dog and hamburger were outrageous. 2. If you are going to charge $5.50-$6.00 for a hot dog and hamburger, it better be pretty good. This leads me to reason 2. The buns were dry and crunchy. Maybe having a hamburger on sourdough bread is a San Francisco deal, but personally, I found it gross. The hot dog bun was hard and not edible. If you're going to charge the above price for hot dogs or hamburgers, please present a better product.
author: Terence W.

description:
BLUE COLLAR BURGER JOINT

This past Friday after the SF Boat Show at Pier 48 McCovey Cove I came here to eat with my co-worker and boss for a late lunch. I had a double cheeseburger medium rare and root beer. 

With all the hipster places popping up at San Francisco it's great to see the blue collar vibe at Red's Java House. That's what makes this place iconic is that the vibe of Red's Java transmits to the burger. The meat is a rectangular patty. There's no standard round bun but a toasted sourdough roll. The cheese is a bright orange color. Combining these features doesn't make sense. But after eating this burger you understand why. Not only is the burger is delicious and light, but also this is a no nonsense burger in a no nonsense burger joint without the frills of some of these new eateries. Some new places come with the hype while the old places remain a test of time like Red's Java House. I can see why Anthony Bourdain loves this place.
author: Gerald R.

description:
How disappointing that a place that's been around "forever", is right off the bay, etc. can survive by offering mediocre food.  Their menu is very simple which can be a good thing if all are executed well.  Only their garlic and chili cheese fries come close!  Their burgers are probably quarter pound patties folded into a large piece of sourdough bread with onions and mustard.  No flavors save for the sourdough bread!

What a waste of a view!
author: Gene D.

description: This place is apparently a San Francisco local's staple.  It's a hole in the wall that people we spoke with remember with extreme fondness.  The only start I knocked off was for the cleanliness.  It's a bit dirty, and when I came out of the restroom and washed my hands, I almost feel dirtier than when I went in to it.  The burgers we're juicy and cooked perfectly.  They only serve mustard, onion, and pickle as they everything.  You put your own ketchup on.  There's no frilly vegetables here at this joint.  You place your order from a small menu, they call your name loudly over the intercom, and you eat.  It's that simple.  Want service?  Not here.  Want white table cloths?  Go somewhere else.  Want a no nonsense burger and fries or onion rings, this place is just what you need.  Oh, and they serve beer!  Yeah, do I need to say anything else?
author: Greg M.

description:
Anthony Bourdain said anytime you begin to doubt the wonderfulness of San Francisco, all you gotta do is come here. 

It's a no-frills place where you can grab a good burger, chili cheese fries, and a beer and enjoy the view.
author: Liberty A.

description: Overpriced for bad quality food. They don't even use hamburger buns they use some hard nasty bread.
author: Diego S.

description:
great place to come before a Giants game.
Got the Sourdough Cheese burger and a bucket of beers.
Gotta get here early, 2+ hours before the game, other wise it will be tricky getting a good place to sit.
author: Justin K.

description: Good was good. We had the eggs rancheros. It is quaint and very relaxing inside. I would come back again. Great location! Friendly staff:)
author: Ilene D.

description: Accept this place for what it is...the most incredible dive you've ever been to. Breakfast is quick and at a better price point than you'll find anywhere. Lunch is the real deal but pregame drinks is where this becomes my go to. They have a full bar in back with game day deals...Burger is one of the best in SF. Stop ripping on how old the place is, that's part of the charm. The only negative is they can get crazy busy so get there early.
author: Chip W.

description:
The most all-american restaurant I've ever been to.

Love their cheeseburger, especially since they put it on that chewy sourdough bun. No substitutes, no fuss, ya get what ya get!
author: Angela L.

description: I didn't particularly like this place. We went and had a burger for brunch time. There were all kinds of flies inside, the burger wasn't so tasty, the garlic fries were ok. They had a patio outside and a large bar in the back. Probably would have been better for happy hour. The inside had a lot of nice pictures. I wouldn't go again.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Food is decent. They don't sell lettuce or tomatoes, I find that to be odd, since they sell burgers. 
Fries are good. 
Seating is decent. 
I won't give 5 stars bc they only have 1 bathroom which continuously has a line. There are port-a-pottys outside but.... Gross 

Not a place I would crave. Would only go bc it's convenient if I'm in the area
author: Vanessa Anne R.

description: Good burger and my girl loves the fish and chips here. Parking cost $4 for 2 hours next door also a good place to go on the way to a baseball game
author: JD E.

description:
Good views and good burgers. I like how their only toppings are mustard, onions and pickles. Too many places overkill a cheeseburger. The sourdough bun is also bomb.

Next time I'm going ask if I can get fresh patty on the grill. My dbl. burger came out 3 mins after ordering, which makes sense because it is a small place & builds a line quick. But I don't mind waiting 10mins to get a juicy burger. 

My mom said they had the best fish-n-chips she's eaten in her life tho.
author: Steven L.

description: If I could give this place a zero I would. When I walked in, the flies swarming the place greeted me before the staff. The staff was rude and greasy, a lot like the food. The beer was flat, so disappointed!!!
author: Aja B.

description:
I was impressed by the menu when I first walked in. It's a cute local business, the food was alright. I ordered a double dog, thinking wow this must be good. It ended up being 2 skinny wieners in a massive sourdough loaf with tons of mustard, onion and pickles. My husband's sandwich was also sourdough, and we learned that day that we are not big fans of sourdough, at least not with hotdogs. It wasn't great, I ended up scooping a lot of the onion and mustard out. We split some garlic fries which I felt were too oily, and the garlic seemed a bit bitter.

I'm not going to totally knock this place, I definitely enjoyed the general vibe of the place, and I'm curious what their breakfasts taste like, just not going to run back anytime soon.
author: Jenny M.

description: Today my boyfriend rec'd a brown hot dog that was cold to the center. It was, and I quote, "the worst hot dog I ever had". He never complains. We've eaten here before and it was good.
author: Angela S.

description:
Great place to go before a Giants game. Tasty burgers in a sour dough bun and craft beer to wash it all down. Get the double, otherwise you might still be hungry. 

Sure, you can go to overpriced fancier places with lesser burgers closer to the ballpark, but you won't get the view and they won't match the atmosphere.
author: Rolf G.

description:
I love the burger! It's a simple thing, but the bread is what MAKES it. They use fresh, San Francisco sourdough bread on their burgers instead of boring, mealy buns.They've got great chili fries too.

Grab a beer and enjoy a nice view of the water. I hear this place does great breakfasts. Next time I'm in the city, I'm definitely stopping in again!
author: Angelica K.

description:
9/29/15 I stopped to have a drink with a friend. On the way out the owner accused me of taking my drink "to go." I assured him that wasn't the case since I just finished my drink. He proceeded to call me a "liar," a "faggot," and a "bitch" because he insisted that I had a bottle in my pocket. Really, I had no pockets that could have concealed a bottle. If I wanted a drink to go, I would go to the store.

Beyond that, the food sucks, the drinks are overpriced, the service is lacking, and the crowd is obnoxious.

This establishment clearly doesn't deserve your business and most definitely will not receive any business from me or anyone that I know. It's a shame that the owner thinks this kind of behavior is acceptable.
author: Brian A.

description: This is a hole in the wall place.  I ordered a coffee and it wasn't good at all.  Java shouldn't even be part of their name.  It's cool that they are on the water, but I think it's time to tear down and rebuild.  I don't know if I would eat here.
author: ViJay K.

description: Been going here for over 20 years and it is still a great place. People don't get that this is a traditional sandwich cooked the same way since the restaurants founding. A simple beef patty on a great sourdough roll with onions, mustard and a beer. This has always been a blue collar bar vs a hipster hang out. A great location, food and Bloody Mary's if you want more then a beer.
author: Mike H.

description:
Perfect spot for a cheeseburger and a beer or Bloody Mary. 

Amazing vista underneath the Bay bridge, great outdoor area. Really relaxed ambience inside and out. And very chilled vibe from the staff.

The cheeseburger is a solid 8/10. Bloody Mary's 7.5/10
author: Iain M.

description:
Everyone, including Anthony Bourdain, knows that Red's Java House is a San Francisco institution. I've passed by Red's Java House on my way to AT&T Park countless times and yet somehow never found the time to stop in. Luckily, I was finally able to last month on Opening Day.

My mom and I got to Red's fairly early for breakfast. By 11 a.m., it was packed to the brim with people so be sure to get here early if you want to eat breakfast comfortably and not in a rush. We both ordered the pancakes plate ($9.75) which came with scrambled eggs, bacon, and a large pancake. Red's gives some generous portions and we were full until late in the afternoon. The food here is your standard breakfast fare but it still feels like a good, home-cooked meal.

With great views of the Bay, Red's is definitely one of those places where you "stop and smell the roses." As a San Francisco native, I love places that give me a truly, local vibe and Red's offers just that.
author: Stephanie C.

description: The perfect breakfast place. Red's java has been around for a long time and I totally understand why. Their breakfast items hit the spot. In my party of three we all had different items and they were all delicious. Definitly worth a visit if your here on holidays and if you luve in SF and never been ! Otherwise you know what i'm talking about !
author: Michelle W.

description: Wow, can't believe I have never been here, great spot on the water.  Yes, divey in a great way, no frills, great view.  The burger was tasty, no tomato though.  My breakfast quesadilla hit the spot with an IPA on tap.  Just a fun spot to stop in at while walking the waterfront.  Good cheap eats and good beers on tap, and that view, great view.  And doggie friendly!!
author: Carole W.

description: Retired and belong to a breakfast club.  Weekly, we visited SF eateries for breakfast.  Lots of history at this place.  Very laid-back place.  4 of us visited one weekdays' morning.  Place pretty empty.  This place serves alcohol and burgers that we didn't try.  Ordered 4 different breakfasts and they're all very good.  Will be back to checkout their burgers and happy hours.
author: Denis Y.

description: Fantastic dive on the water under the Oakland Bay Bridge with perfect San Francisco weather and great for pre-game (Giant's game) activities (beer drinking).
author: Trujillo F.

description:
Still good for a tasty burger and a cold drink. Good views in the back seating area. 

The bad. 
Parking is a premium. 
Prices is high. Ten yrs ago $5 for combo. 
Pigeons also dine in with you.
author: Phil T.

description:
Yes... It's a hole in the wall... Yes it is visually unappealing... And yes it is awesome! 

I had no idea Anthony Bourdain had visited.  The only reason I went is that one of my employees told be they had a burger and fries that was good and it was only a 3-minute walk from my office.  I was intrigued by the sign in the store that boldly drew a line in the sand. "We don't serve tomatoes or lettuce."  However, the question asked of me as I placed my order at the dilapidated  counter raised another mystery. "Everything on it?" I responded with an unflinching "Yes." My mind raced...if no tomatoes or lettuce.... What is everything?  I asked for extra-crispy fries and they obliged with out hesitation.  Soda was served in a can. Nicely chilled. Barq's - It has bite (caffeine for the uninitiated - much needed mid-day)!

While I waited for the enigma of the burger's toppings to unfold I made my way to the dock/patio at the back of Red's.  The America's Cup is in full swing and they are set up right behind and to the side of Red's.  I found a seat with no seagull crap and nested.  Patio umbrellas provided some shade but it was a warm day.  I entertained my self watching the seagulls and pigeons fight over food scraps and waited for my food to arrive.  

Finally, with out any fanfare the unassuming burger was laid before me.  Not much to look at.  Condiments? Toppings??? Not much to speak of.  Mystery solved... Chopped onion, pickles and mustard.  Two large patties, shoved unceremoniously into a sourdough hoagie roll.  Experience??? Unforgettable!  Pure. Unpretentious.  Protein packed, delight!   Everything a man needs in a burger!!! I have found a place in California, where you will be slapped if you request guacamole on your burger. This is a haven for those, like me who can appreciate the simplicity of a few select items prepared from age old traditions of meat and fire!!! 

I was sure they must prepare the meat themselves.  I inquired of the cooks, if this was the case because the meat tasted so fresh.  In actuality they buy the patties off premise but fresh...not frozen and that is why they taste so good.

Bonuses: fries...extra crispy. Crowds... None.

Price... $13.... A little high but this is San Fran!  

Try the fish and chips!!! I'll tell you about those later!
author: Lloyd H.

description:
Sometimes I just don't get Anthony Bourdain . . . and sometimes, I do.  This was one of those times that I feel like he knew better than me.  My first impression was that this place looked like a shack and I saw no lines out the door. I will have to admit that given the recent glut of burger bars, I was a bit dismayed at the lack of offerings. What do you mean, you guys have no truffle sauce or aioli mayo that I can put on my burger?

But this is where the ultimate joy of burger comes through.  I have to admit that I found a zen like experience in eating a burger with no special sauce or gimmick - just meat, cheese, pickles, onions on a sourdough bun.  Unpretentious and simple - what a burger used to be before the Foodie craze turned it into an overly flamboyant monstrosity.  Not that I don't like that at times. 

Paired with a beer, I felt the worries of the world melt away and imagined myself back in a time where men could freely watch tv while sticking one hand down the pants. Yup, that's how comforting this burger was.
author: Hion L.

description: I really love the double cheeseburger. Bun is fantastic. Great beers. Great location. The service is awesome and really quick. Best place to eat before a Giants game!!
author: James B.

description:
A friend had mentioned that Anthony Bourdain recommended Red's Java House so the boyfriend and I headed on over... we are always on the lookout for a good burger.

We went on a Saturday afternoon after hitting the farmer's market at the Ferry Building. We waited in a long line when we got there because apparently there was a Giants game that afternoon and everyone was pre-partying.

We ordered the double cheeseburger combo to share. The burger patties were rather thick, which I was excited about, but they didn't really have a great amount of flavor. I am a big fan of sourdough, but I thought it was a bit bland. I found the burger to be just OK, nothing to write home about.

Another thing I noticed was that the fries tasted as if they were fried in oil that was old and needed to be changed.

We enjoyed sitting outside in the back; the sun was shining and the weather was gorgeous. Wish the burger had been more than ok, though. Glad we tried it, but not as great as it should be considering all the hype.
author: Jennifer P.

description: If you're ever around the piers of SF, hit this place up. They have the best cheese burgers (if you like your cheeseburger on sourdough bread) and fish and chips. My husband and I have been coming back for years. And the view of the bay bridge from this spot is beautiful.
author: MaryJane C.

description:
This is a San Francisco place you go to for one reason: to check it off your list. 

With a simple menu, Red's should produce food that's spot on. 

Instead...

Nice and greasy. Slides down easy.
author: GB M.

description: Had some breakfast from these guys.  Good pancakes and bacon.  Staff was friendly.  I'm interested to go back and try a burger since Hi Dive next door isn't great.
author: Brian B.

description: I love Red's. It's a cool, divey place for gutbombs. The Double Cheese Dog is great...as is anything with eggs....and yes: it's overpriced...it's SF....but it's a must-visit.
author: Sean C.

description:
Late night before.... Morning in like thunder. Mad bongo player sat cross legged between my ears. Need The Cure.... 

Which, South of Market, is delivered between grilled slices of rye and filled with heaven and hash. Only at Red's. The weekend special, Corned Beef Hash Sammich. Match it with Maria Sangriento and your morning just got a whole lot better. 

As for the rest of the menu....? Ya mean they get other things, too?!
author: S L.

description:
I have one of those creeper hangovers.  A few hours ago I thought I might excape yesterday's mayhem undamaged.  Now I'm pretty sure this will not be the case.  Lent ended with an exclamation point.

The Giant's got swept, which is a drag, but they let game three go on what seemed the most beautiful day yet this year.  The sun came out for good while I was waiting to order breakfast at Red's.  Pancakes, bacon and eggs on a paper plate with a side of chili.  Washed down with a couple of very tasty Bloodys.

I start every day game at Red's.  And many, with yesterday as no exception, finish there.  Out back under the little tent, at the bar.  Red's is an institution.  The food will give you a solid foundation for cheering the team, the camraderie will send you to the park with a smile, the hospitality will bring you back for a daycap, irrespective how the game turned out.

Lent is over.  I have a headache.
author: Markus N.

description:
Place is ok.    I had somehow overhyped it in my mind (i guess it was the tony bordain thing).   I got a chili burger.  I'm not a huge sourdough fan, so the choice of the sourdough bun didn't resonate with me, additionally, the chili was very heavy on beans.  Onion rings were ok.

Very good value for the money.  I'd bet breakfast would be good here.
author: Michael E.

description:
The food here isn't much to talk about. It's just some burgers with cheese on some sourdough bread with onions and pickles. They don't serve lettuce or tomatoes here. You could add chili to your burger but there isn't anything special about that either. It's a great spot to grab a beer though. 

Take a walk to the Ferry Building to Gott's Roadside for a better burger, but if you just want to grab a brew and chill then stop into Red's.
author: Joe N.

description: Perfect spot before the game. Get a cold bottle of bud and grab a burger on amazing sourdough bread.
author: Noah D.

description:
One comes to Red's not for the fabulous food, but for hangover dive bar food in a beautiful waterfront joggers-going-by setting.

The food costs more than it ought to, but the building, the staff, and the food are all interesting and worth a visit. Perhaps not two visits, but at least the one visit. On a sunny day. With friends.

Food: **
Ambiance: ****
author: Michael S.

description: They raised their prices, but great cheeseburger for just 5.95 on a great French roll with Pickles.  on the other hand , the hot dog is kind of a rip off at 5.95. breakfast is not too good either for 10 bucks but easy parking and a hamburger and french fries are great. I like this place
author: Eric H.

description: Add $4 for every item for the menu shown. The food was good for a quick bite before the game. The price difference compared to what's shown on the help menu was the only thing I could say bad about this place. It was the first time eating here. I would return. Quick and convenient!!
author: Dave C.

description: We REALLY wanted to love Red's Java House, and show our support for local businesses.  While we love the setting, location and most of all the people, the food versus price makes it very difficult to give Red's a higher rating.  Sadly, it's mediocre at best.  Too bad really since it's a fun venue with jazz music playing, but those prices are a tad too high for my pocket.
author: Joel M.

description: Great double cheeseburger. Like the twist with the sour dough bread. Cheese fries were good too.
author: Greg L.

description:
Never really considered dining here, with so many food options around. But working (and eating lunch) around South Beach gets pricey so I found reasonable prices from their menu online and decided to try it out, with Red's being on my usual jogging route anyway. I came in and ordered fish and chips. Subbed the fries for garlic fries... came out to $14.96, even though prices are different online. Decent price and the food was what I expected. 

Would've given five stars if the cashier answered me directly when I had a question instead of talking and laughing with the line cook. i've worked in food services and in customer service and it was kind of rude.
author: Frances T.

description: Want to eat a yummy, sloppy burger on sourdough? Here's your spot! I mean "Sloppy" in a good way! The double cheeseburger was made fresh and so, so satisfying! My husband and I are on their patio overlooking the Oakland Bay bridge. Beautiful view! Red's java house is a little place full of character and yummy smells! Totally stopping by again!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
sunday run and brunch...only two miles down to red's java house...the sun bright and calling...word of good corned beef & hash...rejected!...all out of corned beef & hash...over the counter order...breakfast special with pancakes, eggs and bacon requested....coffee please....second, scrambled eggs with salsa and tortilla...potatoes plenty...self serve coffee canisters...refills fine...taking out to the patio back...feeling guilty of gluttony after such a short run...pancake fluffy and standard...drizzle of syrup and tasting fine...bacon thick and charred crisp...eggs over-easy as requested...potatoes inch cubed and crispy...dip in ketchup and good...tortilla griddled toasty...good wrap for salsa and scrambled eggs....two breakfast meals to share amongst three and three coffee cups roughly $twenty-two total...enjoying san francisco sun, bay bridge and water views...city mornings...

saturday breakfast and finding corned beef & hash gratification...shredded moist fresh corned beef quite delicious...great taste and texture...breakfast quite large, but the sandwich version just as good in smaller portion and cheaper pricing...
author: Hen A.

description:
I keep saying to out-of-town friends just how beautiful San Francisco is. How cultured. How diverse. How exciting. How pioneering. How cosmopolitan. How laissez faire. But I have never described San Francisco as "down-to-earth." I may now have to hang my head in embarrassment. Thank you for that, Red's Java House! 

This place is divey, and I don't mean that as an epithet. I say that with something akin to awe. Nowhere else in the Embarcadero Waterfront have I been to that is like Red's Java House. The menu is simple: burgers, fish-and-chips, tuna salad sandwich, and none of the fancy gourmet dishes San Francisco is known for (they do have veggie burgers, though, so yeah, they still give nod to SF's health nut side). 

My lunch companion and I ordered fish-and-chips and decided to just share since neither of us were truly hungry yet. Did we get disapproving looks or raised eyebrows? Nope, the staff were as cool and pleasant as could be. The fish-and-chips was $9 and it was more than plenty for us (we didn't even finish the chips!). It may not be the best fish-and-chips I have had in San Francisco, but it was quite good.

Since it was a glorious San Francisco day, we chose to situate ourselves in their outdoor seating area. The spectacular view of the Bay Bridge whilst watching the birds very closely to make sure they don't snatch our food kept the smiles on our faces. On the other side is a parking lot with nothing of interest to note of. There were business people in their spiffy attire, tourists with their huge cameras, hipsters with their fabulous tattoos, a family with a toddler, and goths with their dark clothing dining there as well. 

At that very moment, I couldn't help but think: How very San Francisco! San Francisco where the beautiful and the gritty, and all sorts of people coexist -- in a little, down-to-earth dive smack dab in the center of the West Coast's Wall Street. Thank you for that SF moment, Red!
author: Clarice O.

description:
Today I had a half-fantastic fish & chips at Red's. Fantastic: the fish. Not good at all: the fries. Bummer! 

Probably my waistline is better off as a result, I just couldn't eat those fries but ooh la la did I say the fish was delish? You betcha. The companion stuffed a double cheeseburger down his gullet and seemed quite content. 

Another negative is the plethora of pigeons and seagulls hovering, just WAITING for you to turn your head so they can snatch some of your meal. Yeah, I know that's a stupid thing to complain about. You can always eat inside. 

Red's is such a slice of SF history I hope it never ever goes away. Charming as all getout.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Iconic fixture along the waterfront, just under the Bridge? check

Chock full of history? check

Seal of approval from that fiesty, oft-irreverent Bourdain? check

Flavorful fish and chips on a Friday? there was not. Great portion for the price (in the neighborhood of 8 oz), but absolutely NO SEASONING on a piece of cod at all--still shocked by that--- and fries that were woefully underfried and colorless and soggy....

I don't think so. Only one other customer in the house at the time... WAAHHHT?!
author: Jana C.

description: The only reason I gave this place two stars is the location and its history. The food and the staff on the other hand should be history. The burger and the meatball sandwich at $9.00 each is the size of a dollar value burger from McDonald's. And the taste is worth only $1.00 if I'm a tourist from Chicago or New York I would laugh at the food and throw it in the bay. It's pathetic. The staff were all speaking Spanish, even when they knew you were waiting for them to take your orders. This place needs major work to be a place to hang out at.
author: Nicolas A.

description:
Uhmm, the only thing this place has going for it is the views of the bridge. 
Maybe the beer.

Skip the meals (especially breakfast) & the piss-like coffee.
author: Ranjani S.

description: This is supposedly a "forever" spot in SF, so we were really hungry and went to grab breakfast. Dingy and divey? Yes. Limited hangover food menu? Check. Ratio of price to food? Not worth it. Swarms of flies/gnats everywhere inside. Bar in the back is a separate transaction and situation. Drinks are nothing special. The best part is the seating in the back and the fact that you can chill there with your dog. Mediocre is the best word for it.
author: Zara S.

description:
*Rude's* Java House
Came to get a cup of coffee while cruising embarcadero. While I reviewed the menu board, my 5 year old son expressed that he needed to go to the restroom, so I had to help him find the restroom. The lone restroom was occupied and my son could not wait, so while the other patrons would have let him go first, I had to take more urgent action. I spied a portapotty and ushered him there. On our way back up front to get my coffee, I was accosted by the owner who felt compelled to tell me that the restroom was for customers only. SERIOUSLY?! Did he want my son to wait and pee on his carpet while I purchased my coffee first? Definitely flunks in the hospitality department. And really, does the portapotty take a lot of effort to clean?! F minus
author: Jane L.

description:
Pompous turds looking for fancy bat guano coffee -- please keep walking.

This is a legendary SF small business still in operation, and thank goodness, catering to decent people with simple tastes.

Enjoyed my breakfast of real shredded corned beef hash, eggs over easy, and sourdough toast.  The coffee was hot and did not taste like piss.  And that's good enough for me (full disclosure: a caffeine addict).

The amazing October weather, great company, and hella gorgeous view made for a memorable experience.  Nice staff, too.  

Thank you, Red's Java House.  I'll see you again some time.
author: S.H. V.

description:
I totally forgot that I had never reviewed this place! 

All of the negative reviews of this place are from probably from hipster, transplant, vegan kids who have no appreciation of what simple, delicious blue-collar and TIMELESS  food is like. 

No this isn't a Michelin starred place, there is no kale, quinoia or organic anything. What Red's Java House does have, is simple food, done with  San Franciscan tradition. 

This is a great place to sit down, have a beer, enjoy a burger (served on sourdough, of course), get some fish n chips and maybe go to a Giants game. 

In a city that is constantly changing (for better or for worse) it is comforting to know that some places stay true to their roots.
author: Alan T.

description: It was great to get away from the tourists to sit by the water and drink beer/eat burgers. I'm definitely going back.
author: Junica B.

description:
3.5 stars - their A-frame sign noting double cheeseburger and beer special lured us in to grab a bite before heading to the game.  It was a hot day and the line was quite long...almost gave up but hubby wanted to try.  As expected, the place like others in the surrounding area was packed with Giants fans inside and out.  

We had plenty time to study the menu on the wall and we decided on the combo: double cheeseburger w/ fries and Lagunitas IPA for $12.95.  It is a good deal and plenty food for the two of us.  Not sure why the line was so long because our order was ready right away.

We grabbed a table near the front door and enjoyed our meal.  They serve their burgers on a sourdough roll and it was actually quite good, better than we had expected.  The roll helped absorb all the juices from the burger and the chewiness added a nice texture.  The burger was juicy and greasy but very satisfying.  Fries were crispy and the bottle of IPA was cold.

Full bar in the back.
author: Gloria H.

description: Menu clearly says $9.53 for a hot dog and beer plus tax. They then proceed to charge me $12. I ask for it to be clarified and the receipt shows   $5.53 for the hot dog, $6 for the beer, plus 0.48 in tax.
author: Kurt N.

description: The food is pretty good for what is offered, it is sorta a greasy spoon after all, besides I like the old school take on a hamburger, cause  who needs lettuce and tomatoes anyways? It is all about the onion baby! I love the fact that they serve up cheap boxed wine out of red solo cups too and the beer is priced reasonably. The place itself has sorta a cool, low key, old timey vibe and a awesome outdoor sitting area. Plus, they have a parking lot for those of us who loath public transit.
author: Sabrina D.

description: Burgers are good for the price. They use sourdough bread. Fish and chips are delicious. Cheap drinks out on the wharf. Works for me!
author: Mark R.

description: Ordered a burger and fries but they wouldn't give me a cup of water. My friend who I was with asked for a cup of water and they gave him one but still wouldn't give me any water. I'm not sure if this was prejudice or what but I was actually sick with a cold and had a headache and actually needed the water. It's actually against CA Health Code to serve food at a restaurant and not have water available so I will be following up with the Health Dept regarding my experience today.
author: Quinn W.

description: I've never been more disgusted by a restaurant in my entire life. The food is mediocre and the service is beyond poor. They lack tack and I witnessed an outright hate crime in the facility. I watched what appeared to be a server or maybe the owner ask a patron if he "Was a f***ing faggot.." Never going back there ever again.
author: Samantha S.

description:
I did not have a good experience here. I think this was more because there aren't any healthy options, literally there's a sign that says "no lettuce, no tomato." I got the veggie burger and it was fried and I'm unsure if there were veggies in it, more like a fried potato between bread. 

I do think this is a good place to grab a drink before a Giant's game, I'm just not a fan of the food.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
This restaurant looks like a little shack on the side of the pier but it's a hidden gem! I don't think they have the private lot anymore, unless it was just closed off because of the construction and America's cup that is going on. 

My boyfriend and I had a double cheeseburger meal and their daily special which was the corned beef hash burger. The double cheeseburger consists of two patties, cheese, onions, pickles, and mustard on a roll. The corned beef hash was the same except without cheese. I definitely enjoyed the corned beef hash more than the burger itself. They warn you that the burgers don't come with lettuce and tomatoes, which is probably why I wasn't super excited about the burger. The corned beef hash was really tender and definitely really filling! My boyfriend shared both burgers but only finished half of the corned beef hash burger. 

The outside seating is amazing, especially when it's sunny and not cloudy! We enjoyed our burgers under an umbrella next to the waters with a great view of the Bay Bridge!
author: Cathie N.

description: Great place to go for lunch!  It's an amazing classic and the cheeseburgers I've had on a sourdough roll are very good.  I always try to have lunch here when I'm in San Francisco.
author: David H.

description: Noticed on my VISA bill that the sleazy bar guy double charged me for my beer. BEWARE of this place!!
author: KC L.

description: Came here on a recommendation from a friend.  I had the breakfast, my friend had a burger.  Breakfast was on par with McDonald big breakfast. Burger was edible. Won't be coming back.
author: John G.

description:
Love this place's burgers and fish/chips. The fried clams are great too and outdoor patio in back is great, fun and there's live music at times. They do take cards: they took my visa. That was last year though so please check with them. If not, there's plenty of places around and a few bank buildings across from the Embarcadero.  

YUMMMMMM

also: Guy Fieri of Food Network reviewed it too and said how awesome it was. ;-)
Service was good too.
Enjoy!
author: Julie T.

description:
Over priced ....no lettuce or tomato.... Anthony Bourdain how dare you. 
I could make 25 mediocre burgers that beat this place. The view is ok if you don't mind being attacked by pigeons.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I used to live near Red's and frequented it often for breakfast. It's been awhile since I had been, but I went yesterday with some friends. We had just missed the window for breakfast which was disappointing because  there was no one else in there and it would have been good customer service to accommodate our group of seven. In any case, we had to order lunch from a menu that only offered a hamburger, a hotdog or fish and chips. Talk about limited! I went with the fish and chips, my son ordered a hamburger and my daughter ordered a hotdog. The fish and chips were recommended, but unfortunately there was more bread than fish and there was very little flavor. Even the tartar sauce didn't have much flavor. My son's burger looked like a frozen patty and the ratio of bread to burger was 2:1. Being a nine year old boy he can normally eat a burger, no problem, but he disliked it so much, he didn't even finish it. I took a bite myself and the burger was tasteless. Lastly, my daughter orders a hotdog, which she liked and was ironically the best item on the menu, but for $5, it was a total rip off! I would have left immediately after realizing that breakfast was over, but we were with friends and we were trying to make the best of the situation. I honestly think everyone was disappointed with their meal, but I am only speaking for my self when I say that I won't ever be back! I called and spoke with the manager and although I told him this was the worse meal I've ever had in San Francisco all he had was excuses and didn't offer any kind of reimbursement in return. Unfortunately it seems like this SF institution now hanging on by a thread and if they don't change the quality of their food and the prices I don't see Red's being around much longer.
author: Tonia B.

description:
If you are thinking on getting food here, don't, you'll regret it. 

It happens everytime.  They have this amazing back area out in the sun right on the waters, so its great to grab a beer and just sit out there watching the boats come through.  Though we always for some reason get food, and sure enough, give it 1-2 hours and you'll regret it like the last time you ate a whole bucket of KFC chicken by yourself. 

Come here for the drinks and views, just not the food.
author: Maggie F.

description: First time here and staff was extremely friendly! I ordered the veggie burger and it was delicious...:)
author: Karina P.

description:
As it is one of the coolest Embarcadero-area restaurants, I adore this place.  It is, at once, both beautiful, and gritty.

You have a sweet little spot on the water, with a semi-dirty view of the under-belly of the Bay Bridge.  This is a must-go spot for family and friends visiting me.  

The Bar:  Drinks are poured nice and strong and always with a smile.  There are always sports on the TV (as there should be), and on Giants game days, this place is nuts!

The Food:  Sourdough and dead cows...yum!  The Chili Burger absolutely kicks ass.  The Fish N Chips are another go-to here.  
I have had most of the menu, and it all turns me on.  

The brunch stuff is often gone by lunch time.  Get here early (ESPECIALLY on game days) if you want a certain dish or a particular spot out back.  

There are super-cool pictures all over the place, and they always have some random-as-Hell trivia question on the board behind the front counter.

Be prepared to fight off a Seagull or two for your fries.  The bastards are relentless!

I fell in love with this joint before I even moved to SF.  It just feels right. 
Eat some sloppy, delicious food with a stiff drink on the water!

I did, in fact, leave my home in Georgia (seriously) and headed for the Frisco Bay.  If I am to sit by the dock of the bay and waste time...it will likely be here.
author: Evan M.

description: Red's is an SF institution. Awesome burgers on real sourdough bread, great patio to relax and eat on and a bar out back for ice cold beers served by awesome bartenders. Just watch the seagulls if you leave your food unattended on a patio table for any length of time, they can be known to lay claim just a bit early sometimes. Cheers!
author: Armand C.

description:
I just moved to the neighborhood and wanted to try out the local restaurants. I decided to go there for breakfast one morning with my boyfriend. The location itself deserves one star because it's on the water and kind of away from the touristy things. However, once inside, the decor was just awful. There was no old charm like some places have. It just looked old like no one cared about any upkeep.
