Burgers are just oaky - too much bun for the meat. But order double burger with bacon and it's quite good. Fries are oaky. Onion rings are better.

Overall, I really like this place -- more for the atmosphere than the food. And it's a San Francisco classic!!!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Nice views, nice to sit outside, decent service and decent food. The line moves fast. 

The burgers are unique in that they're on sourdough bread, but I feel like in this case that involves an awfully lot of ripping and vigorous chewing for a relatively run of the mill burger. Fries aren't anything spectacular either. But still red's is good enough that I'd go again.
author: Allison M.

description: We went here today, because my husband remembered how awesome it was several years ago when he used to work in SF.  The guy behind the counter was rude, and completely disinterested in helping customers.  We ordered a cheeseburger, a tuna sandwich and one order of fries...it was $16!  The cheeseburger was cold, dried out, drowned in mustard and pickles (and I love mustard and pickles) and tasted like it had been sitting on the grill for a while...just waiting.  Ditto on the fries...cold, stale, seemed like they sat under a lukewarming light for a couple of hours.  We ordered a couple of beers, my husband had a can, and I ordered a draft.  $5 for a very small (would be a kid's drink size at any other restaurant) throwaway plastic cup of lukewarm beer.  I would never go back here again, and highly recommend you find another burger place in the area.
author: Sandra B.

description: This was divine.  I got heuvos rancheros on a morning before preparing to explore the city on foot, and I do not think I've had a similarly satisfying breakfast since.  It was all very simple, of course...runny egg yolk, spicy chili, ample tortillas to sop it up, but you can't beat it.
author: Dennis R.

description:
Popped in here on a super rainy Sunday for lunch a week ago and finally had a chance to try their fish and chips with an Anchor Steam beer.  It was really good!  Way better than expected and the price was very reasonable too.

Coming on a day with such horribly bad weather, I thought we would be the only ones there, but wow, was I wrong!  It was crowded in there and for most of the meal, there was a childrens birthday party going on.  Yow, screaming infant syndrome!!!  Highly unusual for here, but regardless, I enjoyed my food and drink.  There's a lot to be said for this place.  I'm upping it a star!
author: Roy N.

description:
The staff is always so damn friendly, I love that. I've been coming here for years when I'm craving black coffee and something greasy (I've nursed many a hangover here). I generally sit inside in the run down, but charming interior, but they also have an outdoor patio/beer garden. You'd think a patio literally on top of the water would be a beautiful spot, but it's not. You pretty much see asphalt as far as the eye can see...

Ah well, it's still a fun hole-in-the-wall spot for occasional unhealthy food fun.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Dropped by again on Friday to grab a quick bite before heading to the east bay.  Had the double cheeseburger and once again, not the best burger, but very satisfying and under $5 before tax.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Nice, casual place to sit by the bay in the sun. If the fish & chips special is available the day you visit, be sure to order that. I usually never order fish & chips because I find that the fish is always so dry but I tried some of my friend's and it was soooo juicy! 

I ordered the tuna sandwich and I wish I hadn't. I was actually just going to order myself fish & chips but luckily, my friend couldn't finish his so I ate the rest. My other friends ordered the burgers but they were all having a lot of difficulty biting off the bread. They used some kind of sourdough bread which made it difficult for all my friends to eat it. 

Really awesome place to just sit and have a beer with friends so I'd def recommend it as a place to check out if you're in the city.
author: Yunah R.

description:
Dear Red's Java House,

 I wanted to love you SO much. I've driven by you a thousand times, seen you on Anthony Bourdain's show, and LOVE greasy-spoon/hole in the wall restaurants. Where did we go wrong? I overlooked when the guy taking orders was a little bit of a smart-a$$ to my gf (she wanted a meatball sandwich, and he said "come back on Wednesday when it's actually our special" quite rudely (a simple "we don't have that today, sorry" would of sufficed). I overlooked the pigeons walking around INSIDE the restaurant (and around the food service area), I even wanted to overlook the mediocre portions (my friends breakfast plate only had ONE pancake). At a certain point I decided to stop convincing myself this place was everything I wanted it to be and looked at the facts:

*Paper plates and plastic silverware (I understand to-go, but for dine in as well? breakfast foods definitely suffer from being presented this way)
*No tomatoes or lettuce offered for burgers (I thought this was America)
*Small portions (pretty much all me and my friends were still hungry afterwards)
*Pigeons, outside is cool, but inside the restaurant too? one flew over our table and almost hit my friend waiting in line for the bathroom.

And lastly my biggest disappointment: the food.  When it comes down to it and you think about the money you shelled out, while definitely not expensive, the food does not stand up to expectations. I love divey places (see my review of Butter) but the bottom line is that the food did just not cut it here. I came with 7 hungover friends and all we wanted was some solid greasy breakfast (hard to mess up right?). I ordered the "2 eggs and chili" expecting something huevos rancheros-esque, when in reality it is exactly what the description says "two eggs and chili", basically a cooked tortilla (not fried or done up in any tasty way) with a bunch of chili (I suspect from a can) with two eggs and a dab of salsa on top. I asked for my eggs "slightly runny" what they gave me was barely cooked (I could still see a lot of clear fluid from the egg not being cooked thoroughly). My girlfriend got the chili burger with similar "not slightly impressed" reaction to it. Along with my friends small and unsatisfying breakfast plates, I don't think I could ever recommend this place as someplace to go for breakfast.

For the price, you are better off going to Delancey Street Restaurant a block down (or even a Denny's for that matter) OR stay at home and cook yourself (we didn't taste anything that we couldn't of made at home when we were half asleep). Sure, the place has great character, and I can see possibly coming here for mediocre fish and chips and a beer after a game, but aside from that I dont think I can see myself coming back any time soon.
author: Mathew C.

description:
L a r g e  please.

A medium.  A medium white cup is placed before me.  In Starbuck's lingo, the size Grande.

"What's this?" I query to the unassuming order taker at the counter.  

"That's your coffee cup." he shrugs.

"This is your large?!" I ask, incredulous.

"I know.  Everyone says the same thing." he smiles.

"Wow, I guess I need to bring a thermos with me next time," I reply, laughing.

Red's is right across from my work and usually, I rarely rarely make a pit stop here because usually I'm in such a rush to make the meager seconds given to me to run across the Embarcadero to the other side (try it in heels and in 12 seconds) but when I am simply craving the wondrous jolt of energy lifts my eyelids in a miracle blepharoplasty, I've made several stops here.

Not only do you get a cup, you get to serve yourself from one of those push coffee jugs.  

But what I do see here, are locals and working people who need the hearty grease-laden works of gut stamping effects....I've heard the breakfast sandwiches are pretty good here.  And the plates are mounded with eggs and hash browns.

In addition to seating inside, they do offer outside seating and when the Giants are playing at home, this place is packed with people catching a good encouraging moments of peace and food before hitting the bedlam at AT&T park.
author: Miika M.

description:
I'm getting hungry just writing this review.
We love Red's burgers. We go at least once a week. Sometimes I don't have a lot of time between classes so I run to Red's for some awesome Take-out! The guys there are fast and they always remember me, my mom, and grams. But they are especially fond of our Basset Hound Maggie! 
It's obviously a hole in the wall but the food is great and we love to take Maggie out on the back deck and eat. I love the hamburgers, fries and chili fries but Maggie is a huge fan of it all.
xoxo
The Carter Girls
author: Carter G.

description:
It's actually great for a late lunch or happy hour. It's a small building located on the Embarcadero and they serve pitches of beer AND fried greasy goodness. My friend got the meatball sub, while I went with the fish and chips. His meatballs were way bigger than the bread, which don't get me wrong, awesome and great, but a huge mess to eat and clean too. I got 2 big things of fish in my basket and could hardly finish it with the fries. We sat outside and watched the bay while enjoying our food and a pitcher of coors light.

They were playing the game in the tent where the bar is, so we could hear the game too. This place is great since it's so close to where I live!! A pitcher is $15 here.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Food: Good.  Ask for no mustard on the hamburger.  

Service: Amusing if not subservient

Cleanliness: Well, the health department gives Shawn 100%  

Ambiance: When my book comes out, I'll let y'all know.  Let's just say, the quirky old San Francisco isn't dead, but most of them still eat at Reds.  

If you don't get it, go somewhere else.  The rest of us don't want you there.
author: Polly P.

description:
Best Place for Drinks prior to a Giants baseball game !!  I prefer sticking to the burgers and fries, and of course the bar.  .. 

It looks like they are putting our *drinks dollars* to work as I see they have made some upgrades since last Giants season.  (I don't quite like the port-O-let that sits right out in the patio area where people are standing around drinking and eating.  Its a real turn-off to see the door come flying open as the stench from it comes out.  The line for drinks at times becomes very long and often you are left standing right next to the port-O-let.  (ponders lessening my star count because of shitter in the drinking area) .. 

I will minus 1 star because of the state of the kitchen and how it looked when i captured a pic.  I will add it to my pics for your zooming pleasures.
author: Roco j.

description: Love Reds!! It's a staple for us every time we come into the city. Food is amazing and servers are friendly!
author: Angie C.

description:
Stopped in on Sunday January 8th, 2012. Great spot! Fantastic View of the Bay with tons of seagulls around.

Overall a veggie burger with cheese on that tasty sturdy roll for $4 is a steal! Beverages choices included PBR and Rolling Rock are $2 per can and a soda is roughly $2 as well. Bags of Chips is a $1. Love coming in - sitting on the patio and enjoying the view on a lazy afternoon.
author: Brian D.

description: Greasy burgers and fries and beer pitchers on the back patio in the sunshine? Sounds perfect to me! Not for everyday consumption but definitely a spot to check out if you're in SF.
author: Lisa T.

description: Food was not done. Guess what i got? A hot dog. Which had been soaking for god knows how long. I spit the food out and ask for my cash back.
author: Rico J.

description:
Pigeons are out of control here!  They attack you and your food like a Hitchcock movie scene.

Located next to Bay Bridge next to the water, this shack restaurant provides a wonderful atmosphere to enjoy a cheese burger and some beer.  If the weather is nice, it's a nice place to bring a out of town guest.  
PROS:  Free parking next to the restaurant.  Cheap place to sit outside on a nice day and enjoy a nice cup of beer while soaking in the view. 
CONS:  This hole-in-a-wall with cool retro atmosphere entices me to give a higher rating, but I cannot betray my taste buds.  Come on now, close your eyes and tell me if the burger is really any good.
author: トモ T.

description: 5 stars is an appropriate rating system considering I have 10 fingers and would cut 5 fingers off for a red breakfast sandwich and Bloody Mary... and if you asked me how id rate it in fingers I'd give it 5 fingers (sans my 5 missing fingers). Lived in SF 4 years and this was like my urgent care for Sunday morning hangovers (please tell kaiser they're a-holes for declining my brunch bills).
author: Matt M.

description:
I'm obsessed with Red's! I've been traveling across the country and up the California coast for the summer, and I love meeting new people as I eat my way through the US. The service at Red's is incredible. The staff is so sweet and fun, and willing to talk with you or help you find your way around the city. They even came out in the back bar to watch the World Cup with us.
The food is something else! No tomato and lettuce means that you just get really great cheese, meat, onions, and the most amazing brioche bun in the world. When they say garlic fries, they're serious! These things are drenched in strong minced garlic; great with ketchup, bad for a first date. 
Their breakfast is on point as well. Try the pancake or breakfast plates if you want a little bit of everything: meat, eggs, hasbrowns, toast, pancake. The coffee is average, but that's made up for by the view out back. The covered bar, open patio, and view of the bay and the bridge are all you could ask for.
author: Olivia K.

description:
More like 3 1/2 stars, but I'll leave some room for a future upgrade. Great fish and chips. Really crisp and tasty. Loved the chips as they were thin and perfectly crisp. I came back for a burger a few days later, it was good, but I was expecting the sourdough roll and it was on a hamburger bun. I'm not sure what's up with that. I should've asked. They're open until 6:00 now, I hear (from the previous 3:00 PM closing time).
Great patio area. The open air bar is frequented by seagulls and sports a nice TV for your sports-viewing pleasure. Oh, and $1.75 PBR's? Yes, please!
author: T Shane G.

description:
I dare you to find a better Giants pregame spot! 

Went there last night and had a burger and fries for under 7 bucks, then bought a few 3.75 beers! 

With parking right next door, it is a great place for pregaming. The burger is tasty, as are the fries, although I do not agree with Anthony Bourdain on this one, I didn't find their chili fries all that - kind of overly fancy chili for such a thing - but still a great eatery. 

To "the only opinion" - I don't think you've been there! they Do NOT serve tomato and lettuce on their burgers, so it seems to me you have a fake post merely to hate on this establishment! FOR SHAME! Can Yelp do something about this?
author: Sam A.

description:
Red's Java House is a living and breathing San Francisco museum. They have pictures and articles that document important events and dates in San Francisco's history plastered all over their walls. 

Sometimes it's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Financial District. It gets stuffy and too bougie at times. So it's nice to have a place like Red's where you can take a step back into the past, to a much simpler time.

Red's is conveniently located right next to Pier 30, with the calming Bay as it's main backdrop. You can choose to sit inside or sit outside depending on the weather and your mood. There is definitely something soothing about eating food next to the sight and sound of crashing waves. If you sit inside, you will notice pigeons will fly in sometimes, which is both endearing and disgusting.

The food here can be described as comfort food; good ol' extra greasy comfort food. They have daily specials written on the wall plus every day regular items (like your classic cheeseburger or fish and chips). The burgers are thick and juicy and the fish and chips are hearty. The prices are just right. The combo deal of a cheeseburger, fries and a soda runs you about $7 or $8, can't beat that. 

The food here isn't the greatest (but also not the worse), but you don't come here to enjoy a transcendental foodie high. You come here to get away from the hectic work and city life. You come here to take a few generational steps back in time to an easier and Blackberry free life.
author: Allan Y.

description:
Pretty divey place.  Not so great on a hot day as the back patio can get an icky smell and of course there are lots of pigeons/seagulls hanging around.

Burgers are cheap $3 or so for a cheeseburger but you get what you pay for.  Bun is good but patty is paltry.  In and Out is much better for the money.

However, the fish and chips were pretty good.  Just like I expect fried fish to be - nice and meaty with just enough breading, not soggy, not bland.  I would have preferred the chips to be proper chippies instead of skinny fries (skinny fries don't hold up well to vinegar).
author: Jean K.

description:
OK...lets put this in perspective,  the hamburger was ok, on sour dough bread was great, with  Anchor Steam beer was greater, and the view was the greatest.  
all for eight bucks.  I paid nine bucks for a lousy 12 oz draft beer at AT&T park a few blocks away!
author: S K.

description: I came here expecting a lot. Anthony Bourdain even came here for his show, "No Reservations". The cheese burgers are nothing special but the fries were good. I recommend coming here to hang out in the back patio to have a pitcher of beer and enjoy a day before or after a Giants game.
author: Justin L.

description: The standout was the crispy bread they served their burgers on.  the burger itself was decent, the mustard was not too overpowering (I was scared because they put so much on it).  They have a nice patio in the back where you can sit outside right next to the ocean.
author: Mary V.

description:
Saw Red's on Anthony Bourdain show "No Reservations" and was so excited.  I got the double cheeseburger and fries and wasn't impressed.  I like the fries but I wasn't a fan of the burger.  I hated that it was on a sourdough bun because It just made it really difficult to bite and chew.  If they gave me another option for a bun then I would have really enjoyed Red's.  But they don't...

The plus side to Red's is that it's in a really cool location where you can just hang out with your friends and grab a drink.  It can be cold at times so dress accordingly!  =o)
author: Katie T.

description:
Be vigilant. Keep your burger close and your fries closer. The pigeons at Red's are for real. They are brash and dirty and if you stay long enough they will win. 

If you don't mind bobbing and weaving whilst you eat your lunch, and are not put off by the prospect of having pigeons climbing OUT of the trashcan as you put your trash IN, then Red's is the place to be--particularly the back "patio." I recommend showing up early on a Saturday to take advantage of all-day happy hour and heading over to Hi-Dive for your sunset nightcap. If you can keep it going after that, more power to you.

Fellas, I also must recommend getting the double cheeseburger as the patties are about McDonald's size. Now you may be thinking that takes away from the place, but a quick perusal of my reviews reveals my impossibly high rating of Micky D's, so it's more like a compliment, really. If you get a single you may not even be able to taste the meat due to the bun to mustard to patty ratio, which is 5:8:1. Double it up and add pint of Sierra--you're good to go. And remember, you'll work off the calories fighting for your life if you eat in the back.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
Hit Red's for lunch today. The weather was beautiful and we wanted to sit outside.

Got the double cheeseburger/fries/soda combo and it was meh. Much better burgers in the nearby area for about the same price. Brickhouse Cafe, for example.

Sitting outside was nice, but there was a funk in the air from something stinky.

Overall it was ok I guess, but there are better spots for eating outside.
author: Jack S.

description:
This is my absolute favorite breakfast place in SF.

Moreover, I have brought all my friends here and have yet to find anyone who doesn't love it.  The prices are impossibly cheap, and the food is awesome.

I think the eggs and chili rancheros or corned beef hash are the two best breakfast offerings.

There's a bar in the back, go for the Bloody Mary to round out the ultimate hungover breakfast, and thank me later.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Say you farted in your room, or living area, and you were like, "Damn, it really smells up in here, I think I need to leave this room temporarily and get some food instead of bathing in my own fecal smell."

This didn't happen to me, it happened to a friend I know....and he called me up and said "hey, let us go to Red's Java House." I said 'Totally!'

So I like to go to Red's Java house before Giants home games. There's something refreshing about going to this joint during this time. It's also a nice place to grab some quick grub on a weekend morning. A meal here always hits the spot. I've been coming here for a bit, but the popularity went higher when Anthony Bourdain reviewed the place as part of his show, No Reservation. 

I usually order the Double Cheeseburger with Anchor Steam. The combination of the bitter beer taste of Anchor goes well with the Sourdough double meat patty and cheese. You don't get lettuce with your order, strange, I know, but you get everything else. Tomatoes, pickles, mustard, ketchup, onions. I've had their fish & chips on a different occasion and this is great as well. Thick and battery. You'd enjoy either one. The menu is simple, and the guys behind the counters can be real characters. Red usually pops in to check on how things are going in the morning. Chill guy. It doesn't seem like it because it's hanging off of the pier along Embarcadero, but this place is a perfect 100 in terms of the restaurant green card.
author: Michael C.

description:
This is a great place for lunch (better on a day with clear skies...you can sit outside). The burgers are inexpensive and tasty. The locatino is filled with history.

Great place to sit, eat a burger and talk with friends.
author: Frank T.

description: Iconic SF spot to visit! Burgers on sour-dough rolls. Eat out back on the water. Fun! Totally casual, somewhat disorganized but a classic!
author: Linnet T.

description: Fantastic double cheeseburger and hella good fries. The flavor of the meat was really good and it seemed like the fries were cooked in fresh oil. The place is a dive but it's long since proven it's right to be a destination in San Francisco. They also had Lagunitas which is always a plus for me.
author: Michael F.

description: When you go up to the menu board to order your food and the first sign you notice is a sign that says "No Lettuce or Tomato", you know you can just drop all pretense of being able to eat a balanced meal here.  We came here for a late lunch yesterday and I got a hot dog and fries combo.  My partner ordered fish and chips.  Everything tasted fine, the place is very bare-bones and retro, the view is calming and, on a warm day like yesterday, just what the doctor ordered.
author: Yvette F.

description: Been coming here since I was little, if your in the area it's a perfect place to grab a burger and a beer! Great prices, reminds me of home great pre giants game spot as well patio can get crackin
author: Jill F.

description:
Great little place. AMAZING VIEWS! Went for a hangover lunch and it was perfect. Double cheese burgers, a beer and some sunshine while watching a homeless man do Thai Chi on the pier. Too funny.

A bit of a line at first, perpare for a wait depending on the time of day. Seating is first come first served, but there's plenty. Especially if its sunny and you can sit outside (highly recommended) and enjoy the view.
author: Anne H.

description: What a cool place!  Ordered chili cheeseburger and fries and my boyfriend ordered a cheeseburger and onion rings. The chili cheeseburger was huge, sloppy and so good. The burger "bun" is delicious, crispy sourdough. Fries were great, but the onion rings weren't crispy enough. Took our lunch and a couple of beers out back to patio to eat on the dock on a gorgeous sunny day. Hope to go back again before vacation ends!
author: Melissa L.

description: Unassuming but delivers. Walked in at 10am and was able to get a cheeseburger- not only is that awesome, but it tasted awesome as well. Definitely a hidden gem worth trying.
author: Briana C.

description:
I dig this place.
And I am definitely feeling those sourdough rolls they serve the burgers on. Much more civilized than a bun!
author: Lisa T.

description: Great fish and chips.  The counter guy acts cranky, however just give him a $1 tip in the jar and he brightens up nicely :-)  The only minor fault I have is that some pieces of the fish has too much coating so you get a thickly coated fried icelandic cod fish(according to the counter guy).  It was so good that I got 2 extra pieces of fish @2.75/piece.  Fish and chip and bud light, breakfast of champions. 555
author: Jim J.

description: Five star view, three star food....the double cheeseburger got the job done, but I'd come here again for the venue itself.  Very old school, right on the water, the kind of place that is unfortunately disappearing from San Francisco.
author: Jack K.

description:
This place makes the best breakfast... Ever! The breakfast plate comes with your style of (2) eggs, bacon and a massive pancake :) and it's only 6.95! Say what?!

My love and I come here almost every Friday morning for breakfast... It's a beautiful view and a great way to start the day.  If you are at all pretentious or super picky about your food, then this is not the place for you.  It's a no frills, no bull$?!t place with friendly, humorous staff!

I also love the chili cheese fries... But they are humongous, so you might wanna bring someone to share with!  Also, the cheese burger will melt in your mouth and the grease will run down your hands.... If you don't mind getting a little dirty while stuffing your face with some down home comfort food, then Red's is your stop!
author: Frenchie P.

description:
if you're going to salty Frisco
be sure to red some java when yore here

you won't find more authentic
longshoreman echoes linger

never mind the price jump
still a damn good value
author: Lloyd M.

description: I can see why Anthony Bourdain and native San Franciscans love Red's.  Simplicity, grease, and beer rule the Java House, a place where character is paramount to silly culinary hang ups like garnishes and diets.  This is food with attitude, where hamburgers are packed in sourdough pockets, cheese invades like aggressive dictators, and the cool Bay breeze reminds you that what you're experiencing is a city, just as much as it is a meal.
author: Michael D.

description:
Went there a lot during Grad School to unwind, have a cold beer and great bar food - and I still drop by when I can! This is great diner and a SF gem. Seating out back has good views on the water.
Everything I have had here has been great but be aware it is bar/diner food - counting calories will require a serious calculator so you might as well not ... 
Great spot before a Giant's game or just to hang out ...
Service is quick but don't expect to be pampered ...
author: Chris L.

description:
Best corned beef hash EVER (PERIOD).  That was a few years ago, I hope it's still good.

Clam chowder...clam shaouwdare?  Brilliant.  Simple yet delectable.

My personal favorite: Double bacon cheeseburger deluxe with jalapenos.  Watch out.  If the cook who makes your burger sees that you're white, he won't put enough jalapenos on your burger.  He won't think you can handle it.

TELL HIM YOU CAN HANDLE IT.

They use a sourdough loaf for the burger so you should order a double because a single is too little meat for the burger/bun ratio.

Best burger, fries and a beer deal in the city.
author: Josh L.

description:
Great before Giant's Games.
It's more like a hole in the wall but their crab and shrimp sandwich is HELLA GOOD! Small area to eat inside but I alwayd sit outside to enjoy to weather and view. No parking!
author: Priscilla S.

description: Great place, but the prices have more than doubled over the last 10 years. The hot dogs are infinitely better than the burgers, and anyone who tells you otherwise doesn't know what the hell they're talking about.
author: Doctor L.

description:
Bourdain brought my attention to this place at the end of his show in San Francisco and I'm glad he did.  This place is right on the bay and down the street from AT&T Park which works out well before going to a game.  Plus, it's reasonable prices helps you fill up and save money from otherwise buying food at the game.

The burgers are hearty so remember that a single will do the trick.  This is mostly because in true San Francisco style, these burgers are served on sourdough baguettes- very filling.  My husband mentioned that you almost need a double to go with all the bread.  If you order a double and eat the whole burger I think you would feel like going to bed rather than going to the game- or doing anything else at all!

Another nice feature of Red's is that you can order a beer with your burger.  We tried the local beer, Anchor Steam, but other regulars are available too.  if you're looking for your choice of booze there is also a full bar in back.

If I lived here I'd come again :)
author: Lauren G.

description:
Yup, Anthony Bourdain sent me.

My friend and I parked in the nearby pay-and-leave-the-receipt-in-your-dashboard lot only to realize a few designated free parking spaces were right behind the restaurant.

$5 wiser, we walked into what looked like an old dock office turned bar.

The place was packed with 90% guys, mostly just-rolled-out-of-bed locals. We were the youngest people here (that rarely happens anymore.) 

You know when you visit a restaurant for the first time, you'll look at the menu like it was one of those hidden 3-d puzzles and ask your friend for help minutes later? Well, here the choices are pretty basic and a decision could be made in 10 seconds. My only debate was if I wanted to get a beer with my early meal or not. 

After a short wait on line, I ordered the double chili cheese burger, fries, and a soda, for under $10. We took the food outside by the pier, lunching in the sun near the brave seagulls and a sweet view of the Bay Bridge.

The food looked like a messy piece of heaven. Looked like. I had to dip the fries into the excess chili and cheese, just to get a hold of the burger. The meat was lost in the chili and unfortunately the sourdough bread. It was pretty bland and if it wasn't for the laid-back ambiance and no-frills charm, it would be something that I couldn't really recommend - 2 stars.

But the cool view, no nonsense vibe, and the option for a cheap early brew by the San Fran pier bump this place up to the worth-trying but don't-go-out-of-your-way 3 stars level.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Hey, this place is a Java House.... don't go for the greasy food.  This is the best coffee house location in the entire city and you know it once you get there!  Fresh air!  Bay view!  Actually more than a bay view, you can fall into the bay if you're not careful.

This place deserves a five star rating for location alone.
author: H.A. ..

description:
This place is everything the Birkenstock wearing, vegetarian eating (yes I'm one too!), sustainable food movement crunchy munchy Bay Area is not-which makes it wonderful. Right on the water you get a seagull doo view of the bay with tables inside and out. Guy at the counter is straight forward and yet kind, and made fun of the yuppy couple who clearly is more accustomed to Chez Panisse than dives right to their face, while my boyfriend and I made fun of them behind their backs. 

Got the breakfast sandwich which was cheese and eggs (no meat for me) on a roll and it all tasted so good because it came from a 40 year old grill that has all the goodness of having meat and eggs grilled on it day after day. My bf got the pancake, eggs, and sausage. The pancake was delicious-not too sweet, the eggs were perfectly cooked (friend around the edges and gooey in the middle), and the sausage was perfectly round (probably frozen) patties. 

The coffee was weak and boring, exactly what you would expect and don't even bother asking for decaf. This place is great.
author: J E.

description:
I was eager to come here after seeing this on you-know-who's show; I'm a lemming like that. After reading yelp reviews, I dropped my expectations through the floor. Expectations met.

Pluses: Nice people. Nice location. Great view. Decor reminds me of diners back home (IL);  white, open, lots of framed pictures on the walls. Larger than it looks with outside seating. Cheap prices. Quick, at 1pm Thursday. Credit cards accepted.

But the food...I got the single burger and it tasted familiar. Ah yes, it's every mass-produced burger I ate in college from dining hall to free bbqs to frozen Costco ones I cooked on my Foreman grill. I thought people were being jerks when they compared it to McDonald's. Um, count me as a jerk; I agree. It can come with chopped white onions and mustard, on a slab of chewy (not in a good way) sourdough baguette. More bread than meat. No tomatoes or lettuce. (Fine with me since I happened to have sliced tomatoes that needed eating.)

I guess if you like cheap beer with an amazing view, this is the place to go. But I don't drink. If you're spoiled like me and enjoy meaty $10 burgers, this is so not your place. I still want to come back (hopefully they don't read yelp) and try their other food. It's cheap, it's locally owned, how could I not support that?
author: Yan E.

description: For ambience, character, and so forth - 100 out of 100.  Nice little location on a pier.  Over the years many famous patrons, including my favorite Anthony Bourdain.  Great bar serving nice Margaritas and beer.  Great place to hang out.  Food is old fashioned fare such as hot dogs, burgers, and fish- and very tasty.  Not for the calorie conscious though.  A must see if you are here to visit or newcomer to the city.
author: Mark P.

description: Bourdain also brought me here so I mad e my husband come here with me too . I had a double cheeseburger with fries and a drink it was pretty yummy only ate half it was way too big for me . the place is a little dirty but it is a dive place the food was good the meat had no fat on it wich was great . the minute the placed opened a line grew out the door must be a local fave . also great view cant get much more for the price of this place as well .
author: Lori M.

description: Great place to stop before or after a Giants game. Love the breakfast sandwich before the game. The sunny deck is nice afterwards. Always good and reliable food. It's been a fun place to drop in on for the past several decades.
author: Rob C.

description: Quite possibly the worst food ever. Just left disgusting double cheeseburgers slathered in grease, making the buns wet doughballs with sides of cold fries. Mind you, the first bugers were raw, sent back, and these were cooked more, but disgusting. Huge disappointment because for years we've traveled the toll bridge and paid a lot for parking cuz the food was THE BEST. Never, ever again.
author: Evokative S.

description:
Went because Aonthony Bourdain recommeded it.
Large burger on sour dough bagette. Good flavors. On the bay.
author: Peter S.

description:
I love this place!  I can't believe I'm just now writing a review.  French bread cheeseburgers, chili cheese fries, ice cold beer, pancakes, tuna sandwiches, HEAVEN!

Outdoor seating perfect for beautiful SF weather, and dog owners!  

Also full bar open on weekends and Giants game days.  

Bottom Line, if you're on a diet, this isn't the place for you.  If you love burgers and beers, then this IS the place for you!
author: Eric D.

description:
Nice little shack that's been here for a while. Offers a great view of the bay bridge and free parking to make your visit much easier.

Their onion rings are bomb and they have anchor steam and other beer to complement their OK burgers on sourdough. Come here during the day though, because they close at 5, but can close earlier (430) depending on the owner. Finally made it out here, after a few failed attempts!
author: Chester A.

description:
I love me some Red's. It's one of the few establishments in the city that offers a decent Chicken Parm and cuts some good fries. The guys behind the counter have always been friendly and generous with the servings. 

The food is routinely good, though often a bit messy, and you get enough to get a serious case of the itis after lunch.

I usually come to get it to go on Thursday's. The walk up the Embarcadero is sunny and nothing beats taking in the sea air while they're filling your order. It's closer to fast food than anything else (like any old burger joint) but you get your money's worth both quantity and flavor wise.
author: Rajiv P.

description:
Good greasy burger on what I believe is a sourdough roll. Not something I could eat every day but definitely tasty. They have a combo which includes Anchor Steam which I will need to try. 

No lettuce or tomato served here which is kind of a downer but other than that it isn't bad.
author: Rich S.

description:
Eat here for the history, not for the cheeseburger

It was a rainy, miserable day in San Francisco. My friend and I were drinking coffee on Haight street trying to figure out where we should get lunch. He suggested a burger place that is always closed by 6pm. Onn we roll.

First impression from outside: it's a dive, which equals great in my book.
Second impression from looking at the menu: this is a no-nonsense burger place. There's practically a sign that says "fuck you if you like lettuce and tomato."

I order a cheeseburger, fries and coleslaw. The first letdown: skinny fries. Skinny fries be damned. The next letdown: seeing the meat to bread ratio. In the end, the bread, an excellent sourdough roll, overpowered the meat and left me with with just bread and pickle.
author: Dave R.

description:
It's dirty. They're rude. There is seagull poop everywhere on the patio.  

This is not fine dining, people.  But I always used to take people to Red's because it's just really special.  Right on the water, and the super cheap food is pretty good, for what it is.  But you're not going to get a fine meal, really.  It's the whole Embarcadero experience.  Don't miss it.
author: Amber S.

description: KEEP ON WALKING!  We stopped here to eat on the way from the Embarcadero BART to AT&T park. We weren't sure if there would be any more eateries before the park. This place was terrible and just as expensive as buying food in the park. I should have saved my money for the park, because the food there is better quality for sure. The burgers at the Java house do not come with lettuce or tomatoes.... only mustard, onions, and pickles. Patty is thin and dry. They use sourdough bread instead of a bun, which wouldn't have been terrible if it wasn't so stale. The chili for their chili cheese fries came straight from the can (not even warm), and the cheese was hardly melted. The fish and chips was the only decent looking item from their menu. Flies are everywhere in their establishment. I urge you to take your money elsewhere. Do not get fooled by the convenience and location to the baseball stadium. Just wait and use your money elsewhere. I would not eat here again. I hear their pitchers of beer are good and affordable, however the food certainly is bad.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Anthony Bourdain was here and this is the 2nd place that he went to in SF that I have been to.

I love how Tb surprises me with this lunch invitations and who would say no to burgers. I had a good walk coming here and back.

The burgers are okay nothing great, meatball sandwich was good, fries are real hot.

Its nice to eat and then have sometime after to sit and chitchat overlooking the bay, people watch and jjust chill for a minute with the Tb.

It was a good lunch.
author: Malou C.

description:
Go here for beer, bridge view, history, and location (5 stars). Do NOT, god help you, go here for the food (0 stars). Their onion rings do not have actual rings of onion, they are merely onion-flavored breading formed into ring-shapes. Foul. The fries were undercooked. The burger was nearly inedible.

And, could we get some bike parking? A dozen bike riders in the "patio" area and not a single rack? C'mon.

But the beer...the view...bliss.

p.s. Don't be a dimwit and leave your food unattended at your outdoor table. The pigeons will be on that faster than you can say "Shoo Ratbirds!" I pity the woman that unknowingly tucked into a burger her boyfriend left unattended. He didn't even tell her that a horde of pigeons had recently been picking at it. That's a relationship that won't last, probably because he'll eventually let her eat something even more poisonous than pigeon-picked food.
author: Lauren G.

description: Went back after a few years of not having me some Reds, the place looked more spacious and remodeled. Is it just me or did the prices go up too? Well had the double cheeseburger and onion rings..mmm..just as I remembered them to be YUM!
author: Karen T.

description:
An iconic hut along Embarcadero, this salt sprayed wood shack is a San Francisco mainstay for numerous reasons.

Their menu will lure your inner deep fried, gut bomb loving self out of hiding to devour some of their best classics. Fish and chips, double cheeseburgers, and enormous breakfast plates will remind you why you have a mouth. It isn't for speaking...

Rain or shine, Reds is a perfect place to start that lazy long weekend you've been dreaming about since Monday morning. A comfortable atmosphere, you can easily get lost in the paper, as you gaze out towards the looming Bay Bridge.

We had the pleasure of throwing a Holiday Party for friends here, and without a doubt, couldn't have chosen a better place to have it. 

Converting the entire back patio into a covered dance floor, friends were able to prove their love of alcohol and find comfortable homes for the diner favorites being dished out all night.

The staff here is incredible. Outgoing, a bit nuts, and just up for a good time. 

Reds, thanks for the good times. Trust me, I won't be a stranger.
author: Mike K.

description:
Red's is definitely a San Francisco institution worth seeing.  I live in the neighborhood, and have come here repeatedly for the greasy, down-to-earth American fare for a hangover cure.  

I've taken out-of-towners here to see what old San Francisco was like, along the Embarcadero, and they've all enjoyed the vibe/decor of the place.  With headlines like "JAPS Bomb Pearl Harbor" and such WWII references, pictures of what the area used to look like, pictures of the Golden Gate bridge under construction, etc., the experience alone is worth the trip.  

To the food - the food isn't spectacular, but it's definitely tasty for the traditional American grill items.  They have beer and burger combos with Anchor Steam for I believe ~$7.  

Red's is a great place to grab some hangover food along the water on a Saturday or Sunday morning.  Come support Red's and keep it alive!
author: Leo C.

description: This is a great dive bar/brunch joint. Quick service, the breakfast sandwich was delicious, and the coffee is pretty good. If you bring your dog, you can sit outside, no problem. Seems like a popular spot for game-goers, but we enjoyed it for just a casual, relaxing way to start our Sunday.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Red's is great!  Perfect spot for a sunny afternoon to sit on the back deck and drink $1.75 PBR's or pitchers of any of their on tap beers.  

Red's is definitely the opposite of fancy, more of a fun and simple dive, but you can't beat the price, and it really hits the spot.  Burgers are served on sourdough rolls (yum), and the onion rings are massive.  And, considering you just paid about $5 for that, not bad.  

Very friendly place, you can just pull up a bar seat and talk to the bartenders or other folks hanging out there.  Definitely a lot of regulars and a lot of people who live in the neighborhood who stop by.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Maybe I'm just crazy, but I wasn't as wild about Red's as everyone else.

We came before a Giants game for our co-workers. The idea is sweet, just casual, quick served laid back food on the wharf. I wasn't expecting anything fancy at all. I loves me sourdough burgers, but I really can't stand it when the meat is well cooked and lacking in any flavor. I wasn't too hungry and ordered a single, which meant too much bread. This may also have to do with the fact that I made delicious burgers with a chili vinagrette base the night before and wasn't really in for more burgers. They also closed down super early at 8pm and we didn't even get to finish our pitcher. Since this was our primary focus for going, I'm giving them a two for the food and for closing up shop. 

The prices are good and all, the beer selection decent for the price range. Just overall not really a huge fan, but I'll probably come back for breakfast and definitely beers before the game.
author: Alita M.

description:
I don't know much about Anthony Bourdain, but here's what I do know: he did a lot of coke, he wrote some books, he inspired a bad tv show called Kitchen Confidential, and he featured this place on his Travel Channel show.  Now that I've gone to Red's Java, I also know that Anthony Bourdain doesn't know good cheeseburgers.  

Red's Java has the location and the concept to be good, but the food was disappointing.  My cheeseburger came in a giant roll that overpowered the thin patty of meat.  The burger didn't come particularly hot either, but it did for some reason have a spattering of strangely cut onions. The chili cheese fries were ok, but definitely not for the faint of stomach with all the beans. The onion rings were really limp, but I will say that somehow their flavor was decent.  

At a cost of about $20 for just 2 cheeseburgers, chili cheese fries, and 2 cokes, it' not really worth going back here, especially for food that doesn't seem to come out warm, tasty, or crispy.  My friend summed up it best by saying that he got the same nasty feeling he gets after eating McDonald's, but without the McDonald's taste.
author: Kim S.

description:
Cool place for a juicy, fattening burger and a cold beer. Pretty much food that will feed anyone who is hungry... or big beefy guys that I saw sitting all around me (construction workers in this case). I don't know if it was really worth it to pay 11 bucks for the double cheeseburger with fries and beer combo, but I did come to the conclusion that I probably ordered a burger too big for me. It was really good though. Although if you are scared of condiments like I am, you might want to tell them to not put any mustard on the burger (they put this on it automatically, as well as onions and a pickle). I didn't know this, so I wasn't able to enjoy my burger like I usually would. 

Other than that, i'll probably go again.
author: Caroline L.

description: Love the fried egg sandwich and the ease of parking.  Best place to stop and grab a few beers before the giants games or a walk down the embarcadero.  My kids love this place, they can scream, spill, what ever and you just blend.  The only tip to the ownership is I think an extra bleaching on the tables and chairs each week would do the place well.
author: Sean D.

description: Two stars for really neat photography inside and very, very friendly staff. The food was not very good. I had to dig through two inches of chili sauce to find my dog and soggy bun. Eh.
author: Kirsten B.

description:
Not a big fan of the food...think super greasy spoon...but it's a great location...not just on the water but close enough for my LAZY friends in SOMA to make it over ;)

If you're looking to hangout on the water with a bucket of cheap beers this is one of the best places.
author: Jackie G.

description:
Yummy burgers...yummy fries...yummy onion rings...and yummy ranch

I wish they didn't run out of french bread for the burgers, but we came later in the day, so it was fine.
author: Nette P.

description: Perfect casual spot for a beer and a view. There is a photo of Anthony Bourdain on the wall (among other celebrity visitors) as he visits it in an episode of No Reservations. Good beer on tap with a decent price tag and an outdoor patio next to the AT&T stadium parking lot. Cheese fries are cheap and good too. Be open minded to birds hanging around and very drunk people stumbling out next door at The Dive.
author: Jessica V.

description: Greasy for sure, but the food isn't the draw. Sitting outside in this most excellent neighborhood with your dog, that's the draw. We enjoyed fried eggs, sausage and potatoes. No garlic, we asked, and no hot sauce. Still the breakfast was good, just not great. $20 for two, about as cheap a meal as you could eat in south beach. I would return on a sunny day, the view is as good as it gets here in san francisco.
author: Kelly K.

description:
I don't even know where to start, this place is an utter trainwreck.

So I came here yesterday for lunch with some co-workers for a change of pace from our usual spots, and knowing Red's had been featured on Anthony Bourdain before, I figured it would be pretty damn fantastic. Boy was I wrong. 

The menu is small and relatively simple, which I can dig. Cheeseburgers, hotdogs, chili-cheese fries, etc. Everything seems pretty easy and run of the mill, no weird stuff here, so how can you go wrong? Famous last words.

Well for some odd reason the people at Red's are opposed to the idea of lettuce and tomato on a burger, and they make it a point to have a sign saying that they don't have it. Are you kidding me? I thought we were in America? That's like ordering spaghetti and meatballs without the sauce or cheese. It just doesn't make sense to me. Is this place just so cheap that they can't afford fresh Lettuce and Tomatoes or do they REALLY not want me to have it? Well, I didn't notice the sign until after I ordered, and was greeted with a snickering "we don't have lettuce and tomato" as if I was some sort of moron for requesting such commonplace items.

So I order the burger regardless, and only have the options of mustard, onions and pickles to put on my burger. Mustard is not for me and I like my pickles to the side, so I opt for just onions. I get a side of fries and a water and sit down.

The fries came up immediately, and were decent. They were a little greasy like McDonalds, but I can't complain. Easily the best part of my meal.

Soon after that was the "burger", or lack there of. The first thing I noticed was that the burger was not on a bun, but on some sort of roll that you may get a sub or something on. It was so thick and doughy, it just DID NOT go with a burger. You need to have that light airiness, it's really essential to a good burger. It's all about the Brioche bun. 

The actual meat patty was downright awful. I come from a place where the burgers are thick, juicy, and cooked to my liking. I want that burger moo-ing at me, and this just wasn't doing it. Cooked Medium-well, this burger was just devoid of any juice or flavor at all, and was about the thickness of a McDonalds beef patty. The "bun" itself was double the thickness of the burger, and for lack of a better term it was like "throwing a hot dog down a hallway".

I wasn't expecting a gourmet medium rare burger, but I was expecting something that looked more appetizing than the Big Mac my dog wouldn't eat of the garbage.

Overall, I was just completely unsatisfied and I will NOT be coming back here, for anything, ever. My co-worker had the fish and chips, and though it tasted fine and was nice and crunchy, I don't want to take the risk and let this place steal anymore of my money. Good riddance Reds.

Thanks for letting me down Bourdain. Get it right next time.
author: Bradley D.

description:
Recommend 100% if you're looking for a three-star place, especially before a Giants game. 

It's not glamorous, the menu isn't healthy, and there's a port-o-potty  on the deck but it's right on the water with views of Oakland and the Bay Bridge and is reasonably priced.
author: Jen N.

description:
Forget Bistro Burger and the Rincon Food Court, too crowded.  Although rincon would be better if they didn't frown on jumping in the fountain.  But I digress....
It's a dock, by the bay.  The food is simple and filling.  Not the "healthiest" place, but now-a-days, it seems like nothing is really "good" for you any more.  Enjoy the fries, the specials and the 2.95 sandwiches.  Also a nice walk from Embarcadero center.  Bring a friend and enjoy some real conversation.  If the cops and the constructions workers are there every day it has to be good.  Pass it on....
author: Mike V.

description: Tried my first breakfast here today. I already knew the burgers were great. They know how to do pancakes, eggs, bacon, and coffee just right too. Nice atmosphere on the bay.
author: Crockett H.

description: It tastes like it died screaming... No trip to SF should end without a trip to this fav relic.  In this town of political correctness, a double cheeseburger and chili fries and beer is something to be cherished.  It's cheap, it's good, it's got a view, if u want it.
author: Jane L.

description: this place may be quite possibly my favorite place for fish and chips, yeah its that good.  i also like the bloody mary's which is heavy on the Worcestershire sauce and horseradish. very heavy pours, doubles unnecessary.
author: Wakako U.

description:
hmm. maybe we ordered the wrong things. 

after passing this place on my way down the embarcadero countless times and hearing it was featured on anthony bourdain's show, me and paul decided it was time to give the place a try. there's a huge parking lot in the front, and anyone who's been in downtown SF can truly appreciate the beauty of this. the menu is simple; burgers, fries, hot dogs, etc. everything is affordable, which is also a plus. paul got the double burger and i ordered the fish and chips [only a special on fridays]. our food came out quickly and we sat out in the back patio since it was a beautiful day. 

the fish and chips were actually very good--i like my fries thin and crispy like they are here. the fish was nice and crispy on the outside, but still moist on the inside. the burger, however, left a lot to be desired. the patty is really thin and dry, and it's served just with onions, pickles, and mustard. i know this is a traditional american burger or whatever,but i like my burgers with at least lettuce and tomato. there was really just no flavor, and it was especially dry when we tried to eat the leftovers later. 

it's a great spot to come visit on a nice day, so you can sit on the patio with a drank and enjoy the awesome view of the bridge and water. i've read that the breakfast is actually really good, but i don't think i would make the effort to come back here.
author: Angela L.

description: "Tastes like it died screaming!" mmmmmm
author: Yan L.

description:
Had a bad first experience because of the single bartender that was working on a Saturday around 6PM. 

A couple friends and I stopped by for a drink, the bartender questioned me and asked if I was drunk..I replied no, he gave me a drink. My friend got denied for being "stoned", bartender said, I'm the bartender it's my choice who I serve. I found it funny because my friend clearly is not a smoker..But we all got questioned for being drunk or stoned for no apparent reason at 6PM. He put more effort in questioning us, rather than serving us. 

Bartender who worked on 7/13 at 6PM, you can thank yourself for four of us not returning ever again.
author: Amanda T.

description:
I never went to Red's because of Bourdain.
I used to go to Red's because it's the cheapest place for breakfast at 5:30 in the morning.

Breakfast specialty was short stack of pancakes in collision mat style.
Never tried the hamburger.  From what others say about it, just as well.

As I left Red's one morning two dudes got  out of a taxi;  one of them had a Rollei on a strap around his neck.  He clicked it once and went inside.
Next time I went back to Red's, they had a supply of grey sweatshirts with a b/w picture of me in front of the restaurant and the Bay Bridge arching over.  
Of course I wore my beard, trenchcoat and wide brimmed hat -- very film noir.
But the price of the sweatshirt was out of my reach.  
So, how about a free breakfast?   No.
Well, then how about an extra collision mat on the house? No.

I have not been back to Red's.
author: Peter N.

description:
Anthony Bourdain, you either have a good friend who owns this place, you were blacked out when you picked it, or you are losing your touch/retirement is calling. We headed here after seeing Red's on No Reservations SF, and I left completely disappointed.

Their burgers make McDonalds look like Taylor's in the Ferry Building. I didn't want to finish the burger for fear of getting sick. I tried the onion rings, and I have had better ones bought from the frozen section at Luckys Supermarket. The fries were the one saving grace, and they were average at best.

I will say that Red's Java House has a charming, run-down shack atmosphere that made me really want to like this place. The outdoor patio was also a big plus, BUT the food was too shitty for me to ever enter its shack doors again. 

Sorry Red.
author: Jackie M.

description:
My boyfriend introduced us to this spot before a Giant's game. We drove right in where it says $25 parking. DON'T PAY!!! (you can find closer parking on the street for $5 an hour) There are free parking spots there. We felt like home with all the orange and black everywhere. When you walk in it's kinda like this is it? Yes flies were flying around and you are on a pier. But let me tell you that there Fish and chips were AWESOME!!!! First the fish was this golden big piece of fish all moist inside. And I'm not a fish eater. And the fries were yummy to. And did I forget to say it taste better with Malt vinegar. YUM
 If you go in the back there is a bar, perfect before a game. I ordered a Bloody Mary $6, and she was SPICY! but so flavorful. Otherwise yes they do have beer.
author: Shannon F.

description:
It's been a while since I came here, hence, the late review... 
I usually stop by here before I go to the KABOOM festivities or before I enter the AT&T park. It looks like a shack from the outside, actually it's a dive with history, the back has a awesome view of the bay bridge. The burgers here are decent, it's on a hard sourdough. 
I remember reading the menu on the wall last time I was there, it said ...Cheeseburger, fries and Budweiser - $6 
After reading that - you got me! 
But don't come here for the burgers. 
Like other reviewers said come here for the beer and the view.
author: Ed V.

description: The food is just ok, but when I used to work in the City, I used to come here at lunch time and order the double cheeseburger combo with fries and a Bud and watch the Bay, to me that's already a 3 star.  I still get the same relax feeling when I eat here.
author: Bob S.

description:
Saw this place from Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations San Francisco and decided to try it out. Great little place on the pier almost right under the Bay Bridge! 

Ordered a cheeseburger with chili cheese fries and sat out back with a view of the bridge. The burger was pretty good, but I would've liked it a lot more if there was a larger meat to bun ratio. Felt like the sourdough roll they use over powered everything inside and that's all I tasted. Chili cheese fries were okay.. nothing to get excited about. 

All in all this is a great place to grab a bite and have a few beers after or before a Giants game. I love the location and will be back again even though I wasn't too excited about the food, I would come back to enjoy a sourdough burger and beer with some friends on the pier. (did not mean for that to rhyme lol) 

Still need to come back to this place on a Sunday morning to try their corned beef hash! I heard it's amazing but you have to come early before they run out...
author: Mitch W.

description:
The seagull and I are in an epic staring contest.  This is about to become full fledged war.  The seagull advances slowly and cagily.

Jennie advantages: much, much bigger.  Has custody and control of the food (for right now).  Opposable thumbs.

Seagull advantages: can totally shit on my head.

So far, I have won this battle when I have come to Red's.  But I suspect there will be a day that I look away, entranced by the preternaturally attractive guy at the front counter, and a seagull swoops in to cart off my food.

The food is good and dirt cheap.  The atmosphere is pleasantly divey, as you would expect, seeing as it's situated on a bird-poo-covered pier.  You order at the counter, you take your own food out, and you will eat it... you will eat it and LIKE it.  (As everyone else says: don't expect lettuce and tomato on your burger - it's not going to happen.)

Sometimes when confronted with a good thing, you have to adjust your expectations.  You realize that the boy of your dreams is never going to remember to coordinate his colors properly.  You eat inside the building instead of outside.  You forgo the lettuce and tomato.  You yell at the seagulls and pigeons for attacking your personal bubble.  Whatever.

Worth it!
author: Jennie K.

description: Reds is the perfect spot to hit before the Game. Grab a bucket of beer, a burger and on a nice day, sit outside. You will appreciate the chill atmosphere, other fans and the $ you save not buying food and [as many] drinks at the park.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Upon our hotel concierge's suggestion, my beau and I ate a late breakfast at Red's Java House before the Giants game. We walked along Embarcadero for what seemed like forever until we reached this famous quaint shack on the water. According to a message on the menu, breakfast ends at 11; while the long line crept forward, my heart pounded like a flimsy pancake.

"I do NOT want to eat a cheeseburger," I informed my boyfriend, as a greasy meal would not sit well with me. At 11:03, we reached the counter.

"You still serving breakfast?" he inquired, knowing the answer would set the mood for the morning.

"Maybe," the staff member smiled.

"Good, that'll make her day," my beau sighed with relief, glancing toward me. We later learned Red's serves breakfast until 2 on the weekends. We both opted for the Pancake, Bacon and Egg Plate, a huge and cheap helping. A convoluted pile of sweet, crisp bacon made a mound at one edge of the plate, a mountain of scrambled eggs balancing it out on the other. The pizza-sized pancake came with plastic containers of butter and syrup, oozing into the eggs and bacon. 

The food was nothing special, although the pigeons would've been glad for a bite. A sign in the bar even warns patrons of the birds' aggression. 

As lunchtime approached, Giants fans flooded the back patio that overlooks the water. Clearly, the game day patronage and indoor decorations make up for what the food lacks. Historic city collages appear beneath the plastic table tops; red stools line those indoor  tables. A Giants baseball bat hangs over the entryway leading from the eating area to a photography-lined hall to the bar. 

My simple breakfast and people-watching at Red's got me pumped for an afternoon at AT&T Park.
author: Bobbin W.

description:
I always pass by this place and I keep telling myself I'm going to have to try it one day. So when some coworkers decided to go to lunch here, I decided to leave the office and give it a try. 

It is a cute little casual restaurant that has lunch and breakfast. I went for the chesseburger/fries/soda combo because, how could you go wrong with that? :) Once I placed my order at the window, my food was ready is less than 5 mintues...nice! 

The food however, was eh...I've had much better burgers elsewhere. I also didn't like the fact that you have to specify if you wanted an actual hamburger bun. If you don't, you're going to get your burger on a huge french roll. The patty itself is very very small/thin- I could see why a lot of people order doubles. 

The taste was good though, and their fries were a winner in my book- the chilli cheese fries are worth the visit! I've been reading a lot about their breakfast- i will give that a try sometime.
author: lauren j.

description:
The walls scream blue collar history even if many of the patrons (and prices) have moved on.  Burgers are made the way they've always been so I'm told: ground beef, cheese, onions, and mustard on a sourdough throne...I mean, bun.  They don't do lettuce and tomato, reads the friendly sign, and frankly, who needs it?  

I love Red's for its ambience, the views, the delicious simplicity of the food, and the way it just fits with the city.  If possible, I make my way here before a Giants game, but I will find an excuse to be in the neighborhood whenever a craving hits.  Their breakfast food also gets the job done and there are few things finer than a hazy morning, whether from hangover or fog, sitting on the bay with a plate full of traditional breakfast food.

Those that deride this fine establishment for the lines or the smells out back (on the bay...) or the supposedly lackluster presentation have simply missed the point and I'm glad they will quickly move on.  There's always more double-cheese for the rest of us who continue to foster taste.
author: P D.

description:
The only thing I love about Red's is the charming hut look and feel and the waterfront seating which is perfect on a sunny day. Beware of the seagulls eyeing your food though.

I don't love the food options here since everything is fried. Okay, fried is awesome for most people but I can't always gorge here. I had the tuna sandwich once and it was completely my fault that I ordered that. The second time I ordered a cheeseburger but it came on sourdough bread with no fries. Maybe I'm used to my burgers being on hamburger buns and really juicy.

If you're into dive places, come here. But if you're a foodie like me, you might be a tad disappointed. The staff is really nice so that's a major plus. That's why we keep coming back here for lunch regardless!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
The Bay, Burgers, Beer - can't go wrong with that combo!
If it's good enough for Anthony Bourdain.......
author: Rosemary B.

description:
"Eek, Methinks not" is right!!! 

After seeing this place featured on Bourdain, I, like many others i'm sure, decided to check it out.  Let's just say i hope to puke up that  "meal" i just ate, because it was crap!  

One of the most mediocre cheeseburgers i've had, and by far the worst onion rings in the cosmos.  Seriously, the cosmos...

The view was great, i cant wait for Red's to be torn to the ground so something worthy can open up in this spot.  

Puke time...

"hama ya! singa wada song now!"

-Bruce Springsteen
author: John B R.

description:
Great  Place For A Quick, Filling, And Affordable Breakfast/Lunch/Life Support

You know that feeling when you're up all night drinking, sleep for a few hours, and wake up feeling like a million bucks? Neither do I.  That's why I spend my Saturday and Sunday mornings stumbling, crawling, or being carried across the street for a breakfast/lunch at Red's (think a real life, adult-themed game of Frogger).

Food- 4/5
For breakfast I recommend the breakfast quesadilla or breakfast sandwich.  Full of eggs, cheese, and a meat of your choice (ham, bacon, or sausage)... Simply Put: if you don't like this meal, you don't like food... unless ofcourse you are allergic to eggs, cheese, or meat, at which point you would have bigger issues on your plate.

For lunch I recommend the cheeseburger with a side of fries.  The burger is very basic, cheese, onion, beef patty, and served between the best fresh and locally baked french bread you've ever had.  

Location- 5/5
Literally right on the water: where the Bay Bridge meets the Bay... and the bay met Barry Bonds' balls.......... during his impressive and record-setting homerun season.  

Service- 5/5
Red's handles it's customers like a man handles a marriage: They take the order with a smile and it always comes quickly.  The service is fast, friendly, and if you come by a few times they'll even remember your name and rendition of what "the usual" entails.

Value- 5/5
$4 burgers, $6 breakfast plates, and all day weekend Happy Hour.... Unlike your startup "business" in Pablo Sandoval memorabilia, Red's promises a high return on investment.


Overall I would recommend Red's to anyone looking for a friendly, quick and affordable meal that will hangup on even the mother of all hangovers.
author: Matt M.

description:
I hate to do this to you Red's but I gotta.  I'm sure you fit the needs of those looking for a great place to pick up a burger and a beer before the game or for those looking to not be robbed blind by the prices at the Ferry Building but for those just looking for a good burger, sorry to say, it ain't at Red's.

Normally, there is nothing I like better than a hole in the wall burger joint but I was disappointed.  I came here for lunch since I work nearby and ordered a single cheeseburger.  The burger isn't served on a bun but on a roll.  The roll was tasty but the meat to roll ratio was way off.  Way too much roll.  I think had I gotten a double burger that might have alleviated the problem.  The meat was thin and not juicy.  Maybe it was juicy at one point but the roll soaked it up and since there was so much roll it didn't really help.  I rarely ever dip my burger in ketchup but I had to since it was so dry.  They also serve burgers with just onions, pickles, and mustard.  Where's my lettuce and tomato?  Sure I get it, that's not their gig but I couldn't help but to be reminded of a McDonald's cheeseburger.  It probably was also due to the fact that the second I placed my order I was literally handed my burger.  Can't get service faster than that, even at McDonalds.

I'll probably be going to Red's again if my co-workers are insistent but I think I'd rather eat at my desk.
author: Mylinh M.

description:
Simple but good breakfast. Choices were limited to eggs, egg sandwiches and pancakes. I had egg sandwich and selected the bread roll for bread option and bacon for meat. I was pleased with my selection. The bread roll was good sized and  looked like it was purchased from a bread place versus from a grocery store. Husband had pancakes with sausages. Pancakes filled the whole plate and enough so that you need two containers of syrup. 

Definitely a place to come back to eat breakfast if in the neighborhood.

The other bonus was free parking in which plenty of spaces were available in the lot next to the restaurant. We were there on a Saturday about 10am.
author: t h.

description: Great gritty dive bar along the water with sizable sandwiches and cheap beers. When there is a port-a-potty outside in the beer garden, you know that you're in a pretention-free zone. A short walk to the ballpark helps too. Can't wait to return and have the chicken parm sandwich that I was admiring from afar.
author: Michael H.

description:
The location of this local and fun dive bar is amazing!  A lot of people stop by here for a couple of drinks before a Giants game, but I just wanted to enjoy the warm spring weather that SF rarely has.  

We sat outside to enjoy the bay views and catch some sunlight while taking down a couple of beers.  The bartender was very friendly and the people sitting next to us were raving about the food they were eating (we only had drinks there).  The food did look quite awesome - big servings with wonderful smells.  I want to come back here on a warm summer day to drink, take in the sun, and eat their food!

However, the one thing that would keep me from coming back is that their bathroom is just a port-a-potty.  Kinda gross...
author: Tram T.

description:
came here for some iced tea after a long walk on a very hot day.  was a little bit disapointed that the only ice tea they had was in a can and it was sweetened.  same for the lemonade too.

the service was pretty good.

i'll probably be back to try their food.
author: Amy L.

description:
Cheap place to eat and drink before a Giants game.
The food is just OK.
But like I said, it's cheap
author: Deka M.

description:
I do not know why I chose to wait so long to finish this update. Especially seeing so many new people comment after they saw Anthony Bourdain visit the city! I am in no way trying to be a glory hound but I feel that it was time for me to finish my unwritten reviews. Located near AT&T park and off the beautiful coast this is easily considered a small hole int he wall gem in San Francisco. It has been here what seems like forever and the thing to get here is their breakfast or burgers. I tend to go for the burgers because in all reality there is no way I can wake up in time early in the morning and high tail it there from where I am living now. There is simple indoor and outdoor seating which gives the place a good vibe and you see people from all aspects of life coming here. From different generations to different ethnicities people really do enjoy the food here.

Now with that said why have I chosen the what seems to be high in grease burgers you may ask? Well that's actually quite simple. The burgers here are amazing! Even though it is a bit of a commute I wouldn't hesitate to come here for lunch one day as I enjoy a reasonably priced burger. Goes to show you that even with all these people proclaiming that they have the cities best burgers either by ads or online websites that the best places don't need any advertisements. They let their food and customers do the talking for them. In this case they are right. Everything for under 10 bucks is a steal in my opinion. If you ever find yourself around the area for whatever reason, then this is the place to go check out. Order the double burger. You will not regret it.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Cheeseburger is ok (too much mustard for my liking), chilli is bleh but onion rings are FAB (prob bc they are more fried batter than onion - but hey, I'm not complaining). Also FAB - $1.75 PBRs everyday. 

All you need for a perfect Sunday: some sun (although it's a little rare in SF), a couple PBRs and onion rings. Not quit sure what Bourdain was talking about re: the burger....
author: Adrienne C.

description: Decided to try this place before going to a Giants game since seeing it on No Reservations, but was rather disappointed. Had a cheeseburger and the only good things about it were that was cheap and it came on a sourdough roll which was different from the usual burger. First the line took FOREVER which was fine since I wasn't in a rush but I realized the line was so slow because they wait to hand you your food up front right when you order it which is completely inefficient and explains why it takes so long. The burger itself was just alright, I ordered it with everything which includes mustard, pickles and onions. I'm ok with mustard but there was so much of it everywhere, it was hard to finish by the end and the pickles and onions were squished into one side. The cheese was also only half melted. Sadly disappointed by this place.
author: Bernie H.

description:
Burgers. Quintessential San Francisco views. More burgers. Very reasonable prices. Did I mention burgers on a toasted bun, including a veggie option? If not, I should. Burgers.

On a sunny day with the Bay Bridge in view, you almost can't do better.
author: Jason B.

description: We live nearby and thought, hey, we should really stop in.  It's great hangover food. We got coffe and a bloody Mary.  He really loves the greasy Corned Beef Hash sandwich. I guess the greasier the better.  It's a nice patio in the back where you can bring your dog and you get a view of the Bay which is a bonus.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Unhealthy food to the max.  The is your typical American dive greasy spoon.  When I went the place was packed with about 80% who either worked around the docks or the financial district.  There was a sports vibe there also.

I got their basic hamburger, well, ok, nothing special but it was worth a try.  Kind of greasy for sure.  

No need for me to go back since I can find much better burger joints that have healthier hamburgers with fresh lettuce and tomatoes on it, plus the quality of the burger is much better.  

If you want a dive experience that has been around a long time with eclectic charm of a bikers parade, this is the place to hang out.
author: Vanilla C.

description: Blondie and I had awesome timing and got in before a bonecrushing rush of Giants fans... good cheeseburgers, fries and cold Anchor Steam... service was quick and the food was hot... a good deal before you venture into the ballpark.
author: Scott P.

description:
This shanty-appearing antique diner has been here since 1923 and it looks as if nothing's been done to it since it's construction about 86 yrs ago.  The interior walls are decorated with old pictures, photos and posters from days long gone.  No frills with a counter of hot pots of coffee and hot water near the entrance and small tables/counters for the diners. In the rear deck are some tables and chairs for those who want to dine outdoors,  watch the boats,  listen to the spashing bay water and enjoy sunny days.  It's so rustic, you'd expect the fishermen to stomp in any second with their boots plastered in fish scales. 

Sundays and Saturdays, the special is the corned beef hash with REAL chunks of fatty beef and potatoes, served with 2 eggs (any style) and 2 whole slices of bread (choice of excellent wheat,  very sour sourdough, white or rye) for $8.  Certainly, the corned beef hash was delicious but you could see the huge amount of oil at the bottom of the plate, hard to discern if the meat was that fat or they used too much oil to cook it.  Hubby's breakfast plate of 2 patties of sausage, 2 eggs, potatoes and bread was over $7.
author: Ry T.

description: Had breakfast/brunch here.  It's a pretty classic diner, and doesn't really serve vegetables.  I had a breakfast quesadilla and breakfast platter, both of which were mediocre.  Can get much better food and value elsewhere in a city full of great breakfast spots.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Seriously one of the best places to stop in before a Giants game.  

Sure you could go to all the places that are basically adjacent to the ballpark...but you'll deal with giant (no pun intended) crowds and mostly amateur hour fans.  However, if you actually want a fun experience before the game with little hassle for a spot where you can meet up with your party and have some quick beers and cheap eats then this is your place.

The setting is straight up.  Four walls and a roof with a patio.  There is a bar and tables.  No frills.

Service is always friendly.

Crowd is always fun.
