Walking distance to park and Ferry Building.

Coffee option is nice for the night game...after work all day I'm pooped and need a pick me up.  (Side note-a shot of espresso in a Guinness is amazing and does the trick)

Beer and grub is always mad cheap.

Grub is very average...but then so is most of the ballpark's but at twice the price.

I'm afraid to post this...I know many know about this place but god forbid it turns into another freakin' MoMo's.
author: Chris D.

description: This place is perfect if your looking for a beer and a classic SF burger. The sour dough bread they use is off the hook.
author: Tony A.

description: I came here for a burger and an Anchor steam beer. They were out of anchor steam, really? Strike one, I was thrown off by the amount of bread and lack of meat on my burger. Strike two.  I know this is a local favorite but the burger was dry and not enough meat. Service was a bit rude. Strike three.  I can put up with rudeness if there is flavor in your food but this is not the case here.
author: Traveler 9.

description: I've walked by this place many times on my way to Giant's Games Since they moved to AT&T Park. I have always wanted to go inside and grab a bite and I finally was able to order that Chili Burger i have been wanting for a long time. The chili is really good. No clue if it's made in house or not, but this place would be excellent hangover food.
author: Grayson C.

description:
After finishing up a massage at Suchada's across the street (thanks to a gift certificate from our sweet roomie Kia!), the sunshine and the cresting waves of Bay water beckoned us to the outdoor patio of Red's Java House.  We both were in the mood for fish and chips, but the menu also had tons of burger options.  The fish seemed fresh, the beer-batter was fried to perfection, and the view was unbeatable.  It's a perfect spot to enjoy a meal on a sunny SF day...

good beers on tap too
author: Sid D.

description: Before the game a couple of beers on the back patio overlooking the Bay Bridge and San Francisco Bay on a bright, sunny day. Afterwards we stopped in for a bite and had burgers on sourdough, chili cheese fries and dogs, washed down with cold beer. Not anything to brag about but both visits were good in their own context. If you're looking for a nice, sit down meal in a regular restaurant this might not be the place, but if you want something to eat and drink pronto that hits the spot even if you have to use the porta potty and wipe your own table down the place might work for you.
author: T L.

description: best place to go before a giants game. the food is VERY simple, yet a great burger. cheap and good food and drinks-- fine with me! super causual and fun, a great place to go with a group.
author: Megan F.

description:
Often in San Francisco you have to choose: eat gourmet at an expensive restaurant with a view, or opt to chow down at a dive with one window that looks out on two bums fighting over a used bootleg off the classic Will Smith film, "The West Was Wild." 

But at Red's you get the best of both worlds - a spectacular view, combined with cheap burgers and a hangover-friendly atmosphere. Unable to process much of a menu? No worries, Red doesn't have much of a menu. You'll eat it and like it! 

Red's got a visit from the San Francisco Burger Blog - for more, check us out here:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/
author: Drew H.

description:
Finally went here for lunch on Saturday after 1 year of living across the street.  I was pretty disappointed.  The "great space" out back is pretty gross- lots of pigeons.  I'd recommend going here AFTER you've already had a couple drinks.  

We ordered a cheeseburger, onion rings and fish 'n chips.  I can only recommend the fish 'n chips.  The cheeseburger could barely compete with the equivalent from McDonald's and the onion rings were soggy and flavorless.  But the fish was actually pretty good- and you get two big pieces.  

The margarita is pretty good, but at $7 for a small cup, I'd only go back for $1.75 PBR.
author: Karla R.

description:
This place is great.  How can you go wrong with a gorgeous bay view, nearby parking, and beer on a sunny afternoon?

The burgers aren't the best, but they're cheap and so is the beer.
author: Peter H.

description: Hunh? What is all the hype about? A dried up flavorless hockey puck burger on a 10lb roll is not my idea of culinary greatness. No lettuce no tomatoes just onions if you want a vegetable. Oh and Costco pickle slices. The onion rings were those Burger King chopped and formed rings, not whole onions,, pretty nasty. Dumpy place, trashy outside, surrounded mostly by pavement. Never again.
author: Bob I.

description:
Great space out back to just chill and even have a drink if that tickles your fancy.

A few friends were hosting a fund raiser for the Susan G. Komen and as a good friend I wanted to help their cause.  Now this place will be a stop on a sunny day where I have nothing to do.
author: Po L.

description: I love Red's. When I go to ballgames, it is an absolute that I will start the day/evening at Red's. Let the yuppies crowd Momo's and drop a C note on drinks and a bite...I'll always be at Red's, enjoying a perfectly greasy burger and killer onion rings, or perhaps change it up with fish n chips. The crowd is always amiable, Sean the owner is a cool dude, and the beer is cold and cheap (esp. when compared to ballpark prices!!). But don't just go there when there's a ballgame. Make sure you take your out of town visitors. We visited during Fleet Week and had an awesome view of ships and planes.
author: Sharon B.

description: We moved to SF in April 2011 and have been in search of a good place to go for breakfast on the weekend. We've been there 4-5 times so far and have found the food at Red's to be just what the doctor ordered each time.
author: jon b.

description:
Cheap and tasty. I consider myself a "flexitarian"...don't eat a ton of meat but sometimes get a hankerin' for a good 'ol burger.

Came here recently on a gorgeous day after sailing the Bay for 3 hours and famished. Good burger.

Add a star for the grilled onions and the pickle bar. Goes perf with an icy-cold Anchor Steam and a seat in the sunshine.

Right near the stadium too, so save some dough on the overpriced food and head to Red's.
author: Faith S.

description:
Good ole Red's, what a waterfront stalwart!   This little shack has been here longer than there has been water in the bay.  Well, not really, but close.  I used to come here when you could get a double cheese and a longneck for a buck fifty.  Ahhh, the good old days.  Funny thing about back then, though, was an interesting lunch I had there with a co-worker:

Me:  Shall we sit outside with the grub?
CW:  Sure, how about there overlooking the water?
Me:  Sure.
*we sit, we eat*
CW:  Damn, that was a pretty good burger *BURP* 
Me:  Damn, holmes, push that Bud breath the other way, ya slob!!
CW:  *follow-up BURP*
Me:  Fargin icehole.  I can't finish this burger, where's the garbage can?
CW:  Shit man, don't throw it away, just toss it up in the air, one of these seagulls will eat it, those things are rats with wings!.
Me: *throws remaining burger 20 feet into the air, inches away from seagull*
Me: *watches burger fly over seagulls head, seagull ignores my precise toss, watches burger float and hit the water with a SLAP.
CW:  Damn dude, can you believe that winged-rat wouldn't eat that burger?
Me:  Uhh, no, and now, I can't believe we ate it either.
Both of us:  *swallow index finger*
Seagull:  *takes $hit on my friend's shoulder.

True story, Yo.

Went there recently after Red's reopened, that specific seagull (had a mohawk)  and the prices are gone, I think everything else is still there.

check it, swallow it, be wary of it.
author: Johnny L.

description:
Anthony Bourdain Lied. These burgers tasted like something you'd heat up in a microwave. I suppose at least the price wasn't too intense.
Skip it and go to Holy Grill or something. (or Java House down the street.)
author: B S.

description: Best place to pre-game before Giants games. It was also on No Reservations last year if I remember right. Good greasy food, cheap beer and walking distance to AT&T. The staff is friendly under stressful situations, like a hungry crowd before a baseball game. It's a "must do" for tourists; i bring people here whenever they come to the City. It's a dive and I love it.
author: Toby B.

description:
A very nice place to grab a beer after work on a nice warm, summer day.  The food is meh.  Just greasy bar food.  We had the fried fish and burgers.  The fried fish was not bad, though not great either.  Tasted as if it were fried twice - so it was very crispy.

The fries were simply fries - not as good as McD and got limp very quickly.

The ketchup is a bit watery - don't know why?

The burgers were very ordinary - the buns were not special - a bit dry.  The onions on the burger were cut a bit big and so they were a bit sharp.  The patties are really quite thin/small, so it's hard to taste the meat within the bun.  My kids remarked that "the burgers are good, but not as good as McDonald's."  Can't believe I spent $3.45 for it.  Tasted like a $0.99 burger.  My review, definitely not as good as "In-n-Out" but the views are spectacular.

Also parking is plentiful and convenient - unusual in SF.
author: Madison W.

description: I really like this place. Pretty much come here before all the Giants games..really laid back, greasy spoon kind of place. Right on the water. They sell beer by the pitcher.. what more can you ask for?? Only slight downside is I remember the B not liking her food very much from here..but who cares..really, who goes here for the food?..still the perfect place to be sittin' on the dock of the bay, watching the tide roll away.. hay, hay, hay...what do you say?...
author: Morris D.

description:
On fridays the special is fish and chips, probably the 2nd best fish and chips I have had in the Bay Area (Camelot in Pacifica being my favorite).

The burgers here are pretty good too.  This is a good place to go on sunny weekend days so you can lounge outside and take in the sun, or on game days before a Giants game.
author: Brian A.

description: During a recent visit, one of many (LOL!), couldn't help but eat here after seeing it on No Reservations, & loved the double cheese wrapped in wax paper w/fries. Just down the street from the baseball park if the Giants are in town. A SF classic.
author: Glenwood J.

description: I went here because I was catching up on all of the food shows that have been filmed in SF and Anthony Bourdain did a piece on it.  From the episode the hamburgers looked really good, but that really wasn't the case when I got there.  The burgers didn't have much flavor and the fries were pretty much the same quality as the ore-ida ones you can buy and reheat in an oven.  The best thing this place has going for it is the outdoor patio.  If you're an out of towner and you want an ok meal, sure, go here and get a burger, fries and beer.  But if you live in the city, just go to In-N-Out, 4505 Meats, Gotts, Umami or Super Duper.
author: Joe N.

description:
Nice place to stop with a group of friends before Giants games.  I'll get off of BART and walk to Red's where we'll order an inexpensive pitcher of beer or if we're feeling really cheap, we'll get a bucket  of PBR's.  

Often we will spend our entire pregame here in their back seating section drinking beer and just enjoying the poor man's waterfront view of the bay bridge accompanied by a few pigeons.
author: Bob V.

description:
This review was from 12/09, just finalized it!

Service was super friendly, food was as Mr. Bourdaine described, a good greasy burger at a decent price. 

Great view of the Bay Bridge and a special treat, if you can identify the movie quote... You get free fries or a soda.
author: Andrew P.

description: There was quite a line pre-game however the person behind the counter was friendly and efficient and I had my burger, fries and soda in no time at all. I was able to secure a small table inside and watched a lot of people pass by to and from the rear outdoor area. Lots of regulars here I think.
author: Jay P.

description: My favorite breakfast on the weekend: corned beef hash, 2 bloody marts,  the newspaper and a seat in the back patio...bonus: the folk working there are solid citizens.
author: John A.

description:
I gave this place 3 stars mostly for the decorations (lots of SF memorabilia all over the walls, very cool to stand there and see what it all is) and we sat inside but it looks like there is a really cool deck with lots of tables and on cooler day (it was pretty warm today with no breeze even on the water) I think it'd be a great spot to hit with a bunch of friends.  I also liked the trivia question of the week at the ordering counter.

The Food: I didn't really care for it at all.  Its a cheap burger and you taste it.  The meat was pretty tasteless and it is served on a sourdough roll with mustard and pickles.  Way too much sour upon sour taste.  I do however  like that their menu is no nonsense (there is a sign clearly stating they do not serve lettuce or tomatoes in a clear "don't even ask" kind of way).   I snagged a couple of fries from my companion and those were tasty though.

So A+ for atmosphere, D for food.
author: Dawn L.

description:
went there for breakfast before the giants fanfest.  nothing bad to say about this place.  the service, the food, and the location rocks.  breakfast until 11am

first the food:

the boyfriend had corn beef hash with potatoes, eggs, and toast.  my only experience with corn beef is from a can so i didn't realize how good actual corn beef is.  he said the same thing. i didn't think the food was too greasy.  you kind of expect some grease when it comes to breakfast/diner type food.  

i had the egg, bacon, and cheese sandwich on sourdough.  again... not overly greasy, good portion, and done just right.  the egg was done like an omelet which sat nicely between the bread.  the bacon was crispy and the cheese not overwhelming. 

the people there are mellow, friendly, and seem to enjoy working there.  they were cool that we had our own coffee so that was nice.  the prices are good for the quality of food.   you can be seated upfront or towards the back.  nice view of the water since you're on the pier and a semi short walk to the ballpark.
author: huong n.

description:
UPDATE: 12-17-2007

so we went back last saturday for lunch to have a taste of their hamburgers and to my dismay, it wasn't all that!
served on a french bread and with a thin patty, i wasn't blown away.
they used white chopped onions, soggy pickles and you can have mayo or mustard on it.

however, i still like this place and red's will remain to have a four sparkly stars from me.
i will not get their burgers anymore, though.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

still one leg outside his car, i was already telling him where to have our breakfast that cold saturday morning.my mind was already set on this cafe.

we easily got a parking spot behind this shabby-looking, fisherman's/construction worker's hole known as the red's java house.
once inside, i realized that this is really a scruffy niche where construction workers or anglers can be seen in their stained coveralls and smelly waders having a delicious, greasy meal.

looking at their limited menu, i opted for their breakfst sandwich. having no idea what's on this fare, i asked tony the guy who was taking the order.
in his husky, whispery tone of voice, he asked me if i want what "he'll get" which has fried eggs, cheddar cheese & sausage OR ham. i told him that i want what he'll get...and he gave me a huge smile!

after a short while, we were HANDED the best breakfast sandwich wrapped in white parchment paper. between bites, i took sip of their average cup of joe where it is self-serve and bottomless.

both of us truly enjoyed our meal that i told tony i'll be back for their hamburgers & hotdogs!...and they deliver generous portion with reasonable prices.

on my way out, i took an 8oz paper cup and filled it with coffee for the road.
the next visit is already booked for saturday, 12-15-2007.

I LOVED IT HERE!!!!
author: Nelle A.

description:
I'm not sure why Bourdain was so enamored with the burger. It's basically thin costco style patties, a slice of cheese, tons of mustard combined with onions and pickles surrounded by a loaf of bread. I give this place 4 starsbecause of the atmosphere which is great. The ceiling in this place has a large tumor and looks to be close to collapsing. The outdoor seating offers fantastic views of the bay.

Price is "cheap" but you get what you pay for. If i go back there I'll definitely be getting the fish and chips and ignoring the burger. C'mon Bourdain, I was really hoping you'd find some secrets in SF but that episode was pretty weak.
author: Travis J.

description:
Oh man, you have GOT to appreciate when an establishment makes a burger juicy slab of beef and puts it in a french bread roll. I would recommend the double cheeseburger. 

Not to discount the chili cheese dog, of course. Equally as fantastical. 

PLUS, they had Prohibition on tap when I was there last time. Didn't check this time, but you get 5 stars just for that.
author: Annie T.

description:
I have never ordered a coffee at Reds Java House. Why bother. They serve beer. 

Reds is a reminder of what South Beach was before the Giants moved in along with all of the high rise condos and people who can afford them. The outside is a little worn down, weathered and small compared to its new neighbors. It is still somewhere the working class would be comfortable, sitting outside on haphazardly placed plastic tables and chairs watching the scenery with a burger and a beer, after a hard days work. 

The inside is no more glamorous. You order your diner/deli foods at a counter and grab a bottle of beer out of a sliding door refrigerator case. The walls are adorned with decorative knick knacks that are all at least a few decades old. 

I hope Reds never goes away and never changes, but I assume it is inevitable. Enjoy being taken back in time while you can because "progress" is hot on its trail.
author: Drue C.

description:
What a great place this is!!  I love the location (near the water and on the Embarcadero) and the food is down-home tasty.  Just a great burger and sitting outside to enjoy it is the best!  Super nice people, too.

It's not high on ambiance inside but being located where they are at is a huge plus in my book.
author: Sparkely K.

description:
I first discovered Red's in a car commercial.  You know the one where the only word spoken by any of the actors is "Duuuuuddee".  I just kept wondering why the hell these obviously intelligent young twits didn't take a sip of their overfull coffees *before* they got in the car.  No idea who made the car.  But the cool looking waterfront shack they were leaving was memorable.

So cut to a couple of months later and I'm wandering down the waterfront one morning with my date from the night before, who has promised to feed me, when I see the same shack.  Slight headache and mildly queasy stomach - meet greasy diner food and a lovely breezy morning under the Bay Bridge.  No contest.

As already mentioned by others, the coffee wasn't everything I could have hoped for, but the food was exactly what I needed.  Hot, served on those thick buffalo china plates, not swimming in grease but with a healthy dose of oily goodness.  

Red's is a place I would bring my father for breakfast or a beer.  My mother, well...we may just stick with mimosa brunches for her.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Etiam magna arcu shh don't tell anybody but this place kicks ass. Sed malesuada, turpis vel cursus dictum, urna ante sodales magna, vel tempor est arcu breakfast is among the cheapest and best you'll find in the city. 

Duis egestas, metus vel faucibus full bar in the back with damn good bloody marys.  Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus maybe not as good as Zeitgeist or The Ramp but pretty freaking close.  

Pellentesque libero quam, facilisis sit amet, and spectacular views, especially on a clear day.  Aliquam erat volutpat cops eat here regularly so you know you probably won't get sick either malesuada lacus eget dolor.

Don't go here, it sucks.  Stay away.
author: Sus... B.

description:
This place is an old San Francisco tradition. Food is nothing special; the coffee is like rocket fuel. But they have specials like burger and a beer..... burgers on sourdough, fries in a cup...

I really like this place...
author: Brendan R.

description:
** Big Play's Official Bargain Bites! **

There are certain "classics". In La-La Land, its Pinks, The Pantry, and The Apple Pan. Up here, we've got Ole's Waffle House in Alameda, Millie's Kitchen in Lafayette, and Sam's in Tiburon. To that mix, add Red's Java House.

Located on the Embarcadero, this structure is roughly a hundred years old. Not old for Boston, but old for the West Coast. This ramshackle clapboard locale has that funky old warmth. If you can, grab a window table with a water view. This is Old School, drama mama's not allowed. No foie gras, wasabi, or truffles here.

I had the breakfast sandwich on a sourdough roll ($3.55), while my friend had an American breakfast ($5.50?), which included ham, eggs, toast and hash browns. Service was prompt, and banter with the gent manning the cash register was lively. This place used to serve longshoremen in a time long gone, but some of the feeling is still there. You can get a dog and a Bud for $4.50? (And for the Hipsters, yes, they sell PBR here on the cheap.)

(My second visit, I had the Italian sausage sandwich, on a French roll. Included a few onions ($5.00). An average sandwich that could use a little help.)

Historic photos document the past, and an outdoor patio out back serves the thirsty when the sun is shining. My bet is that drinks are priced reasonably, and strong to boot. This is honest, no-frills dining. Some of the food is bare bones, but the waterfront location, historic aspect, price (value), service and vibe win for me. 

This business is on property owned by the Port Authority, and if they ever try to axe this place, the Dungeons and Dragons crowd should break out their paint ball gear!
author: M Z.

description:
Even after reading many mixed reviews, we just had to try this place. We are Anthony Bourdain fan! Heck, we can we could at least enjoy the view!  

When we got there, tons of free parking mad me happy! finding parking spot & walking around is not so fun anymore with our 17 month old who wants to walk by herself & always walks to opposite direction from where we are headed. We parked & hung out there with my baby watching the ducks in the water until our friends get there. 

Spectacular view as we expected. Super! As we walked into the restaurant through the bar area, we were even more thrilled to order some food. It just felt like we were back in east coast! Home sweet home~

The guys are so nice & cool! We love this place!
We ordered onion rings chili fries & burgers for guys. Onion ring came hot so fast, really hot! It was soooo good. Maybe very greasy but what do I expect from fried food? not to be greasy? 
I didn't try the burger but guys said, it's so-so. They said, if they make burger so well, this place would be so crowded that we would not be able to eat here. Lucky for us! 

I think people come here to enjoy food, seat outside, chat with friends & enjoy the view~ The food may not the best thing here, but I have to say I'm a fan of this place! Nice people! When we go back there again, we'll try something other than the burger.
author: Sunny K.

description:
Tried the double cheese burger and it was fair at best. Lacked flavor and freshness.  And it wasn't cheap! The burger, plus fries and a coke was $9.

I love you Anthony Bourdain, but your starting to piss me off!
author: David D.

description:
How can anyone not love Red's!!!  

It's always there when you need it.  

Hungover?  No problem, chase it with Stella on tap, yummy french fries and the sun beating down on your face out on the patio.

Don't want a fancy breakfast or brunch?  Here's Red's.  Breakfast sandwich, breakfast plate, sides of bacon.  Oh dear gawd, need I go on?

In the mood for some grub later in the day?  Red's serves up a perfect salami sandwich, traditional hot dogs and the burgers are yum.  And yet once again, Stella on tap.  

Simple and easy food.  Sun.  Relaxing.  Patio.

Done and Done.
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description: I've been here twice now, both times when we had guests in from out of town.  First time we had breakfast.  Today we had cheeseburgers and chile fries.  Really enjoyed this both times as did our guests.  The cheeseburger is served on a roll.  Cheese was cheddar.  This is almost reminiscent of a Westlake Joes burger.  Simple, good food at a good price.
author: Brian C.

description:
Depending on the day, you might mistake me for a longshoreman. I can sport that grizzly, sweater and wool cap look like few others. But under that very thin facade lies one of the biggest cream puffs you're likely to meet.

I mean, you gotta feel my hands some time. When people actually talk about a baby's bottom the comparison they usually make is to the softness of my hands. These things have yet to see an honest day's work.

So it's understandable that at Red's they're not sure what to make of me. I look and sound like I belong there, but their sea gull's sixth sense tells them something ain't right.

I'll tell you what is right, their breakfast sandwich on sourdough roll for 3.55+tax.
author: Jason R.

description: Great place that has SF character! Great classic fried onion rings and burgers! All the pictures become a collage of the history and the life of SF and Red's and Shawn  ....the best character in the joint! Also a great spot for simple breakfast...scrambled egg-whites w/salsa, wheat toast and occasionally when I want to 'splurge'....BACON!
author: MeeSun B.

description:
I love this place... I didn't stick to burgers or fish & chips... I got the chicken parm sandwich and an anchor steam... the chicken is actually pretty tasty but the tomato sauce is kinda watery so it made my chicken soggy... Fries are good... sitting on the dock in the sun is good... drinking beer at 1pm on a Friday is good... walking from my apartment door to red's front door in 5 min is good... 

Gotta come back here for the pancakes...
author: Jen D.

description:
Some friends and I decided to grab lunch at this place before a Giants game. The location is incredibly convenient since we were walking down the Embarcadero, and I love the waterfront view. And you know why else it is convenient for those who are on their way to a Giants game? The service is super fast. It only took about 30 seconds to get my food from the time I paid. They constantly have burgers cooking on their grill, so there is never a long wait. I would have loved to sit out back in the outdoor patio area, but there aren't a lot of tables, and each one was taken. So we had to sit inside. No biggie, though. There is plenty of San Francisco history and memorabilia on the walls to keep you entertained.

As for the food? I ordered a single cheeseburger with a side of onion rings, and the burger meat was fresh and perfectly cooked. A couple of my friends ordered the double cheeseburger, and it was a lot of meat.

I took away one star because of the french role they use for buns. I would have preferred an actual hamburger bun. The french role was too tough for my liking and began hurting my teeth about half way through.

The onion rings weren't very good. They give you a sizable portion, but I have the feeling that they are a frozen brand rather than freshly breaded. There was way too much bread and not enough onion.

All in all, pretty good place. Decent food at decent prices. The perfect stop for a bit to eat on the way to AT&T Park.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Do I have anything else to add? 

Don't get stuck on the back porch after a Giants game lets out! One bathroom. Twenty people in line. They should let those of us who have drank several happy hour pitchers first right of refusal. Ha! The happy hour prices are very happy, at $2.75 for domestic and $3.75 for micros and $11 for a pitcher of Sierra Nevada. On the water, view of Oaktown, the Bay Bridge, and FiDi/SOMA, great breeze, careful about the nippin' out time at sunset- chilly! The meatball sandwich and fries hit the spot, it's cheap and 50s diner-a-riffic!
author: Braden B.

description:
The #1 reason why you should never judge a book by its cover or a restaurant/bar by its store front.  

Red's is located on the water off of Embarcadero next to many fancy restaurants.  But I will tell you that I prefer going to Red's any day of the week for a nice beer, down-to-earth (DTE) food, and their raw view of the bay.  The food is American comfort, meaning hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, and fried fare.  Everything is very inexpensive, its almost like their paying you to eat there (I had a hamburger on a steak sandwich roll for less than $3.00).  The decor is simple and what you would expect from a DTE establishment.  The patio seating area in the back is great on a hot sunny day, but can be freezing cold otherwise.  

Don't miss out on one of the best hidden gems in San Francisco and pay a visit soon!

Tip:
On those nice summer days, grab some friends, order a basket of fries, and a bucket of Anchor Steam to sit on the patio and pay tribute to how amazing San Francisco is.
author: Herman N.

description:
A bottle of beer and a plate of fish and chips eaten leisurely on Red's back patio. 

On the rare warm and sunny day in SF, a better lunch cannot be had.
author: Catherine H.

description: I realize I just dont' come here enough. Great burgers, and have been the same way for 20+ years. One of the few things in SF that is a constant. I remember this place used to not have a back deck- great addition. Never had anything in here aside from a double cheeseburger and a beer. No need to really. I remember when they used to have the old ketchup bottles they used to just top off from another container- the paint was completely worn off the bottle tops..
author: Jim B.

description:
Scenario: The perfect stop before a Giants game (for humans AND pigeons).

Product: Burgers.  Fries.  Fish & Chips.  Reuben.  Hot Dog.  Pigeons.  Beer.  NO TOMATO!  Don't even ask, trust me.  The burgers are a good size, tasty, and well-priced.  Beer flows aplenty.  It's not the tastiest or fanciest burger I've ever had but it's price-quality ratio is much better than most places.  Better than Oscar's or Barney's in Berkeley and John's Char in Livermore...

Service: I wouldn't necessarily describe it as friendly.  Funny, yes.  Conversational, mostly.  Endearing ...  Anywho, the food comes out quick and the line is short.  Good thing, 'cause the pigeons swoop in fast on your leftovers.

Atmosphere: The patio seating out back is awesome.  A view of the bridge and the water is the perfect place to warm yourself in the afternoon sun as you consume before game time.  It looks like a dive from the outside, and probably is, but you won't care. *waves Jedi hand*

Uniquity: Prices are good, the outdoor seating is relaxing, and the pigeons only swarm 'unattended' food.
author: Robert R.

description:
Ok so I check this place out after some of the stellar reviews. I'm sorry to say that it didn't live up to the hype. The service was real fast and totally quick w/ the order. But the burger was real plain. Maybe I'm comparing it to my experience at Pear's in the Nob Hill District but still..... The pattie was too thin and tasteless. The bread was the worst....it was not even a bun, but a part of a french roll. It was hard as a rock and hurt my gums and the roof of my mouth. I was not even rushing as I took the day off...but even after taking my time...it was like trying to chew coral...abrasive as hell.  

If you do go....go for the history, a beer and maybe some fries (they must be softer than the bread). And have them out on the patio area. +2 stars for the view.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Often free parking.
For the price the food is good, nice view of the bay and right under the bay bridge. Good cheep breakfast. Sizable burgers for the price and a small bar in the back. I will say that the burgers And fries aren't always made to order when it's busy so on a game day you may get soggy fries but in a not so busy day everything is great.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

Two large pancakes for 3.99+tax. This includes a great view of the Bay Bridge and more butter than one could possibly want melting on the food. Pay strict attention to your environment while out on the deck lest the many, many forms of hungry avian life swoop onto your plate and go aerial piranha on it.
Basic food for pre-baseball.

If time and crowds aren't a factor, Delancy is just down the street.
author: Bob R.

description:
I can't keep track of the number of times I've passed Red's Java House on the way to a Giants game or on my way to piers 30-32 for an event (KFOG Kaboom) and never gave it a second look or have gone in.

It wasn't until watching Anthony Bourdain on his SF trip stop here for a burger and a beer that I decided that I needed to check this place out next time I'm in the area and looking for a bite to eat.

Me and four of my friends decided to stop here for a bite before the SF Giants vs Rockies game so we didn't have to pay for the pricey food and drink inside the stadium.

After reading the numerous poor reviews on their burger, and the positive reviews from those who had Red's fish and chips, I then decided to play it safe and go for the fish and chips ($8.50) and a bottle of Anchor Steam (about $5)

We grabbed a table outside with the seagulls and enjoyed the view of the bay and the parking lot next to us.Three of us had the fish and chips and the other two the burgers. Those who had the burgers weren't that impressed..."how was the burger?" "Meh, I've had better" "It's ok"
The fish and chips were alright, I've had better, but it was nothing to complain about. The plastic forks they give you are practically useless on the fried batter on the fish and only good once you crack open the fish with your hands. They give you a couple decent sized pieces of fish on a bed of french fries and with a side of tarter sauce and malt vinegar on the side.

After finishing our fish and chips and burgers, we decided to get one more beer before heading into the game and we got a pitcher of Anchor Steam ($16), ($14 during happy hour - wish I could tell you when that was)

They were cleaning up getting ready to close when we headed out (around 7:20pm) so it's not a late night place, but an ok place to go if you need a quick bite before the game and don't have the time for a sit down full service restaurant.
author: Craig F.

description:
I swear to God this place might lose me my job when it's all said and done. See, it's a block away from my office, and the weather's been really nice lately, so let's just say I visit Red's often and usually stay too long for a traditional "lunch hour".

Look it's not hard to get some things right, and Red's is a perfect example of that. It's a small building right on the water, with a spacious patio in the back for basking in the sun while you enjoy your lunch. And the food? Nothing outstanding by any means, but it's super cheap (a burger and fries for $6, don't mind if I do) and the sandwiches are all served on the classic sourdough roll. The fries are tasty, too. Did I mention they serve pints, which you can enjoy too many of while you realize that your email inbox is overflowing but you really couldn't care less? See, that's the kinda attitude that Red's fosters, and I get the feeling "upper management" ain't too happy about it...
author: Drew S.

description:
Cool old place. Saw it on an old episode of Streets of San Francisco. If its good enough for Lt. Mike Stone - it's good enough for me. 

The burger was decent, but not going to set your world on fire. I did like the fact it was on a sourdough roll. 

I think this is either a love it or hate it kinda place. Some will see the charm of an old, weathered wharfside diner, others will not. The view of the Bay Bridge and bay is awesome and a great place to have a beer.
author: Scott J.

description:
I went here the other day after another great interview for a company I want to work for.  This is the same company who turned me down in favor of an employee seeking an advancement.  WELL, it turns out that they want another A/P person for another division, and I was the FIRST person they thought of!  So that might be a good sign.

So, I've heard a lot of this place and went here for lunch.  I had a double cheeseburger, and I was surprised how small it was.  It comes ONLY with mustard, onion and pickle.  There's even a sign saying they don't have tomato, or lettuce!  That was a let down.  The burger was rather thin, and the cheese was not even melted yet.  The bread was too thick for my tastes.  Service was quick though.

The fries were pretty good, and served in a paper coffee cup.

All in all, I might go back for the CHEAP prices ... the double and fries cost me about $6, and for the location, but not for the quality of the burger.
author: Michael M.

description:
4 and 5 stars?  Did I go to the same place?  The only thing good about this place was the price....I think.  Actually, now that I think about it, I don't think that was good either.  

My friend and I walked in...our first time. Didn't have a clue what to do.  Do we sit down?  Will someone come and ask for our order? No clue.  We sit down and then realize we're supposed to order at the front.  The "hostess" was severely lacking in her customer service skills.  It wasn't THAT early to be so pissy.  She was busy but she had too much of a 'tude when we asked her if we needed to order at the front.  First timers would not know unless they were told.  Whatever.  She wasn't too friendly!

 We order, pay and realize the hostess tried to pull a fast one on us by putting our change in the tip jar.  Err... esqueeze me? What the fa are you doing?  We have to friggin' get our own forks, water, napkins, ketchup AND you think you're gonna keep the almost four dollar change.  I don't think so chica!

We sit down and are given our food. The wait wasn't too long, I'll give you that.  We were starving when we got there...and were starving when we left.  My breakfast quesadilla was ok sized..nothing to write home to mom about.  There were no potatoes that came with it, something I found strange because you always get hash browns or some sort of potato when you order breakfast.  The food was ok...nothing exceptional.  

I wasn't impressed AT ALL!  Once was enough for me.  Seriously don't even bother going to this place....take the bus and go to THE PORK STORE on Haight or even Mel's Diner.  I make better breakfasts than Red Java (not saying much).
author: Daniela L.

description:
I think it's pretty awesome that I'm a third generation Red's patron. Yep, Gramps used to come here back in the day. The old shack is just about under the bay bridge, and you get the feeling it has changed very little in the past decades! 

The pancakes are great for breakfast, and the coffee is super strong, but I usually find myself here for lunch or dinner before an event out on the pier. Cheeseburgers and fries are delicious, and they have a respectable selection of booze. 

When the weather is nice, take your yummies out to the back deck. Don't worry, there's a bar out there too for when you polish off your first beer. Just watch out for the pigeons! They like your food just as much as you will!
author: Kelly C.

description: I just "dined" at Red's for the second time since I moved back to SF. The first was right before a Giants game it was ok, but didn't bring me back for several months. Today I was served a pre-cooked cheeseburger on a sour French roll that was smeared with mustard and diced onions.  This undercooked, cold sandwich was joined by a paper cup of limp, soggy, cold fries. It was awful.
author: Lefty R.

description:
Nicest guys work here... they're really cool. We called them to place an order, since they were closing in 5 minutes, and the guy told us to just come down, and that he'll "take care of us," which he indeed did. 

French bread buns have a unique style to them, and make for some damn good burgers. I'd say the hamburger patties are similar to In-n-Out patties, so if you're a guy or just really hungry, make sure to get double meat!

I asked the guy if I could get half onion rings, half fries, and his response was "hey man whatever we can do, we'll do it," which I freaking love. None of that bullshit some other places give when wanting to order something a little different. However, the onion rings were not too great. They may have just been sitting there for a while, as I saw a new batch come out as soon as mine gathered. 

They also have a sign that says "don't ask for lettuce or tomatoes," because they don't do that there. I really love nice, crispy lettuce in a cheeseburger, which was a little disappointment, but nothing to cry about.

Good. Food. That's what it comes down to. As well as a good price, to boot.
author: Shaddie J.

description:
Whether it's because of simple word of mouth, or people being enamored with the idea of a hole-in-the-wall burger place, or because of Anthony Bourdain, Red's has developed a pretty good reputation in San Francisco. The great debate, my friends, is whether it deserves it. So let me tell you my story...

I came here with some friends this past weekend to finally experience Red's. First thing I noticed? FREE PARKING LOT. That's worth like nine stars by itself in the city. We walk in and the guy at the counter starts making small talk. We mention that it's our friend's birthday today and he says that she deserves something: a free beer! Not too shabby. We order our food and I notice a "question of the week" written on a blackboard asking what movie this line is from: "If it bleeds, we can kill it." Obviously, it's from the classic movie Predator featuring the Governator. I tell the guy my answer which earns me free french fries! High fives all around!

Now comes the big test: the food. We ordered burgers, onion rings, and chili cheese fries. Annnnnd... it's kind of a letdown. The burgers come on sourdough bread which is cool, but they're pretty ordinary otherwise. They come with only mustard, onions, and pickles so there's not a ton of flavor and the meat isn't anything to write home about. The chili cheese fries weren't bad, but I've definitely had better. It also probably didn't help that it was about 55 degrees that day and the cold air coming in made the cheese a solid mass. Also, I'm not totally sure, but it seemed like the onion rings were lacking... onion. It tasted like it was just fried batter in the shape of a ring. So if you like fried batter in the shape of a ring, this is the spot for you.

In review, our trip to Red's went like this: free parking, one free beer, a free order of fries, and a free view of the bay. Not to mention the guys working here are all pretty nice and personable. But looking back on it now, if we hadn't received those things, my review for Red's would probably be lower. It's worth checking out, but probably not a place you're going to frequent. Just be sure to brush up on your Arnold movie knowledge beforehand.
author: Eddie L.

description: Pretty simple burgers in a sourdough roll, but what they lack in presentation they more than make up for in taste. Good fries too and nice views from the bay if you sit outside.
author: Chris M.

description: For someone who doesn't drink coffee, I like it here. The views are quite lovely on a clear day and the smell of freshly roasted coffee is just fabulous. They roast their own coffee here (had to take out the pinball machine to accomodate the roasting machine) and they also serve up food such as sandwiches and breakfasts. This SF institution has been featured in the background of many Hollywood movies.
author: Anita L.

description:
So your walking down the Embarcadero with you and your significant other and suddenly your stomache growls. What is there to eat? You can't imagine eatting seaweed or seagulls. 

Well, its time to come on down to Red's Java House, where they serve much more then a cup of joe in the morning.

This afternoon, my co-worker never tried Red's so we went down from our colocation and had lunch there.

At around 12pm on a Tuesday, the line was short,, 5 people, but the service was fast. Two counters taking orders and so it we had to make a choice quickly.

Me: "What are you getting Cathy?"

Cathy: "Not sure, but I'm probably going to get a Ruebun Sandwich, how bout you?"

Me: "I was thinking a hamburger, but the bread is kind of hard, so maybe I'll get a hotdog instead"

Cathy: "Ohh, those fish and chips look good.."

Waitress: "Next in line"

Cathy goes up to order,...

Me to myself: "WtF should I get..."

Waiter: "Next in line Please"

Me: "I like to get a fish and chip and a sprite"

Yeah, I'm a sucker for ordering things that looked good, but the fish and chips were off the hook! The fish was deep fried of course, but I'm not watching my calories if I ordered fish and chips! Batterwise, it tasted like it came from a beer batter batch, the fish wasn't as fresh or as plentiful as I had hoped, but topping a little bit of malt vinegar and tarter sauce on it made taste yuummy.

The last time I came here, I ordered a hamburger, and it was funkky... You get a sourdough bagette as your hamburger bun, but it feels more like the bread is too hard to chew. 

I only notched a star for that, but everything else is top notch food for a cheap price. 

Being part of my $6 and under meal list, you can get yourself a hamburger or hot dog, fries and soda for well under $6.

Take note that if you sit inside, you'll see a lot of pictures with vintage SF memorabilia that rivals many museums. 

Watch those pesky birds outside though. If you don't protect your food, the birds will have a free lunch thanks to you.
author: Wilson L.

description: Deliciously fried fish with extra tarter sauce on the side please! May not be the fanciest place to eat at, and the pigeons and seagulls can be annoying, but dang it, the fish and chips is delish!
author: Claudia L.

description:
Such a great place for breakfast and lunch!!! 

I pass this place all the time and never gave it a second thought. But my husband wanted to try it while on one of our bike rides and I am so glad he did! I had the breakfast and it was just everything you would ever want from a breakfast, the bacon was hot and juicy, the pancakes were hot and cakey and the eggs were cooked to perfection. 

And then the view is just beautiful! On a warm day, sitting outside would be ideal, but the warm atmosphere  inside is great too...so cozy.

I loved this place, and have been wanting to go back ever since. YUM YUM Red's!
author: Donna S.

description: Food is great if you're not a snob. Ambiance is priceless. Go grab a burger and beer and relax!
author: Michael H.

description:
YUMMY, hole in the wall breakfast and lunch place.  

Yummy. Had a egg and sausage sandwich yesterday on sourdough bread and it was good.  Greasy, hole in the wall good.

Pretty simple, go in order, pay (cash only) and then go find a table and sit down and wait for them to call your order.   

Not much to say other than that.  My friends had the gyro sandwich thing, and a BLT and everyone enjoyed their food, and the chance to sit outside in the sun and eat and have a beer.
author: Denise B.

description: ....If you tire of the grease at the Hi Dive next door try this one both are original greasy spoons...if they weren't on our waterfront they would have been long gone....if either were an In an Out burger the food would be 10X good and the lines around the block...
author: jim b.

description: Had a chili cheeseburger & the meat chili was good, but kind of made the bread soggy.  Very affordable & the bread they use (a large sourdough baguette is great).
author: Andy B.

description:
They emphasize that they are a "fast food" restaurant and when its you're turn in line you better be ready to hit the ground running, Order, pay and pretty much by the time you've picked up a bottle of ketchup and some tapatia hot sauce your burger & beer combo with fries is ready. The burgers are awesome, but I'm more of a hot dog fan. They have daily specials as well as kick ass clam chowder and GREAT fries. 
They also have a back patio with a makeshift bar where you can sit on a bird crap strewn pier and smile to yourself that you don't live across the bay... eeeuugh..
author: Mark G.

description: had the fish and chips, but i asked for onion rings instead of  fries, either way, batter over load.  some people wasn't to keen on the burgers, but you have to realize, its not a Harris ranch burger u r eating..  its a dive...  its good to 80% of the people that go here.  What makes this place a 4 star, atmosphere, the workers, the customers, the decor, and the scenery.    and also, seeing San Francisco finest, police officer eating here.  will try burgers next time.
author: Reese D.

description:
The day I got laid off Red's Java House was kind enough to allow me to drown my sorrows in many, many PBR's at 10 in the morning, and didn't judge when I asked for something with more of a kick.  This was pre-Bourdain, and though I haven't been post-Bourdain but I imagine it'd be the same.  

You can't beat the view.  It's great if your job just kicked you to the curb and you've got nothing better to do.  Bum a smoke, sit out back and have a beer.  Try it, you'll see.
author: Boots B.

description:
This place it great for sitting out in the sun and having a few beers.  Its right on the water, and easy to get to. 

Stars:
+1 for beer
+1 for Sun
+1 for The French Fries!~ so good
-1  for the baseball fans crowding up the joint. 
+1 for when they get drunk and fall in the bay
-1  for not using buns on their burgers.  Why can't you just use buns like everyone else?? Not some hard roll, that is a challenge in itself to bite through.
+1 for fast service
author: Joey R.

description:
After Talk threads said Red's Java House serves the best corned beef hash in town, I went for breakfast on Wednesday to check it out. Alas, they only serve cb hash on Saturdays, according to the guy running the show.  I'll go back in the next few weeks to get the skinny on the beef.  

I didn't realize that you order at the counter, and the waiter saw me sitting at a table waiting to order and didn't say anything - lame.  I finally figured it out and got a short stack of pancakes and a side of hash browns.  Both good.

It was a rainy day but I bet on a nice day it would be great to sit outside.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Let's get down to basics.  I'll take a cheese burger on a sour dough roll. And pass the french's mustard.  Plus one order of greasy french fries.  The fries are served in paper coffee cups. It is simple and it works.  Then top it off with an ice cold budweiser in a bottle. Then I will go out in the back and eat this on some picnic tables overlooking the bay with a view of the old workhorse called the Bay Bridge.

This little dive offers a nice view of the bay looking east from Pier 30..   We all need a little diner food grub every once in a while.  It's easy comfort food.  Plus this place has the most available parking of any restaurant in San Francisco. Its a gigantic parking lot called Pier 30.  Roll on in and get your burger and beer, fish and chips, morning breakfast, etc.  Just keep your eyes peeled for diving seagulls and pidgins.

Sometimes a colorful little dive is all I need on a relaxing day in the city.
author: Georgio N.

description:
I took my daughter and her boyfriend a couple of weeks ago to Red's Java House before attending the Giants game. I have season tickets so have eaten there several times. I have always enjoyed my meal, especially the double cheese burger. My daughter loved the fish and chips. 
I highly recommend stopping by before the game!
author: Paul M.

description:
I would normally give Red's 5 stars because it has everything I love...outdoor patio, greasy breakfasts, super-divey atmosphere, great peeps behind the counter. But they're getting docked one star because I really, really like the super-soft Wonderbread hamburger buns - and instead, Red's serves their burger on a hard sourdough roll. And I'm just  not a fan. 

But...other than that, the place is awesome. And their chili fries are off the hook. No better cure for a hangover, that's for sure!
author: Kate S.

description:
It's hard to rate this place, as it is a quite awesome place but for different reasons than you'd think.

Obviously, the views have been spoken for.  You get to sit on the pier and just hang out.  There are chairs, tables and umbrellas.

There are drinks available, including $1.75 PBRs (every day) and a few deals on Corona, Anchor and some other beers.  These of course enhance the previous point.

The food (at least the burgers) are relatively average but they are made very fast.  Make sure you request a hamburger bun, I think by default they come on the rather unweildy sour dough roll.

The prices are very low.  I thought my hangover had disabled my vision but the prices I was looking at were correct.  Most of the sandwiches and other meals come in at around $4.

So in summary, if you want a quick, cheap meal while enjoying some beers outdoors, you can't go wrong here.
author: Steven R.

description:
I've been coming here since the  Embarcadero freeway loomed over the place and "The Streets of San Francisco" was on ABC.  

And pretty much the place has only gotten better, well maybe not better but definitely cleaner.  And there's ladies, which was something you never saw.

I do wish donuts and candy bars were still on the menu.

But after reading some of the reviews, I just got to ask......What is wrong with you people?  No seriously what goes on in your heads?

Can't you tell just by looking at Red's what kind of place it is and what your "dinning experience" is going to be?

This isn't some restaurant consultant's  "ironic" idea of a diner.  This is a dinner.  A greasy spoon that used to serve greasy food to generally greasy customers.

You want organic, free range, balsamic, arugula, artisan, raw, sustainable, small scale, white table clothes, black turtleneck, well go somewhere else.

But if you want a burger, fries and a beer for under $10, this is the place. A place where a guy can get a good honest cheap meal and a good honest cheap drink.

Sadly this is one of the last place where it's still truly San Francisco.  

Not the San Francisco of Web 2.0, hipster, post-industrial, suburban transplants and NIMBY'ism. 

But the old San Francisco.  The working man's San Francisco filled with shipyards, steel mills, fisheries, breweries and shops.   Where the unstated rule was that no one bothered you as long as you didn't act like a jackass.

Don't get me wrong.  I love that the place is filled with fauxhemians and bright young things.  And it's great that Bourdain got all these people in the joint.  You guys are keeping the place open.

And please keep coming back.  Who knows in about 20 - 30 years, you'll wind up sitting in the back, smoking and drinking a bucket full of beer thinking about how good it was back in the day.
author: Richard W.

description:
If you don't like this place:

1) Don't add me.

2) Don't EVEN talk to me!

I heart Red's and I indulge in every last bit of fat, oil, and grease in just about everything they serve.  Everything in our society is too politically correct including our food!  Big ups to Red's for keeping it real.  I love their Breakfast Sandwich with eggs, cheese, and bacon on a french roll.  The french fries, onion rings, and fish 'n chips are all great.  Everyone who works there is efficient and friendly.  Tony's a sweetheart and says hello to me every morning as I walk to work.  I also love the diversity of the clientele - mornings = cops, fireman, construction workers; mid-day = just about everybody as the line out the front door would indicate; afternoon =  Giants fans and a more yuppy and sometimes corporate crowd or private party.  

Red's get 5 stars automatically because:

1) I love the quote they have on the chalkboard menu, "Leave your nights free, drink during the day."
2) They televised many World Cup matches last summer on their flat panel TV.  
3) You get free fries if you correctly answer their daily music trivia question.  Hey, it beats that damn Monopoly game at McDonald's, doesn't it?
author: Cdarling C.

description:
Let me relate a hypothetical situation:

There are those days when you show up to work, and perhaps you had a little too much to drink the night before. You get by until noon with some cereal you had in the morning, but by the time lunch rolls around, you realize you need some greasy goodness to satisfy your body's nutritious needs. Seeing as how you work a block away from Red's, the decision is clear.

Yes, it's fried. Yes, it's greasy. Yes, it's tasty. Fish and chips are a staple here, and it's a GREAT place to go on a nice day. Even if you have to walk more than a block to get here, you'll leave full and wanting a nap. What better way to spend a Friday afternoon at the office?
author: Matthew S.

description:
What's not to love about Red's?
It's right next to the ball park - there's no better place to go before a game. A burger and a beer for under $10...or you can just go straight to the beer and get ridiculously cheap pitchers during their game-day happy hour. And hopefully if you're headed to a Giant's game, that means the weather is nice out, which makes Red's large outdoor seating area (right on the water) all the more fantastic.
author: Devin G.

description: Red's is awesome.  Good place to grab a Red's Burger, fries and a beer.  They got a pretty good Fish & Chips too.  Great spot to go for lunch. In the back, they have a patio and yes there is a bar.  Been going here for years, even before their expansion, when The Man "Reds" was still flipping the burgers and hot dogs.  Just a note, if you gonna order the burger, don't be asking to put your burger in a regular bun.  Plain waste.  Enjoy the burger as is.
author: Willy L.

description: A unique blue collar lunch shack right on the water at Pier 30 directly underneath the Bay Bridge.  What a fun place, with lots of charm and character on the walls in the form of old photographs and newspaper articles, its apparently been there since 1923.  They serve up some great basic burgers, hot dogs, sandwiches and french fries, and you can eat either inside where there are a limited number of cafeteria-style tables and a little counter, or outside at one of the tables around the back with nice views of the Bay or in front on one of the concrete block sitting areas along Embarcadero. A real San Fran experience and lots of fun.
author: Rick H.

description:
If you want gourmet, walk across the street.

If you want cheap eats and experience one helluva SF landmark, come here.  

I actually like the food.
author: Larry A.

description: Red's is the best "dive" in town: a genuine "back in the day" longshoreman's haunt that serves the best fish'n'chips and double cheeseburgers in town.  The walls are filled with SF memorabilia and it has a large outdoor dining area.
author: Terry K.

description:
It pains me to do this, but I have never seen a filthier restaurant.  Seriously.

Granted, I sat inside instead of outside (which would Definitely be the way to go on a nice day).  But... should it have been so repugnant?

a) the trashcan was absolutely filthy.
b) the tables & everything on them were filthy.  Plus, Red's was slow---so no excuse not to come out from behind the counter & wipe them off.
c) the floor...filthy.

Plus, no lettuce or tomato on your burger?  Please.  & the burger was too small for the bread.

Red's put me in a bad mood.  I used to love it so much.  Sigh.
author: Holly F.

description:
I feel sooo bad giving Red's 2 stars because it's the kind of place you really want to like. Small and unpretentious, been around forever...you get the idea. And some friends from the office enjoyed what all agreed was a yummy breakfast one morning - so how could lunch not be good?

I'm not at all up on the whole Bourdain/No Reservations thing, so I wouldn't have known he praised it so heavily were it not for info from one of the said work friends. We decided to check Red's out for lunch on a beautiful, warm SF day - just the kind of day Red's orders up. 

Apparently, Bourdain lauded the chili cheese fries - so I ordered those to split. They're pretty good, but don't come close to Taylor's down the street, which feature higher quality chili and cheese (for, yes, a higher price). On chili cheese fries alone, I'd have given Red's 3 stars.

However, the burger is LAME. There's nothing I can say no one else has. Small, flat patty, way too much mustard drowning out any other flavor, and overly large, chewy sourdough bread hiding the few "extras" on the burger - onions and pickles, maybe? I find this odd, since I specifically ordered my burger with "everything." Apparently, lettuce and tomato are not in Red's wheelhouse.

So...I don't know. I trust my friends' breakfast review, and might try that. But for a burger and fries on the Embarcadero with outdoor seating...hello, Taylor's...you always have been, and always will be, the one for me.
author: Kiesha R.

description: We always stop here when we enter the city. Great breakfast sandwiches and fun menu. Prices are unbelievably good for San Francisco. In and out time is fast. Fun place on the water with great pictures on the wall.
author: Bob V.

description:
I have a made-up story in my head about Red's:

Once upon a time there were two sailors who shipwrecked on Pier 30 There, they found an old fishing shack and they decided to set up a restaurant. Neither of them could cook very well, which explains the food, but everybody appreciated their salty mannerisms, including the cantankerous signs posted around the restaurant. Because they were sailors and not restaurateurs by nature, they often ran out of things like fish for fish and chips and chicken.  However, all these things miraculously added to the charm and authenticity of the place. Plus the booze was cheap and the back patio heavenly in the sun. 

Or maybe it's nice to find a place in SF that has zero pretensions. Anyhoo...I love it, even if the food ain't that hot.

*****************************
Update:

Alright, I'm removing one star even though I still love the location. Don't even think of getting fish and chips or chicken after lunch. They have been out the last 4 times I was there. If it happens on a regular basis, don't you think you would....dunno...order more???
author: Eli B.

description:
There is no better place before a game.  Momo's? No thank you.  Red's?  Hell yeah!  

Pitchers of beer, sitting outside, looking at all the other fans... it's perfect.  The food is very cheap as well.  

I advise that you stand to the right side of the outside bar... I am always overlooked when I stand on the left hand side... so I don't do that anymore.
author: Brittney B.

description: Came here before Opening Day yesterday and it was as good as ever. Double Cheese Burger with Fries and a couple pitchers of beer to wash it down...nothing better before a ballgame!
author: Brendan S.

description: A wonderful old beat-up joint that cranks out great breakfast burritos, burgers, and fun.  You gotta love a place that has a menu that includes "Burger and Beer" on it!  BUT - the hidden gem of this joint is the corned beef hash.  It's only sold on the weekends, and usually runs out early.  Order it "crispy" - which means they put it on the grill for a few minutes.  You'll thank me for the rest of your life!  Melts in your mouth, and you will never be happy with hash anywhere else!  Sit inside if it's cold, or out on the patio and look at the Bay and Bay Bridge.  It's a short walk to the ballpark, and this place is jumping before, during and after Giants games.
author: Marcus L.

description:
I love this place for the simple fact that it is one of the only dog friendly places in South Beach. Great place to have a simple bite to eat and enjoy a cold beer. And you sure can't beat the prices. You can get a burger and a beer for less than the price of a beer at Momo's!
Staff is also super friendly and if you do like dogs there are always some playing in the grass!!
author: Lisa A.

description:
OK, so I just finished pissing all over the Embarcadero Waterfront (in my previous Yelp review, I mean...not literally! Although it's always a wise idea to watch where you step after I've been in my cups...), so I will now atone for the geographical slandering by slathering praise all over my favorite no-sass, no-attitude hang on the Embarcadero shores.

They got cheap food. They got cheap decor left over from the middle of last century. And they got cheap beer. But the view...hell, the view is a fuckin' million bucks. Sit there on the pier and gaze up at azure skies, kick up your boots and watch those suckers on the Bay Bridge curse at traffic while you nuzzle up to a cold, refreshing beer.

Sometimes life treats you right. 

Red, wherever you are, I thank you.

JG

PS: What's all this "java" nonsense about, anyway? They sell beer! Who buys coffee when there's beer to be drunk?!? Oh, right, you're gonna tell me that if Starbucks copied Red and sold PBR at $1.75 per tallboy, you'd still throw 'em $3 for a mocha? Lies. Damn lies.
author: John G.

description:
Good, serviceable, filling food. 

The back patio rocks on a late morning wearing into warm sunshine.

The counter girl takes your order and swigs a beer in between customers.

Totally laid back location full of actual locals (not bug eye sunglass wearing, there-to-be-seen wanna be hipsters) and the staff doesn't care if you chill for a bit.

There's not much to love here.  You can't go wrong with the vibe, the price or the location.
author: Suze C.

description: Ditto to most people's reviews...simple yet tasty food, good atmosphere, fun place to visit.
author: John G.

description: For those trashing Anthony Bourdain and his love for this place, all I gotta say is, you're completely missing the point.  And if you don't get the point of Red's Java House, then you surely don't need to come to Red's Java House.
author: Shawn S.

description:
the menu at this place always cracks me up.  It rambles on something like this:
...
13. Hotdog w/ ketchup $2.15
14. Hotdog w/ mustard $2.20
15. Hotdog w/ ketchup & Fries $2.45
16. Cheese Burger w/ ketchup & Fries $2.65
17. Hotdog & Burger w/ ketchup & Fries $3.45
18. Hotdog & Burger & Fries $3.45
19. Burger & Fries $2.45

the place gets 5 stars for it's old school SF charm.
author: Brent H.

description:
This place is awesome. Easily one of my favorite spots in San Francisco, and one of the very few things I still like about this neighborhood. In WW2 the liberty ships docked on the pier behind Red's, and my grandpa sat there chomping burgers and nursing hangovers before heading back out to sea. At least, so he told me. The shack has since been knocked down and rebuilt though you can't really tell it. $5 will score you a burger, fries and a PBR. How do you get better than that? Well, you could trump it with a fluffy pancake, egg and bacon the next morning. If you opt to enjoy the salty smell of the bay out back, don't sit up from your plate until you've eaten everything. Those darn seagulls will mob your food in a split second!

5 stars for authenticity, the bargain, and the food!
author: Alex C.

description:
So, my neighbors rave about this place. I finally go and I was dissapointed. The ambiance is great and for the price and ability to sit on the water, the prices were EXTREMELY reasonable. I love views and I love the water, but the food was not so great.

I think I may have ordered the wrong food. They are known for burgers and that's what I should have gotten. Instead, I get soggy toast, fatty bacon, and soggy french fries. I will eat almost all french fries, these even soaked in ketchup did not work for me. I am sorry, but they were bad. 

Great views, maybe some great things. I will give it another shot, but don't even think about getting the fries. Sit outside, have a cold beer or soda, and try a burger, as that is what they are known for.
author: Christopher W.

description: LOVE this place.  Fish & Chips, Burgers on Sourdough with onion rings, the ususal faves.  Grabbing these along with a pitcher to sit out by the water is what it's all about.  Mingle with the locals, shoo'ing away the birds, the smell of the the Bay and a view of the Bay Bridge.  Where else would you rather be before a Giants game.  It's even a cool hang out on NO game days.  Lucky for me it's a 10 min walk from work.  Hmmm...*plotting for lunch tomorrow*
author: Stephanie D.

description: Great dive bar to hit up before going to a Giants game. The food is really jst ok but they have this huge dock on the water where you can eat so if its nice out you can't beat a beer and a corona on a sunny day
author: Michael C.

description:
If you love San Francisco you have to love Reds Java House. Reds Java House is a place right out of Herb Canes San Francisco.  If you work in the financial district and have an hour for lunch a nice stroll down the waterfront will be rewarded with an i quick inexpensive and satisfying meal. 
This place has class and by that I mean 'working class' a real blue collar joint. For less that five bucks you can hunker down for chow in one of the last remaining hangouts for red blooded working men. This place is a taste of classic San Francisco.
author: Rodney W.

description: Headed out here for lunch on a Friday and thought there would be no lines since the GIANTS were playing a night game. Wrong! Line was snaked out the door! Ordered the 2x cheesburger and onion rings. Wow, I should've ordered the single patty! It was good (and cheap) considering that Red's don't provide tomatoes/lettuce and cooked however the chef felt at the moment (no red can be seen..........ever!). I loved the sourdough bread and their onions are really good. I like the outdoor seating. Next time, I'm trying the f&C.
author: Marcus Y.

description:
Red's Java House has been a San Francisco institution since 1956 when only dockworkers lunched along the Embarcadero and "fancy" was a fightin' word. 

Best deal is the burger and beer for $3

The burgers and sandwiches come on French rolls smeared with mayo, mustand and not much else.
author: Bumble B.

description:
Here's what I got for my $10.50 (incl. tip) today:

cheeseburger: not so good, although the fish and chips looked dope
fries: decent, not great
can of Coke: nicely chilled
a beer: Bud on tap in a plastic cup
weather: perfectly warm and sunny, light breeze
views: the Bay, Bay Bridge, Port of Oakland, South Beach
conversation: with a guy who lives on a boat and was drinking a pitcher by himself at 2 in the afternoon on a Wednesday

On a sunny weekday afternoon, after the lunchtime rush, this is my favorite place in San Francisco to sit and do nothing.
author: Josh K.

description:
My boyfriend says I need to start not liking places so I can stop giving everything 4 or 5 stars on Yelp. The thing is, to me, if a place is honest about what they are, I choose to go there, and they live up to what they say they are, I'm happy. 

So I continue to dole out top marks with Red's Java House. I went here last night before a Giant's game.  I'm withholding the 5th star because I wasn't in love with the hamburger (the bread overwhelmed the burger), but I can't knock outdoor cheap beers before a sporting event any further. It's a great place to stop before a game and hang with some local fans. If you have a big group get there a little early to grab a table. It's gritty, it's real and I love it.

$3.75 for a Sam Adams? Yeah, I'll be back soon.
author: Katie W.

description: If you like cold fries then by all means go to this place. The view is really nice though.
author: Johanna W.

description: Red's is a destination.  Ride there on a sunny day.  Post up on the pier-top patio with a cold beer, gaze out into the Bay, chat with Giants fans, and smoke until you choke. The lowbrow but well-made greasy spoon fare is just salty enough to make you order another bucket of PBR.  Winning!
author: Eric S.

description:
After seeing this place on No Reservations, I decided to stop in with a friend from out of town.  I've never been so embarrassed at picking a place to meet for lunch.  I ordered a double cheeseburger, fries, and a beer.  The fries were decent, but the burger was bad.  Two *thin* slices of beef smashed in a huge, overly-chewy sourdough roll.  My "grilled onions "weren't on the grill for more than 2 seconds.  

I honestly don't see what the big deal is here.  I've had a better cheeseburger at Carls Jr.  

To top it all off, i witnessed the guy behind the counter be a total dick to the guy in front of me while he was ordering.  Won't be going back.
author: Jon M.

description: Serious cheese burger.  Don't ask for tomatoes.
author: T. L.

description:
I love to eat outside and this has great views.  Its right on Pier 30 and has the very best Bloody Mary you can find in SOMA.  

If you are good at music trivia you can get free fries if you can answer some hard questions.
author: Bay N.

description:
Went here for the first time when the AVP tour was in town.  I don't know how many times I've driven by this place and asked myself, "i wonder what they serve".  Well I finally found out.

Burgers, Fries, breakfast Sandwiches are the norm here, but what's really great about it is the service.  Everyone is just super nice.  They make you feel welcomed right off the bat.  That impressed me a lot.

The burgers and breakfast sandwiches are served on a nice toasted sourdough roll, and are decent.  They're not exactly Red Robin here, but for the price ($3) it's good enough.  The fires were a bit less to be desired though.

Looking at it from the outside you'd think this place is all alone and by itself (Hi-Dive bar is next door) and wonder how many people actually frequent this place.  Granted i was at an event that had 1k+ people there and food selection was bleak, but if you do drive by on any normal day, you'll actually see a pretty good crowd here.
author: Yehoy L.

description:
I work within walking distance of this place and have yet to get there.   Beer, Burger, and Fries for $10?   Sold!   

The burgers come on sourdough bread so be ready for a chew-a-thon.  
So it's not the greatest burger, but it's pretty solid and quick.  Tons of mustard and onions which you should be forewarned of.  The fries are pretty decent and come fresh.  Go there on a nice day and chill outside.  Fish and Chips is pretty tasty (and way too big), but only a Friday special.
author: Simon Y.

description:
Cheap, good, and great for outdoor dinning when the weather is right.
Great for a burger before a Giants game or a great cheap brunch on a nice Sunday morning.
author: Joe D.

description: Great burgers/fries before the baseball game. I also saw this place on "No Reservervations" as well, but i had walked by a hundred times always wanted to go in. If you like Burgers you will love this place.
author: Justin S.

description: Our group of five ladies (nicely dressed and well-behaved) were on our second pitcher of beer on the patio. They close at 5pm, but at 4:30 we were told we had to leave that very second and could not finish our beer because "all the customers are at the North Beach festival, we're closing early so we can go home".  "But aren't we your customers?" "Sorry - you need to leave." What?!  We were so shocked - we just left and said nothing. Never again will we return.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Great pancakes and even better location!!  Perfect place to go to hungover on a gorgeous weekend morning or before a ball game.
The owner just changed recently(Feb 2009??)  So hope not much will change.
author: Chase F.

description:
Great piece of SF history!  Burgers are made how they originally were in 1918 when brought back from Germany after WWI by American servicemen... hilarious when snotty tourists scream at the cooks they forgot the lettuce and tomato, and the cooks bluntly saying "we don't make 'em like that."  The customer is NOT always right!  Hah!
Besides burgers on sourdough with real cheddar, they've got the usually burger-shop fare of other fried things and sandwiches.

The kicker: there's an open-air bar out back with seating on the pier... great views of the East Bay and the Bay Bridge.  Makes for a great day on a sunny weekend with folks, and a game on.  And did I mention $1 PBRs?  I'm so there!
author: Cooper S.

description: Cheeseburgers on sourdough rolls are the best!  The Supreme includes pickles, mustard and mayo.  They don't serve tomatoes or lettuce so bring your own or just sub with a Bloody Mary.  The deck makes the visit so much better.  If you bike you can lock up just out back.
author: Eileen L.

description:
First step into this joint, you know what to expect - NOTHING fancy shmancy here. if you want a dog, you get a dog, you want a burger, you get a burger, nothing altered or catered to any particular taste.  My pet peeve is when resturants have 50 variations of burgers. Reds stay loyal to a true burger and a true hot dog. 

My first time, I ordered double dog, coke and fries. Best hot dog meal i've ever had. The bread, a nice chewy bagget/hoagie style bread, freshly toasted, jsut the way i like (not the soft spongy kind), the meat, juicy, salty with a nice snap when you bite into it. The fries, you cannot beat! always fresh and hot. 

This is a great place for laid back lunch, somethign simple, and on nice days, you can sit on warf out back, and enjoy the sunny day.
author: Mai T.

description:
I used to work directly across the street from Reds... Umm... Take out:  The grease from the fish 'n chips soaking through the brown bag.. Dining in:  Sittin' in the fenced off parking lot area as seagulls tried to steal your food.

That being said, it was cool being able to grab lunch at Reds, and now that I work on the other side of The Bay I miss having access to the 'ol place.

F*ck the Raiders.. NINERS!
author: umlaut i.

description: Great place to grab a burger and a beer on the way to a Giants game. If you are a hippie; move along, there's nothing to see here.
author: Brian M.

description:
If there's anything I like more than a $2 beer while sitting on a sunny bay-side patio its eating a $2 hamburger while sitting on a sunny bay-side patio.

Note to yelpers, this place is about as dive as it comes, and you have to be prepared to dodge pigeon intruders.

Someone told me once that you could see this place in the background in one of the Dirty Harry movies, but I have seen these movies a couple of times each, and have yet to see this place, but if you have, please do tell.
