Sidenote, I heard that as of a year or two ago, the city of San Francisco was going to triple their rent cost, so this place may not be around for that much longer.

Hopefully it will.
author: Alex H.

description: After watching the segment on No Reservations, I decided I wanted to try Red's Java House. I recently went there on a sunny saturday afternoon to tackle this burger. The service is very quick, Easy to Read Menu's,  The burgers were really good. However I felt there was too much bread for my tasted. The Onion Rings and Fries were crispy and delicious. I would defnitely go back there again
author: Eric Y.

description:
One star for service
One star for Ok chili cheese fries, 
The cheeseburger here was very disappointing. I'm aware that sourdough bread is a big SF thing, but it was way too much bread. When they said they don't have lettuce and tomato, that made me think it would be one delicious beef patty that they didn't want to cover up with toppings. I was wrong. Their meat is strange. It has no texture, more creamy than meaty, it was very thin and no seasoning at all (or so it seemed). The onions are chopped too big for my taste, and I asked for no onions but got them anyway. The chili cheese fries were not what I expected. I thought there would be a stronger flavour from the chili; it was a little bland. It didn't taste bad though, so I gave it a star. The service was really good. The lady taking our order told us what the best deal was and was very friendly. 
I almost forgot to mention the pigeons. They run around all inside the restaurant... even in the kitchen. It's kinda gross. They need to keep the back door closed. They're cute, but i'd rather not be visited by them unless i'm sitting outside.
author: Jen F.

description:
I know people love this place.  I'm torn.  I've been here a few times, and I must say, I'm disappointed overall.  I think for me, it's the service.  The last time we went, the woman who took our order, just couldn't get it.  All we wanted was two cheeseburgers and an order of fries to share.  She started having a conversation with the cooks in the middle of the order - and then we had to repeat what we wanted.  Then she stopped again for some reason, and we repeated our order again.  Then she read the order back to us, and it was wrong - and she got frustrated at us!  Not good.   My husband and I were the only two customers in the place, by the way.

When we got our food, we basically had small burger patties and a lot of bread.   It was not a burger.  I will admit the parts where I actually had meat with the bread was good.   Kudos.  But for the second half of my "burger" it was just bread with mustard on it.  The fries were forgettable.  I write that because I honestly don't remember them or if I liked them or not.

I remember the first time I went, it was with coworkers years ago.  The burgers were good!  And I remember thinking what a deal they had with the burger and beer combo.  It was cheap!  Not any more.  I mean, they're not $$$, but they're not $.  

I think I'll save my money and toast my own baguette with mustard at home.
author: Denise M.

description:
Had another great meal at the waterfront.
Jerome did a good job.
author: don h.

description:
It's a very rare occasion that I actually log into Yelp and sound off for or against any business. Having lived in the city for a few years- and encountered the full spectrum of quality- I have to at least attempt to save someone else from wasting their money at Red's, even if it is only a few dollars. 

My boyfriend and I rode our bikes down to Red's on a fantastic weekend afternoon to have a burger on the water and enjoy the view. I sat outside while he went to the counter to order, and couldn't help but notice the obvious smell of garbage. The outdoor seating area literally smells like you are eating in a dumpster. That combined with the overly loud and obnoxious group of regulars at the table next to us (proclaiming how much they loved the place) should have clued me in to what I was in for regarding lunch. 

Everyone who has said that a $0.69 McDonald's cheeseburger looks like a gourmet delight next to their burger was right on. I have no idea what prompted someone to slap a precooked, paper thin, flavorless patty on a huge hunk of sourdough...drown it in mustard and call it a "burger". It's essentially a mustard and pickle sandwich with no flavor other than the condiments. The coke cans we received with our order were hella dirty, and the onion rings were nothing more than previously frozen, deep fried batter. I could find no onion inside. If I had bought my own lunch and wasn't bound by courtesy, I would have taken one bite and tossed it out- and headed over to Pearl's in lower Nob Hill for a real (and still inexpensive) burger. 

I really wanted Red's to be a hidden gem, and a dive worth visiting when in need of a hangover meal or pregame one day. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place if you have any personal standards of cleanliness, quality, or common sense.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I have season tickets right on the field and therefore am aware of places to eat around the park and all I have to say is this place is the best. Food is cheap, good and filling. Plus it is right on the water so you have nice views. A dive all the way but I love dives. 

And it seems that yelpers are giving this place 5's just like me so yelpers much be cheap, great food lovers like I am. Go RED's.
author: Terry H.

description:
A friend of mine suggested that we take our lunch break here, and I'm glad he did. Its location (the pier) and ambiance (kinda gritty yet civilized) is just what I was hoping to see more of when I moved to San Francisco.

The counter guy was gruff and friendly and suggested we try the fish and chips. Dude had me sold at "fish." Too bad there isn't much of that here: Mostly burgers and other landlubber food.

The fish was good and I liked the fries -- and you will too if you like how McDonald's makes them. I'm serious when I say I hate steak-cut fries and crinkle-cut fries.

My friend ordered a cheeseburger, and it arrived immediately (as literally as possible. Right there and then.), and he said it was kind of cold.

The lunch rush seemed to start at around 12:45.
author: Amy Z.

description:
If you're driving on Embarcadero and pass this place, you wouldn't be alone in thinking the name was Red's Java Shack. But you'll be surprised to know Red's has a lot of seating. Most of it is outside in a little area with million-dollar views of the bay, the bridge, and the ballpark.

Red's expansive menu includes seafood salad sandwiches and tofu patties, but most people order the sloppy, artery-narrowing burgers. The classic: a cheeseburger and fries, sets you back $7.60. The owner tells you to take a seat--they'll call you when it's ready--but if you're sweet, he'll deliver the order to your seat. (He might call you Your Highness, though.)
author: William L.

description:
This place was Grubbin!!!  I went to Red's this weekend because I had seen good reviews of the place so my fiance and I decided to check it out!  This is a small place where the service is friendly and personal and the food is exceptional!  I was pleasantly surprised when I ordered the Corned Beef Has and expected the canned stuff but it was made with real chunks of corned beef.  It was seasoned to perfection and came with two eggs and toast.  My fiance had the two egg breakfast with a pancake and bacon.  Everything was delicious and the price was right at $14.99 for the two of us with a cup of coffee!  

Great location before the ball game or just to hang out on the water.
author: Henry S.

description:
I don't like the burgers here - the concept of a tiny patty overpowered by a thick, crusty piece of sourdough is not appealing to me.

That being said, try the veggie cheeseburger here with a normal bun. It is fantastic. I love sitting out on the back patio over the water with a beer on a sunny day but be warned: you will lose all motivation to return to work if you do this.
author: Jessica C.

description:
UPDATE 8/27/09 - Ever since Red's has changed ownership, I feel like the quality of food has gone down. Last time I went in and ordered a burger with onion rings I got soggy refried onion rings that I watched them dump back into the fryer to warm up. They were the kind that seem strangely processed like they were extruded from some funky onion ring machine (like the kind that come at Burger King). Needless to say the onion rings came out tasting like sad, greasy oil biscuits.

Then to make matters worse, I watched them put a burger that had been sitting on the backburner into my bun. It was really the saddest burger I've ever had. I'm never going back. Even their coffee tastes like Foldger's now. 

# # # 

If you're looking for diner breakfast, it doesn't get any better than this. Red's has a limited menu, but its two egg breakfast with bacon and hashbrowns is the best in the city. THE BEST IN THE CITY!

You wanna know why? It's the hashbrowns and bacon, both of which are cooked to a perfect crispy, greasy perfection. The hashbrowns are fried *hard* on one side, flipped once and fried hard again allowing for one sheet of crispy, crunchy fried goodness that is lite and fluffy on the inside. Toast comes slathered in melted butter, and I always get my eggs over medium because once or twice I asked for over easy and sunny side up and got runny whites which is NOT OK.

Another reason why it's the best dinner breakfast in town is that Red's doesn't serve crappy dinner coffee! The coffee is ground fresh on location and is definitely NOT Foldgers. 

And lastly, it's the "manbiance" (like ambiance, but manlier). When I go in the morning, the place is full of manly, blue collar types: construction workers, police officers, firemen and dock workers, usually bearded and older. I like to sip my coffee as I wait patiently for my breakfast, listening to the oldies and imagine that I am a fisherman, headed out early for the morning's first catch. YEAH RIGHT. I'm really just there for the hashbrowns and MENZ watching.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Cut out early from work and spend a sunny afternoon on the back deck.  The FISH N' CHIPS are among the best in the city (and, as said previously by another spot-on reviewer, "impossibly cheap.")  And the cranky (is it an act?) man behind the counter taking food orders reminds of my home-town back in New England--"Just give me da' owdah'!"

Beer is great, food is great, atmosphere is great, especially on a warm sunny day.  Bring the sunscreen!
author: J M.

description: What can you say about this place? It's a San Francisco tradition. Nothing better than eating a burger on the waterfront dodging seagulls as you much on fries. They are a no nonsense spot. Great place to grab a burger, but they also have daily specials and hot dogs. You can't beat the view!
author: Lori F.

description: This place is famous. Saturday morning corned beef and hash is a stand by. Aside from that the food is nothing spectacular but there's something about the no frills setting and service that makes this spot perfect. Just don't turn your back to the gulls they will pounce on your plate and gobble up your food in an instant.
author: Alex S.

description: If you're not a local, and drive, they do have free parking in the lot next to them, but make sure you park in designated spots. Like what everyone says this place looks like a shack. Burgers were okay, not something I would go out of my way for. Burgers come on sourdough roll, with pickles mustard and larger chopped onions. 2 burgers and 1 order of onion rings came out to be $11.
author: Robin L.

description: Went in there with the intention of not caring about anything I ate.  This is not the healthiest choice, but it's not trying to be.  It is exactly what it is supposed to be.  A solid hole in the wall with some serious grub.  A bit of chili cheese fries and a double cheeseburger later, I left completely satisfied.  The french role as the bun threw me off on the burger, but it totally worked.  This is definitely recommended!
author: John R.

description:
Definitely one of the best breakfasts in the city!  The building has a lot of history..it's been there for a long time and it's great to peruse through all the historical photographs on the wall.  It's located underneath the bay bridge, and they have an outdoor patio in the back...but it's definitely a java/diner shack.  It is not fancy and the views are not that spectacular.  You see dirty green bay water....but if you're willing to overlook that-then the you'll be fine.  

My breakfast platter of toast, 2 eggs over medium, hash browns, and sausage-delicious.  Just the perfect amount of grease but with flavor.  Home cooked breakfast like my mom used to make.  You have to grab your own silverware out of the container and pour your own coffee, but a pleasant find.
author: Toni L.

description: Red's is such an institution in San Francisco and I'm glad I finally checked it out last week. It's pretty quality food, especially for the price. The burgers were good, but not as amazing as Anthony Bourdain made them seem on his SF episode. The fish 'n chips, however, were most excellent - nice and flaky and not too greasy. Pairs well with their wonderfully cheap beer.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
What can I say about Reds- it's a great place to meet, greet, chill, drink, DRINK- morning, noon and night (they do close early, that may be my major complaint). 

Go for some of the food, go for the beer, the bloodies on a weekend morning, the view, the lack of posers often found at other spots, the outstanding people watching - I've even witnessed Dept. of Water workers sling back beers on their lunchbreaks and drive right off the lot...

A bucket of beer after work before a giants game is pretty much the way to go. You may find yourself skipping the game and the $7 beers.
author: Lynn B.

description:
Red's is the greasy spoon diner down by the bay. I'll have a two burger and beer lunch any day of the week.
The best part is that only locals and folks who enjoy the nostalgia of a diner on the water will eat  here.
author: Jon F.

description:
Oh.my.god. this place reached new heights in greasy deliciousness (thereby earning an additional star) when i went for lunch this past Saturday.  I ordered a single cheeseburger and no fries, and they totally got my order wrong, but I have no complaints, since I ended up with a DOUBLE cheeseburger WITH fries.
The cheeseburger, which comes with cheese, mustard, onion, and pickles, is served on crusty sourdough bread, which adds a San Francisco twist to an American classic.  So glad they messed up and gave me a double cheeseburger, as I was starving and this really hit the spot.  And their fries are great, especially if you like how McDonald's makes their fries...thin, salty, and just the right amount of crunch.
Sure, it's not the healthiest lunch spot in the world, but it sure does satisfy one's greasy cravings!  And, to their defense, they do serve egg salad sandwiches, which are marginally healthier...I think.
author: Nina B.

description: Great place to chill outside but now over the last three years the burgers are way worse and now no good.  So undercooked most of the time.  I used to love this palce but now it makes me feel sick and half the time I cant even eat the entire burger due to it falling apart.  They went cheaper on their patties and raised their prices.  Still nice people who work there but burgers are just ehhhhh now.  Sorry hate to write this review.
author: Harry E.

description:
The pancakes here are amazing!  I used to live a mile away from this place and we would come here almost every Saturday to eat breakfast.  It is really good and really cheap and the guy at the front is hilarious.

Hint: it can get really cold inside so bring a jacket.
author: Jen M.

description: Great lunch spot!!! Free parking on the Embarcadero, outdoor tables, good burgers, Anchor Steam and all within walking distance from AT&T Park. Burgers are served on fresh sourdough rolls, offered with fries and a beer lunch deals. Most under $10. A true San Francisco gem on the waterfront.
author: john h.

description: Come here and just stick to the basics. An order of French fries and a hot dog or burger. My first time here I ordered something more premium and did not feel the price matched the quality of the food. I spent a whole lot and didn't even have a drink in hand. Looking back, my food was actually not great at all. Chilicheese hotdog and onion rings had a taste similar to seasoned cardboard. I'm just sayin'
author: Aldrich S.

description: Great place right before a ball game.  Except 1) I'm from Los Angeles--- wrong ball game 2) This burger, which happens to be bigger than my large korean face, is lacking in flavor.  Nonetheless, big portions, great patio, and great pitchers of beer for a good price.  Beer= liquid forgiveness and source of "bubble farts" :D
author: Ivy S.

description:
This is the best place to go if you are on budget before a game at SBC.  Beer and a burger for less than $5?  It almost costs that much to take MUNI round trip!  Go get 'em, it is worth the stupid wait.

P.S. With the food, don't expect an $8 for $2.  It is a $2 burger through and through.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Golly, remind me not to indulge in Red's deliciously fresh, flaky but oh-so-greasy fish n' chips when I am either a) sober or b) on my lunch break, needing to actually be productive when I return. 

Well worth the slight tummy-ache and batter-induced food coma. 

Minus one star for lack of ANYTHING remotely healthy, except a lonely veggie burger. Then again, I guess healthy isn't really the point. Cheers a $2 PBR to that!
author: Jenni D.

description:
Great Food
Great View
Great atmosphere
Great BAR
Great Prices
Go Giants!

So if your looking to grab a bite to eat for WAY less than anything you would pay for inside AT&T park, and have it taste 100% as good then go to Red's. This place has been there for years, well before the new ball park was built. 

The people who work there are down to earth, the prices for food and the bar are amazing considering standard rates for a beer or adult beverage in the city. 

The decor is fun and funny all at once. 

Last thing, if you go to the kfog kaboom on peir 30 and want to use the bathroom at Red's have some respect for the staff, they hate that day, or so they say and would like to not have to deal with your hijinx !
author: Andrew W.

description: Red's is a local place to get a good (not extraordinary) burger with a bunch of other fried varieties and beer. On my most recent trip, we were "let in" close to closing and were the few left inside. The owner acts like he doesn't care, but he was still a pretty cool guy, who knows what goes on a burger MEAT!
author: Dennis S.

description: I was with my brother before the SF Giants game, and it was the Aubrey Huff's bobblehead give away. So, I decided to stop in and try their single cheese burger with the soda and I was very disappointed with it. Although, their bread was good. It was a  fresh crunchy sourdough bread.  When I'd received my burger, it seems to be so plain and dry. The cheese wasn't melted at all after watching an episode on Anthony Bourdain No Reservation a few months ago. Anthony ended up getting a double cheese burger  with his coffee, and on tv it looked very good. The cheese was rendering out of his hand as he was taking the bite. From it all, maybe I will try their breakfast instead.
author: Julie V.

description:
So about a year ago my I was driving my 1990 Mazda MPV mini van across the bay bridge with 6 of my friends on a way to a fieldtrip. As we hopped on the freeway leaving the city and got to the point where everyone merges on to the bridge, the timing belt snapped and we were that mornings hold up on the approach. Got towed to treasure island and made our way back to the city via muni. We had time to kill and walking along the Embarcadero the decision was made to make the best of the situation and head to Red's Java house for burgers and bloody mary's. 

Simplicity. Bare essentials. A burger and a beer for lunch. Great views of the waterfront and the bridge. Red's was the perfect escape that day to enjoy ourselves and have a drink midday. The bar in the back is a nice touch to the outdoor patio under the sun. 

I've been here plenty of times before Giants games since the walk to the park is just minutes away and Red's definitely provides a much cheaper eating option. The burgers come on a roll with simply onions and pickles. Their fish and chips special provides a nice alternative to the occasional burger or dog. They also have daily specials ranging from bbq beef sandwiches to reubens. Service is friendly and quick. 

The old school shack of a restaurant adds to it's character as a simple pleasure along the waterfront.
author: Ryan L.

description:
OK burgers, gruffly friendly counter service (I like it). I feel like I've travelled back in time, or possibly to a roadside diner in Massachusetts, yet the place is beyond unpretentious. Firemen and cops eat here.

Cheap. Filling. Worth a stop on the SF burger tour, not for the burger itself, but instead for the total immersion experience. Great views, too.
author: Pat T.

description:
Red's Java House is a burger place sitting by the pier 30.  You come here not for the food, but for the water view and hanging out with a few friends or colleagues.

There is free parking at the back of the building, but it is totally not worth a long drive to try RJH.  You come here because you work or live close to it.

Did I mention don't have expectation on its food?
author: Alex T.

description:
Excellent food in a total dive.

Complete meals for about $7. Awesome place. Right on the water. Real people: MUNI drivers and construction workers all diving into the heavy breakfasts. Mellow people hanging out on the patio during the day for cheap burgers and beer. Ideal place for a sunny day.
author: Tim B.

description:
ahhh... it is home.  It is many things to many people, but to be it has always and will be home.

It is not only cheap, but with a bit of sludge.  Want lettuce and juicy tomato with your burger, do ask, they don't have it.  This place has been around longer than the Bay Bridge and they have a photos to prove it.

Swing over for free parking and chill out at the patio in the back.  Have a "few" $1.50 PBRs and stagger out to the end of the pier.  the food is greasy and the chilly will burn a hold in your stomach, but at lest the prices will not torch a hold in your wallet.

In simple terms, hands down the best and FIRST dive bar in SF.
author: Jai D.

description:
This is the old school San Francisco dock worker/dive bar/cheap eats/on the water combo of your dreams.  It is likely that the food is neither local, nor organic, nor sustainable, nor seasonal.  But come on, you get enough of that stuff anyway.  

Sometimes you just want order a burger and fries for under freakin' $5.  Afterwards, you can order a bucket of beers, sit on the deck, and watch the water, seagulls and the questionable out of towners.
author: Mike K.

description:
San Francisco Institution. Anthony Bourdain loved this place and put it on his tv show, great because only a natural disaster can take the beloved reds out now!  Best greasy burger in town. Get it on the thick San Francisco sourdough roll. Great bloody mary's, strong drinks, good place to grab a pitcher and sit out on the back patio checking out the bay and the birds. Great pre-game giants game, or anytime. Good breakfast. Sometimes catch the city workers docking their boats and grabbing a quick bite to go, pretty OG. I think the ownership changed, prices rose a little bit, but for 2010 its still a  good bargain. FIsh n' Chips are decent if you don't eat burgers. Breakfast is yummy and greasy. Grease is king here. If you need to feel healthier go next door to hi-dive, but your just cheating yourself if you made it all the way to Red's front door and not treating yourself, even if its not the healthiest.
Go to place when hanging with the bro's, or out of towners on a budget, living SF history.
author: Adam S.

description:
Been going to Red's longer than I'm comfortable saying, but suffice to say this java house is perfect for workers of all classes. 

Once the kind of business that catered to longshoremen and the metal thermos crowd, this burger spot has a simplified menu that is priced to go. Get a quick fry (not to be confused with fries, which they don't serve) and take it out to eat on the dock. Enjoy the sky and waterlines at the same time... sigh. A San Francisco institution.
author: sketch f.

description: Nice place to have some drinks before or after a giants game. It's located right on the edge of the bay with an outdoor patio. Nice to sit out there on a summer day. The food on the other hand leaves a lot to be desired. The cheeseburger I had was really lacking flavor and came on some chewy untoasted french bread or sourdough bread I can't rememer which. Drinking place= thumbs up, Food=thumbs down
author: Taj M.

description:
how is it going... 

Java's red house! a great restaurant in San Francisco ... 
service in this restaurant is phenomenal. 
I really like this place has delicious food and fantastic place to go on a weekend, 
it's the perfect stop before a Giants game...
author: Reynaldo s.

description: very disappointed.......$8.oo for a cheese burger .....pre-cooked with no condiments. Could have gone to McD for a quarter pounder............never again!!!
author: Dea M.

description:
If you're expecting a hole-in-the-wall place that sells burgers and beer, you'll be happy like me.  Not fancy by any means, but a good place to grab a late lunch on fridays when the boss aint around.  They have a decent veggie "burger" for the veggies, and draft beer.  And they have PBR for under 2 bucks!!!! 

You can sit happily outside in the sun or under an umbrella, even more happily outside next to the bar, or inside and be sad an pathetic.  What's wrong with you people sitting inside?
author: brewgirl b.

description:
Double Dogg and an Anchor please! Haaa... I love this place. Have been going here since 99' and its great. Food is straight bachlor type so dont expect anything more than that! Fish n' Chips are some of the best too!

One morning I stopped in for the first time to kill time before work and was suprised that they also make an awesome breakfast buritto.

Make sure you park on the left hand side as you enter the pier. I have seen some folks get sweated for parking anywhere else as the area to the right is paid parking.
author: Marlon O.

description: This is the best place to stop when entering the city. Right under the bridge for a burger, a beer and a smoke on the waters edge. Great fries too.
author: Zac O.

description: My guy's friend had highly recommended this place. It is tiiiny! It has outdoor and indoor seating and seems to be a bit of an homage to San Fran! Awesome atmosphere and ohhhh the food! A cheeseburger on french bread with pickles onions and mustard. Who knew I liked my burgers how I like my hot dogs?! I forgot how much I missed burgers like that, my grandma used to make them and haven't had one in ages. They flatten the bread out just a bit so it isn't so chewy and had such a nice texture. Now I highly recommend it!
author: Mary J.

description:
Breakfast the morning after. Big plate, lots of hot food a bit greasy and good strong coffee. Hangover over.

It's a good little diner which I would miss very much if it went away. I will be supporting them with my business often.
author: Jen D.

description: I really wanted the chili cheese fries but I was afraid it would not fill me up.  So I ordered the fish and chips.  I had them put chili cheese on my chips.  They charged $1.50 extra which was well worth it.  However, I don't think me coworkers appreciated me eating all that chili a couple hours later.
author: Danny P.

description: Am I the only one not impressed by Red's? Yeah the location is great and I love sitting in the back patio drinking $1.50 PBR's, but the food here is god awful. I've had the "double burger" which had less meat on it than a McDonald's quarter pounder, the onion rings were dry and not in the least bit fresh, and the chicken parmesan sandwich tasted like cardboard. I don't mean to sound like a snob, but the fact that Anthony Bourdaine featured Red's in No Reservations makes me laugh.
author: Joe G.

description: I have lost all respect for Anthony Bourdain. He did an episode on this place? The hamburgers were awful. The bread did not suit the burger. It was hard and totally un-burger. Even the fries were ho-hum. I give a big thumbs down to Bourdain and Red's Java House.
author: Earl Y.

description:
On a sunny, lazy Sunday morning, complete with a lingering hangover, a stroll along the Embarcadero waterfront to this San Francisco landmark is a must for locals and tourists alike.

Propped up on one of the historic peers under the Bay Bridge, Red's remains thankfully unchanged since the days when it served beer and sustainence to the workers on the wharves of yesteryear. 

As the city slowly wakes up, so the crowds snake their way out the door for the simple short-order offerings of breakfast sandwiches, burgers and beer. Cheap as the chips it serves in paper cones, the brief menu and serve-yourself-java will hit the spot while transporting you back to a simpler era.

Take your paper plate out to the back pier, pull up a plastic chair and settle in to soak up the sunlight as it dances off the bay. Steeped in history, atmosphere, black & white photos and chalkboard menus, this place is as uncomplicated as life should be.
author: shellstar p.

description:
Red's Java House was making a great deal of money this past Saturday, thanks to KFOG's Kaboom!  Just steps from the entrance they were selling great burgers at very reasonable prices - less than five bucks for a double-burger and fries.

This Saturday was the first time my friend and I ever stepped in to the place (we both are born-and-raised), combined with the fact that little people from Mill Valley enjoy eating here,  I'm going to say it sits on the fence of being a local spot/tourist spot - although leaning towards tourist..
author: Anthony B.

description:
For the price, you can't beat this place!

The breakfast is really good and cheap, but they don't serve it after 1:00pm, so you have to wake up early despite your hangover! The juevos rancheros (or something w/ a similar name) is huge and delicious! 

You can get a beer and hamburger for under $5 (where else can you get that!?)

You can eat outside next to the water (just be shure to watch out for the pigeons) and have a nice view of the bridge. This place looks like a small run down shack, but the food is really good (and greesy) and the people that work there are extremely nice! You can also park on the pier, so you don't have to worry about parking!
author: Elaine S.

description:
Red's is amazing, cheap/reasonably priced, massive amounts of delicious, greasy food, outdoor patio on the water for those beautiful days we have so frequently in the South Beach area of town, $2 bud light all day on weekends (and happy hr during the weeks), delicious bloody mary (ask for it spicy!), friendly guy up front who always tests me to see whether or not I'm coming in for breakfast at 11am because I'm hungover from the previous night (usually not, I just perpetually look like crap during law exams; pretty can wait until after I make that paper).

Highly recommend the corned beef hash, which comes with potatoes & grilled onions, eggs (over easy babyyyy), sausage, and toast.  Fries are also amazing.  One of these days, when I'm feeling extra ambitious, I'm going to try the chili burger, so I'll keep y'all posted a year later when I wake up from the food coma.
author: Kristen H.

description:
I don't want to sound like some kind of snob, but I've been coming here for years; before they added the full bar, french fries, and branded soda.  It used to be a bag of chips and a generic soda, like Safeway's "Cragmont" and Diet Rite.  The long neck bottles of beer have always been a bargain.

My biggest irk; waiting behind the customer who's been studying the menu on the board since the front door, but can't make up his mind when he reaches the counter.  Get the "special"; double cheese burger, fries, and a Coke, and then get out of the way!
author: Collin W.

description:
One of my favorite spots in San Francisco. Of course, I love it because it's within walking distance of my apartment, but I also love it because it's the quintessential perfect dive spot.

The restaurant looks almost like a run down shack, but when you walk in, you immediately feel that mom-and-pop quality to it. The ambiance is so comfortable, you feel like you are eating at home. The menu is quite short, but has all of the essentials on it - whether you are there for breakfast or lunch, you'll be able to find something you like. The outdoor seating is fantastic - you can grab a table literally right on the water. To top it off, the service is quick and the guy who takes your order is exceptionally nice.

I love this place!
author: David P.

description:
A great place to go for breakfast when you're hung over.  The egg breakfast (2 eggs, toast, bacon/sausage, home-fries) really hit the spot.  My only issue with it was that the home fries were a little greasy and soggy, but with all the other food on my plate, it didn't really matter.  The spicy bloody mary was GREAT.
Great, no-frills kind of place.
author: Michelle A.

description: I really enjoy this place. It's FAST and convenient! Hamburgers are so tasty and makes you want to eat more then just one! Just thinking about it makes me want to go get one now! :o)
author: E S.

description: I've stopped in here a few times for a small cup of coffee and I'm always treated like a regular customer. I love the atmosphere and even if the coffee isn't top of the line, they treat you as if you are. If you're looking for a quick place for a decent cup of joe, stop in and enjoy Red's.
author: Nicole B.

description: I love coming to Red's Java House before going to a Giants game! Came here today before hitting up the Giants game (which they won by the way!) The place is small and cozy. Their menu is pretty straight forward. I ordered the Double Cheeseburger w/ Bud Combo. It came out to be like $9 or so. Burger was OK. It was not what I expected. The bun is french bread. Also theirs no lettuce or tomatoes. Its straight up cheese, hamburger patties, onions, ketchup, and mustard. Sorry if I forgot an ingredient. But their was no tomatoes or lettuce. It was ok. It was different and it made me full. Will definitely be back before going to the games!
author: Daniel S.

description: I can't believe this place is still around. Memories of meeting my mom for lunch when she worked at the VA. Yummy burgers.
author: Dee B.

description: This is a great place to get a beer and some simple food. You either get it or you don't. For those of you that don't get it, those of us that do don't care. I'm a fan of the meatballs and the good, cold Anchor Steam beer.
author: Laura F.

description:
Red's Java House is a great place to check out during those rare sunny days in the city where you can escape work and enjoy some good beer with fish and chips.  

What's wrong with a cozy shack with good food and a nice view of the bay?  It's well worth the 30 minute walk from the office near the Embarcadero to sit out on the deck and eat a good hearty lunch.  I've had bbq pulled pork sandwich that was good, but I love me some fish and chips with beer.  

Prices are typical for the area, so there's no complaining.
author: Cristina L.

description: $1.75 PBRs all day, everyday. Need I say more?
author: Alexis M.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite spots before the Giant's moved into the area. The arrival of the Giant's have definitley made the owners rich but, the place has lost a lot of its charm. It used to be a great place to steal away to at lunch and grab a decent meal for very little cash. The place has tradition and history that is unfortunately starting to fade. What's up with the patio and flat panel TV? It has become less of a SF landmark and more of just a pre-game drinking hangout. 
It is still a good place on the right days.  Go on a nice quiet day when the patrons aren't on the way to the ballpark.
author: Big B. W.

description:
Red's is a nice little greasy spoon perched on the edge of Pier 30-32.

I have to admit I do not have much experience with the food but the breakfast sandwich i had there was very tasty.  

Most of my experience with this place has been while meeting friends before a Giants game this is where Red's really shines.  

On a sunny afternoon the back patio is the place to be.  With a nice view of the Bay Bridge and the cheapest beer near AT&T Park it is a great place to stop and have a pregame brew with your buds.  Bud and Bud light are just $2.25 and they even have PBR is cans for $2.  Bejond that they have specials on certain days on buckets and pitchers.  

To top it all off there is also a free shuttle that will take you from Red's over to the park.  Be sure to tip the driver though (so I guess it isn't  quite free).

So when you are headed out to the yard and the sun is shining and you want to save a little scratch before spending $9 on a beer in the park, stop by Reds and have a couple under the bayside sun.
author: Ben A.

description:
UN-pretentious Dining at it's San Francisco BEST!
Where else can you go for a quick beer and burger in a tee shirt and sneakers and have a waterfront view?
author: Cid Y.

description:
i met up with some friends here today to chitchat this morning. i only had coffee and it wasn't that great. i was afraid to order food based on the yelp reviews and from what i saw other people ordering. nice people, you can tell there are plenty of regulars who come. there were pigeons inside! they run through the front door and look for crumbs on the floor. 

we'll be finding a new place to try for breakfast/coffee meetups.
author: Ryan D.

description: good old fashion working man food
author: John M.

description: Walk and drive by this place all the time but have not eaten here, until I was inspired by Anthony Bourdain. This place is an institution. Red's is no bullshit. A visit to Red's is refreshing after a lot of Sunday morning line waiting that comes with doing the SF brunch circuit (don't you feel like a drone sometimes?!). Scrambled eggs, bacon and a golden fluffy pancake, made to perfection. Great views of the bay, no urban outfitters and a parking lot; the Sunday morning breakfast trifecta. I'll have to try their burgers on my next visit.
author: Annie Y.

description: I love this place. Kinda dank, kinda beautiful it all depends on the weather and the crowd. But sitting outdoors with a bucket of Pansy and a burger in a croissant is pretty sweet. Cheap, decent food and a harbor view. A great way to spend the afternoon.
author: Scot L.

description: Great grease! the double cheeseburger on sour dough bread soaks up the hangover....take that back it rips the hangover from your body and makes you feel one with the world. the chili cheese fries taste a little like a Cincinnati chili but still ok...yes Cincinnati chili is gross
author: J. B.

description: This is a great SF spot for those looking for a unique experience.  Nothing fancy, just simple food served with beer.  Perfect for a warm and sunny SF lunch (they do exist).
author: Matt G.

description:
Next to the water
Lots of character
Burgers & dogs
Chili burgers
Beer
'Salty' staff
What more can you ask for?  I almost expected a crew of fisherman to walk up from the water.  You get EXACTLY what you see, good cheap food.  If you can drop by for lunch on a nice day, well worth it.
author: peter k.

description:
You know those days where it's actually warm enough to take your hoodie off outside? That's the day when you round up your posse and head on over to Red's FutherMuckin' Java House! Walk straight to the counter without bothering to look at the menu and order up fish and chips, beers, and walk on back where an umbrella-covered table with radical views awaits!

I mean seriously, why anyone would order a burger at any establishment on the water and wonder why it's bad is beyond me...
author: Wil E.

description:
You can't beat good (cheap) burgers and beer along the wharf in the City.  

I used to go here for lunch when I was working downtown....loved it.

Please support and keep an SF original alive!!!
author: Ricky P.

description:
I had breakfast there this past Sunday morning.  WOW.  They have corned beef hash on the menu on Saturdays and Sundays.  Since that is always one of my favorites - a litmus test for a breakfast spot - I had to give it a shot.  It was great.  They set a new standard.  This was not the Alpo canned variety.  No, this was freshly cooked corned beef, shreded and cooked with onions and potatoes.  With the scrambled eggs and sourdough toast and coffee I found heaven.  

The place may not be much on looks but that's not what I'm there for.  The location is great, the view from the outdoor deck unbeatable and the parking was, well, abundant.  The staff were top notch having fun and moving your order along really fast.  

This place is now one of my all time favorites.
author: Ed C.

description: Friday had fish chips as the special. The batter was crispy delicious but the fries were not crispy at all. Soggy oil spill comes to mind
author: Christopher L.

description: Great place to hang before a Giants game or concert at the "park". It's so overwhelmingly beautiful there along the embarcadero,people do fall in love with SF once they see the bay, the bridges,and get a cool blast of that maritine spray!  Also a good place to nurse a hangover,i.e. a hot-dog and a heineken. (it WORKS!)
author: Kevin B.

description: Bourdain, did me wrong by pumping this place up.  It was okay burgers thats about it.  But when Bourdain pumped this up on a recent episode the message was better than okay burgers.  False advertisement and I'm here to let you know from a recent visit.  What to do if you haven't been.  Well of course you gotta try it first.  You don't know if you don't go.  But if you were smart and savvy you'd take my advice from this review.  I said Ahoooo yeah!!!
author: marcus o.

description: ....all is right in the world SK.....RED's is as RED's has always been......  You get what you expect when you walk in the door........  Dawn L 'Wanderer' would be more happy at Gordon Beirsch or Palomino where the "Decorations" are nice too and the food is priced at a premium, with an attitude and a the mandatory oft unjustified tip!  None of that at RED's.....Cheap burger in plastic basket with grease dripping all over the place.  Anchor Steam optional....Budweiser Required!
author: Mac S.

description: Cool that it's uncommon. Be ready for a sourdough burger w/o lettuce or tomato. If you eat outside pay  no attention to the pigeons.
author: San Fran S.

description: Love this place, cheeseburger fries and a coke sitting outside any time of year is great!
author: Chizzy T.

description:
I don't get it.

The burgers are served on stale rolls you have to soak in beer to avoid cracking your teeth on.  A double burger here is roughly equivalent to a single elsewhere, and didn't taste very good.  Very limited beer selection.  Dirty.  Dilapidated.  I was worried I would fall through the floor.  

I won't be returning to this one.  Really didn't see the value for what I paid.
author: Jeff G.

description:
You should know ...
- I am vegetarian.
- I don't do decor/ambiance.

The review ...
Ah a weekend in San Francisco. Good to be back here, and even more so with the great summer weather! A long morning stroll down Embarcadero can leave you with quite an appetite. Red's is a great burger joint for a quick bite.

When you head in you'll see some interesting signs including one that says "we don't server tomatoes or lettuce - don't ask us." I asked them. I got an awesome look back from the server and I continued grinning at him.

One nice touch about Red's is that they serve their patty on sourdough bread (if you want it) and have a great selection of alcoholic beverages (including micro-brews). The fries are In-N-Out style with the skins on, and accompanying them will be some instructions not too feed them to the seagulls, to guard them from seagulls and in general not to provoke the seagulls with french fry related antics.

They were well justified.

Head past the bar, outside to the open area, and you can see dozens of the huge birds eyeing your fries.

Once you're settled though, bite into that burger. Red's makes the best garden patty I've had. Good combination of vegetables, rice and other stuff. The sourdough bun goes very well with it, and will ruin regular burger buns for you thereafter. Despite the no tomatoes, no lettuce policy, it was a very tasty burger and combined with the view outside, made it an excellent burger joint!
author: Middle D.

description: Love this place - the atmosphere, the vibe, the corned beef hash, the chili, the workers and the bloody marys...my wife digs the breakfast sandwiches.
author: John A.

description:
DAYYYYYYYYYYYYUM!!! 

I love this place! You can't beat their burgers for the price. This place looks like a dump, but it's got major personality! That's what I'm about. They do no green whatsoever, so you better be prepared to get some serious artery clogger on, I've tried their burgers and their breakfast sandwich's and they were really good, I would recommend even coming here for some grub before a game.
author: S A.

description: If you don't like pigeons do not come here. They allow pigeons to walk into the dining area inside! I don't think that's really sanitary or clean. Scare the pigeons and they start flapping and flying all over the place. Can you say gross while you're trying to eat? The food is alright. It's hit or miss. Sometimes the fries are really good. Lately not so much.
author: Justin K.

description: This place is pretty friggin perfect for a Giants tailgating event. They have flavorful burgers served on sourdough rolls...which is great, and you can feed the remnants to the scavenging sea gulls that are 5 feet away. The fries were eh, but you can't really do burgers without em so there. Solid beer/burger joint within walking distance to AT&T. GO GIANTS!
author: Jess V.

description: Love Anthony Bourdain, but he got this one wrong (BIG TIME).  We went there as an office lunch and all three of us are sick.  Not best.  If you want a good burger, try Brick House on Brannan or Taylor's Refresher.  Red's = yuck!
author: Big S.

description: After years of burgers, beers, fries and onion rings, my honey and I took the plunge and got married at Red's Java House.  "Huh?" you might think.  Well, a few dozen vases of flowers, artificial candles, gold paper tablecloths, and a red carpet runner down the center of the outdoor patio, transformed this burger joint -- historically a hangout for longshoremen, politicians and journalists -- into a delightful wedding venue.  Owner Sean was warmly accommodating with our planning; friendly and fuss-free.  On the magical night of the wedding, the City was warm, the Bay Bridge lights were twinkling, little flower girls sprinkled fairy dust on a red carpet, the Giants were leading the Tigers in the third game -- we would not have traded the place for the Sistine Chapel.  Our English friend said the fish and chips were great, although the "chips" were quite different from what he experienced as a lad.  Food was delicious.  The Bride had an onion ring -- a favorite item of hers on the Red's menu.
author: Doug C.

description: Dear Reds: I love you. I love your cheeseburgers, your chili cheese fries and your bucket of beer specials. I love that you are close to Giants Stadium, and have a patio on the water. You make me want to be a better person.
author: Love T.

description:
grease without flavor.
doesnt actually stay open during their stated hours.
not impressed.
author: H C.

description: The food is cheap, but nothing spectacular. The interior is fun and kitschy and it's a fun location for a weekend breakfast or lunch.
author: Alex L.

description: i have fond memories of this place. after being laid off, a few of us (5) decided to walk to the closest bar in the area that was serving drinks. Red's was the only place willing to take quarters and nickles in exchange for some PBRs at 9:30am. We sat on the back patio (luckily it was a nice day) for 6 hours waiting for the rest of our coworkers to get let go so they could come meet us. The kitchen staff were very consoling and nice. Fish and chips are delightful as well.
author: Al I.

description:
BEST fish and chips ever!!  haven't had much anything else to eat here besides the fish and chips, so can't really comment any further.  great place to stop by before a game...usually super crowded though.

happy eating!!
author: Fina S.

description:
One of the things I've loved about Red's was the price. I just had a burger and fries and paid $7.25. While I would have given Red's 4 stars even a year or 2 ago the price increase plus the guy who takes your order's excuse for it  "it's Obama" (he wasn't joking) just left me with a bad taste in my mouth. The burger was good as usual but now it's competing against more expensive burgers and now the once -comical "don't even think about asking for lettuce and tomato" or whatever the sign said seems less fun and more snotty. I like the bay view and used to not mind the pigeons and seagulls swarming my outside table but it's not as fun anymore. I'm sure they make a killing on game nights so godspeed there but I was there today at noon and there was no line. 

Goodbye Red's.
author: jeremy m.

description: I walked here hung over on a sunday afternoon.  I could have just gone to Taylors across from my fatty pad but I decided to walk in the foots steps of Bourdain.  How did he even find this place?  I was expecting a decent burger but it was just mediocre.  I wasn't a huge fan of mcdonalds sized cheeseburger patties in a fatty ass sourdough roll.  The breakfast, however, looked really good here.  The patio was an nice place to enjoy my mediocre burger.  Next time I am gonna burn less calories and eat at Taylors even though it takes an hour to get your food.  Lame.
author: Fatty A.

description: I went to Red's twice yesterday-before the Giants game for a burger and a couple of beers and again after the game for more beers.  The burger itself was good, not great but the hot, tasty fries and cold beer definitely made up for it.  Add to that an incredible day weather wise on the patio and inexpensive menu ($1.75 PBR's all day every day) and you've got yourself a winner.
author: phil h.

description: This is a welcome retreat from the slicked back euro wanna be restaurants in the FiDi.  This is a great place to grab a beer and a burger or dog for lunch.  If you can't enjoy yourself here, then you just ain't living right.
author: Richard R.

description: Went after the Giants game.  Total dump.  But it was nice to have a drink outside by the water.  Next to the porta potty.
author: tonya m.

description:
pros -

location, history, staff, cheap, outdoor seating, breakfast options.

cons

yucky onion rings, closes to early (7pm), needs milk shakes
author: Nicole H.

description: this place remains the one place that i know that serves up the flakiest, juiciest fish n chips that i've ever had. and while i may not have had many places, until the next place i try serves up a better batter covered fish, this will remain 5 stars in my books.  staff is always attentive and remembers your face easily in order to make eye contact when your order comes out.
author: Albert L.

description:
Came here after watching the Anthony Bourdain SF episode of No Reservations. I generally trust him as Les Halles, the restaurant where he formally served as Executive Chef back in my old stomping grounds of NYC, had the greatest $20 plate of steak frites I've ever had. So when I saw him standing at the end of a long pier washing a greasy cheeseburger down with a cold Anchor Steam before my recent move to SF, I knew I had to check this place out once I moved here. 

In terms of atmosphere and pricing, Reds doesn't disappoint. You can sit on their large outside deck right off the bay and get insanely cheap buckets of PBR's or pitchers of beer and munch on some greasy artery-cement without breaking the bank. I saw someone eating the fish and chips, served in a paper boat with plastic ramekins of tartar, and it looked deep-fried to a golden brown with meaty chunks of flaky white fish... kind of wish I would have gotten that. 

Now on to why I only rated Reds three stars. While the setting was stunning, the beer was ice cold, and it was a good experience overall, the burger sucked! I really couldn't believe how disappointing it was. It's not so much the sourdough bread serving as bun (although I am a traditionalist when it comes to burgers), my problem had more to do with the patty. Do their burgers come in frozen and individually sealed? It was the most flavorless, peculiarly bound hunk of beef I've ever had the misfortune of digesting. And while I love the idea of white onions, yellow mustard,and dill pickle as the sole garnishes, not even that could save this awful hunk of meat. I'm confident Bourdain wasn't crazy about this burger and pulled a Rachael Ray in his bullshit delivery on camera while washing it down with a beer, because this burger is not good by any stretch of the imagination. And for having such a wonderful location and getting everything else so damn right, a shitty burger is inexcusable.
author: Bruce S.

description: Killer views and lots of atmosphere with a convenient location near the ballpark.  Burgers are average, somewhat lacking in flavor and a bit overwhelmed by the bun. Be certain to get the fries which are a step up in quality from the burger.
author: Michael O.

description:
fell in love with this place back in the hs stoner days. this was pre xgames so it was still a shack, less than half the current size. then it was price club patties on rye bread and a bud for a couple bucks.
 
now its got a 'real' kitchen, a staff and an outdoor dining area. not sure when this all happened but why the hell not. progress is progress. i just happened to stumble in one day and saw their menu had evolved nicely....... and damn it  they had FIRESTONE DOUBLE BARRELL ON TAP!!!!!! instantly, i knew ill be back. 

came back a few times, but sadly, the firestone tap is no more. guy tells me its probably somewhere in tahoe or something, didnt quite follow that, but nonetheless, sad it was.

id still go on a nice day to sit outside, enjoy the nice weather and eat some cheap grub.  their outdoor patio rocks, they got beer, got cocktails, cheap grub , huge free parking.... how can you say no?
author: Euge L.

description: Yummy!  Cheap happy hour beer pitchers ($11), delicious cheeseburgers and right next to At&t park!  Also, FAST service.  We got all our food after about 4-5 minutes.  The cheeseburgers might not be for everyone, they are like big sliders to me, very oniony and mustardy, but it's SO good with the tender meat and sourdough bread!  Glad I stopped by here before the game, and I'll be back.
author: Cat R.

description: This is one of the great breaky places that is impossibly inexpensive, super friendly service, great outdoor dock seating by the Embarcadero especially on a clear sunny day. They serve basic but decent breakfast, lunch and drinks. I particularly like the all-you-can-drink coffee :) The unpretentious service and self-serve style make it less stressful as you don't have to worry about the server comes by. And the breathtaking view? Priceless!
author: T L.

description: Oh hells yeah.  Cheap and awesome, with outside seating AND cheap beer.  Love the burger on the sourdough roll.
author: matthew w.

description: Why does Red's java House get 4 stars?  Well you can start with the burger, bud, and fries for cheap.  Really, I don't know where else you can go to get a deal like that in the city.  You would pay just about the same price for a beer by itself in most places in the City.  The burger is a thin patty of meat that is very much not some premium ground beef on a sourdough roll.  After you get your meal you can either eat it inside, out on Embarcadero, or in the back on the pier.  If you are anywhere outdoors then you'll have a great view of the Bay Bridge and the Bay itself.  Be sure to grab one of the non-health code compliant ketchup bottles to squirt some ketchup on your burger and fries!
author: Luis M.

description: fish and chips were good outside seating is good under the bay bridge
author: Daniel F.

description: we went with some friends we had the cheese burger with chilli cheese fry's to me what set it apart from anyone else was the burger was served on a great french bread roll well worth the wait if there is a line
author: Michael H.

description: Usually has pretty fast service even when crowded at lunch. The fish+chips are HUGE and delicious, and they give you tartar sauce without even asking..unlike some of the other fish+chip places that think vinegar is the way to go.
author: andy c.

description: Came here on a date when I was in college. That was when "Pac Bell Park" first opened. I remember it being very crowded--but well worth the wait because I had a really great hotdog (better than paying $6 at the ballpark).
author: Sue L.

description: My friend just moved to this neighborhood, and after a night of drinking/slumber party, she took us to Red's Java House for breakfast.  I immediately recognized it as one of Anthony Bordain's fav places to eat at from No Reservations when he's in the city reviewing restaurants.  It was breakfast time so I didn't order his special which is a double cheeseburger, chili fries and an anchor steam.  All three of us ordered the corned beef and hash which was the Saturday special and lemme tell you it was f'n delicious and my egg as requested was perfectly poached!!!!  It's rare to find this dish done right.  My favorite place to find a similiar dish used to be Judy's on Union/Steiner in the Marina which is a more  posh place. But Red Java House is what I crave now for breakfast.  Excellent price performance:  Great location, Great Food, Great Prices, Great Staff!  BTW - the refillable, self serve coffee is pretty darn good too.
author: Sheila W.

description: I like good dives and Red's is a good place to grab a quick burger or hot dog. They've got parking, and it's great to sit out on the pier and look at the view while eating. I wouldn't hang out for the ambiance, but for a quick bite while passing through, it works. (Just don't go there too often, because it's not health food!)
author: Sam W.

description: Five frickin' stars for being so old school San Fran. THIS is how I always remember this city o' mine - cheap, delicious, uncomplicated and seaside.
author: Nigel F.

description: My hubby and I were here for brunch yesterday...I had the breakfast plate (2 eggs/big pancake and 2 bacon strips) and my hubby had a hamburger. We thought the food was ok...it wasn't anything specticular...instead of having waiters...it was more of order, sit down, they'll find you and bring your food type of thing...(which was fine). The only slight concern I had was that I noticed the roof near the front entrance looked like it was about ready to collapse...yikes...someone better fix it!
author: JenJen W.

description: I'm with the masses on this one. Four stars.There is nothing better than sitting out the back of Red's on a sunny day, sharing a cup of fries with hubby as he chows down on something meaty and I nibble on the tasty veggie burger (not a veggie btw, just don't tolerate bovine flesh all that well) and we watch boats go by and obese pigeons fighting over discarded grub. Bliss!
author: Sarah J.

description: This is a great place to realize that you're too stupid to enjoy good food. Just eat your burger and relax already. It cost zero dollars and there you are in the sun.
author: Tim S.

description: Simply brilliant. A hole in the wall with decades of history that doesn't mind the lunchtime office crowd. Cheeseburger and fries for $4, with ourdoor seating on the water right under the Bay Bridge.
author: Billy A.

description:
another SF institution, been around for years, and where else can you get a bud and a burger for under $2?  

my favorite time to go to Red's is before a giants day game and sit outside on the back "patio" (AKA fenced in asphalt) sipping an ice cold brew while looking out at the bay.
author: Suzanne A.

description: If some restaurant has the word java in its name, I expect them to serve a stellar cup of coffee.  I didn't eat here but I did order the coffee - and was quite disappointed.  If it's a diner, call it Red's Diner.  Don't call it a java house.
author: Lolia S.

description: I live sooo close to this place and I picked up breakfast for me and a coworker.  Staff made a great breakfast (we both got corned beef)  and made it quick!  it has a great view if you decide to sit outside and its soo convenient for the giants game.
author: Camille A.

description:
Should give this place another shot, and probably will, but wanted to express my disappointment with the place. 

The place has seating in the front, side and the back, which includes outdoor seating. No waiters. You line up to the counter, order and wait for the food for pickup. Then you seat yourself. The tables are relatively clean. The busing of your own dishes was not especially clear to me. There was one bathroom for both genders, which, on a busy day with some guy in front of me who had to take a #2, made for a relatively long wait.

I ordered the fish and chips and it was by far the greasiest version ive ever had. I was practically dipping my entire head into a vat of grease when i was eating the fish. The breading on the fish was enormous...and the grease that coated the fish just inside the breading could lube up a motorcycle. The fries werent great, but werent terrible.

I might try this place again, but im afraid i might have a stroke if i get another grease laden meal like the fish and chips i had here a few months ago.
author: Noli B.

description:
thank you, red, for allowing me to tan on your back patio, although it was not really a patio, more like parking lot with a fence around it, with some wooden tables and scattered lawn chairs.

still, i ain't hatin.  what's not to love about delicious fish & chips with stella on draft under the warm friday sun, all for under $10?  even the pigeons were swallowing the french fries whole off the ground!

don't come here if you are looking for stellar food, come here for the kick back ambiance and seaside location.  

and don't come here if you are a shy vegetarian - they will declare your veggie burger order over the speakers. (which, as quoted by an army brat - tasted like "cafeteria food").
author: Josie M.

description: Okay, so I was skeptical. Maybe because I feel like someone might've forgotten to wash his/her hands before they manhandled my meaty menu item. But I've been won over. But not because it's a San Francisco institution but because onion rings + french fries + hot dog + chili = happiness. Smell you later...
author: Marie M.

description: Burger.  Beer.  Outdoor patio under the bridge.  Great indoor shack atmosphere.  It is what it is.  I love it.
author: Blake W.

description: This is one of my fav spots to go for lunch during the work week. Its especially good on a beautiful sunny day in SF.  Burger, Budweiser & Fries-all for around 5-6 bucks.  You can't beat that!
author: Don C.

description: I shouldn't have had expectations coming here.  I ordered chilli cheese fries and a cheeseburger and the fries were soggy and undercooked and the burger was barely warm.  Good view though if you sit outside.
author: Joseph C.

description: Nice place to sit outside for lunch and enjoy the weather while you can. They've got some nice daily specials, especially the Reuben. Served on deli rye, it had some nice large slices of corned beef which was nice for a change. The fries are also nice and greasy...Overall its just niiice
author: Nicolas H.

description: Definitely a great place for some beer and greasy food in the sunshine. The burgers are actually really tasty and even though the patio is part of a parking lot, you barely notice with the water to the left and a great view of the bridge. It is a simple burger shack that looks in need of some structural support but it could be a fun time with the right crowd.
author: Patrick B.

description:
good views (sit outside), good bloody mary's, nice burger + beer specials.

this place is real, it's iconic, it's historic, and ask anyone who knows their stuff, they would have claimed so, pre- Tony Bordain visit.

ppssstt.. i kinda feel like Tony idealized it. . whatever, I stil like it.
author: Leia K.

description: What's not to like about burgers and a beer?  See, Sliders = eh.  This is great.  Why?  Well, the water.  And the beer.  And the idea.  It's great.  If you get a burger burger (not a Slow Club burger, but a burger burger), it should be at a place like this.  Four stars.
author: Laurel B.

description: This place is awesome.  From the unique burgers served on sourdough to the funky signs all over the place, it really is one of those rare places in the area where you will see roughneck/construction worker types and the after work yuppies drinking beer and munching on greasy bar food.  If it is a nice day nothing beats the outdoor area they have on the pier...sometimes being at Red's makes you feel like you're on a boat.  The only other thing I have to say is that the goofy staff are all great...once I ordered a combo with beer at the kitchen and the guy let me know it would be cheaper if I ordered at the bar.  I just think that was really nice of him!
author: Dylan D.

description:
I recently went to Red's to try their lunch, and sadly, was not as excited about it as I am about the breakfast. The fish n chips were moderately delicious, but certainly not the best I've had. There was practically no wait for our food at 11:45, but the place did get really busy by 12. The back patio is a great place to sit and enjoy the sun while eating, and if I hadn't needed to be back at work in an hour I would have liked a cold beer to wash down my greasy fish n chips. My coworkers ordered burgers and hot dogs, and nobody was terribly impressed. 

I was disappointed to see that the fishing sign had been taken down. If you've been here before and you like to fish, you probably know what sign I'm talking about. I was also disappointed to see that prices had increased somewhat over the past couple of years, but I guess that's not really all that surprising.
author: Erin Y.

description:
the interior feels like the set of an old tiny diner in New York, but the place really is grounded right on the Embarcadero.

great place to hit for lunch if you're in the area. try the chili cheese fries - solid.
author: Darrell L.

description:
Five stars for its historic and funky atmosphere and awesome views of the Bay Bridge and the water. It's especially entertaining when a cruise ship is docked nearby. 

Two stars for the food.  I usually get the fish and chips since the burgers don't do it for me anymore.

Despite the so-so food, I hope this place will always be around. I'm sentimental like that..
author: C G.

description: After my friend and i wanted some good cheesesteaks we walked a good chunk of SF to find out that the place was closed. Disapointed to say the least haha. We were at embarcadero however and my friend thought the sign said "cheesesteaks". Needless to say it said cheeseburgers haha. We said screw it were here and i've been dying to try it for a long time. First off, location location location. You Can NOT miss this place. Its on pier 30 with a gorgeous view of the bay. Its not a really big joint but thats what adds to the home like feel. Its fast paced but everything cooked to order so you gotta love it. Im a huge burger fan and it seemed like a popular item here. Two double cheeseburgers/fries/2 sodas, $16.00 even. Not to bad. One complaint i do have is no ketchup just mustard on the burger which i love but the amount was to much. It should be an option. Other than that the fries are amazing and hell, when was the last time you got a CAN of coke with a burger. I Suggest this place to locals and outsiders alike. Support an SF classic!
author: Mario P.

description: This place has cheap eats... perfect for those days you are going to the ball park and decide to park on the street like I do... walk to Red's... get my meal... eat... and roll to the park... nice and quick... now... if I were to go to Gordon Birsch... it would take forever... this is a good place to go in and out... no frills... and I have been having their food since I was a wee little girl... besides... How can you say no to sourdough... yummy!
author: Amelia M.

description:
i came here during cupcake camp to get away from the sweet rush of sugar, and to satisfy my savory craving.  my friend mentioned that this place was featured on anthony bourdain's show, so of course we had to try...if a celebrity foodie says it's good, then it must be!  well...i just wanted something quick that i could eat while walking back to cupcake camp...so i opted for the $4 hot dog.  i got it with just mustard (a negative to pickles and onions).  the hot dog was just a normal, plain old hot dog...nothing fancy...and not particularly that great.  the bun was slightly toasted, but seemed to have come from a 20-pack of cheapo white bread buns (not sure this exists...but you can imagine).  i think the hot dog was way overpriced considering there was really nothing amazing about it.  

the hamburger, on the other hand, looked delicious.  my friends got it...the patty was inside 2 pieces of crusty sour dough.  the bread was really the only thing that made it interesting...but it was hard to bite into.  it's probably 80% bread, and 20% burger stuff.  but for the same price as the hot dog, it seems like a better deal.

i would probably only come back here if i was back in the area and needed a quick bite to eat.  and if i did come back, i'd go with the burger instead.
author: Melissa L.

description: Red's is a quintessential example of what's right and wrong about the city in the past ten years. It used to be a complete hole-in-the-wall with about five things on the menu, one of which was Bud. No fries: chips. Super cheap back then (double burger + Bud, $3.35 or summat). Now, they opened up the side and back, adding 20 tables and you can sit outside overlooking the Bay. More menu items, free parking on the dock  and a full bar. Totally awesome, except for the Fabulous People with sunglasses on their heads and golf-course polos and the pigeons that jump up on the tables, steal food, walk around under your tables and fly within a foot of your head. The best improvement: women come here now, tough-looking hotties who can drain a longneck without asking for a glass.
author: jim b.

description:
my grandfather used to drop me off here for a few hours while he unloaded his truck. this was back when the embarcadero was mainly shipping and trucking. my grandfather was a truck driver. he would have a truck to unload at near  by pier and i would hang out with Red and his brother. i believe it was Mike but i cant remember.

the food here is 5 star for what it is. dont compare it to some of its neighboors. it is a 5 star diner that serves good, cheap food with killer views and history.
author: Mattew W.

description: For less than $6 you can get a hot dog and beer or a hamburger and beer.  Great spot for a greasy pre-Giants dinner and drinks.  And they have a patio and bar in the back.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: The is my favorite place to take my assistant for cheap burgers and lunch beers on Fridays.  You can't beat the price, the view or the service, it is super quick, which is exactly what you need on a Friday...as much time to enjoy that lunch beer as possible before running back to the office.
author: Alicia K.

description: What a glorious dump!  We ate a most unhealthy breakfast outside and it was just up my husband's alley. It was nice to have this break from all the higher end food in SF. Obviously, this place has quite the history! A huge meal deal, if I were to go again I think I'd try one of their unhealthy lunch options since there were several painters eating hog dogs and french fries at 9 am. Why not?
author: laurie c.

description: I went here because I didn't want to deal with the crowd at Taylor's Refresher.  Probably the best burger detour I made.  A burger and fries at a decent price, not to mention fast service with a smile.  I literally got my order as quickly as I paid for it.  This place really hit the spot for my burger fix.
author: R B.

description: If you're on a diet or unsure what you want; don't go, but their fish and chips are the bomb!  I haven't been in a while as I've been trying to lose some weight, but if you're going to splurge on some fish and chips, this is a good choice.  Eat outside out back to enjoy the water, wind, and company of good friends.
author: Tom D.

description: I agree with all the other two star reviews. I went here with my coworkers for a Friday team lunch and was extremely underwhelmed. I didn't know that Bourdain talked this place up, but I'm surprised he did with all the other great burger places in the city. I got the double cheeseburger with fries and a soda. It's a good deal, but the burger was not very good at all. Meat, cheese, buns, and a ton of mustard. I guess if you like mustard a lot it could be a decent burger.
author: Danny L.

description: Yum yum for your tum tum and good for your wallet too! Good place for locals and tourists... you get a good view of the bay whilest eating delish food for cheap. Red's is also an awesome place to eat at or just to grab a cup of coffee before you head out to a Giant's game! And yes it is within a reasonable walk to AT& T park!
author: selina n.

description: This place has the best burgers in SOMA.  For reals.  They are big, delicious, and filling.  Also, they serve a great greasy breakfast into the afternoon.  Red's is cash only, but you get a lot for your money.  They have a decent amount of outdoor seating, so I really enjoy having a beer and burger on hot days in by the park.
author: C B.

description: Red's gets most of its points for attitude and view.  The food is kinda gross and over greasy-- although I've only eaten breakfast here.    The coffee is watery and not that warm.  You eye the dishes suspiciously for cleanliness.     But the staff is cool and the view of the bridge and the bay from the back is awesome.  Great for people watching -- all kinds come here.   Much better for a pitcher of beer, than for a meal in my book.
author: green t.

description: Perfect for a sunny day!  Two thin patties served on a sour dough roll with some fries for around five dollars!  My friends tried the fish sandwich they looked pretty impressive, as well.  They even have Dad's Root beer.  Try to avoid the restrooms if possible.
author: ELIZABETH W.

description:
A legendary burger establishment! Although in recent years it has gone relatively up-market with a flat screen TV and an outdoor bar out back it is still the same place my grandparents visited in the 1930s before grabbing a Pan Am Clipper Ship across the sea. Originally built to serve the local dock-workers, Red's continues to serve an incredibly diverse crowd ranging from investment bankers and wayward dot-commers high on caffeine to police and artists...providing a much needed waystation between Bart the ballpark (whatever it is called these days). 
Although prices have gone up quite substantially, it is one of the few places in the city where you can get a great hamburger on a sourdough bun with a coke and fries safely out the door for $5 or $6. Also not to be missed are is the bar out back, a great place to melt away the afternoon soaking in the view and defending your fries from the birds. 
Despite the name, Red's never seems to be as busy during the morning when they have yummy pancakes (with real maple syrup) and great egg dishes. 
My only major complaint? They close quite early, something like 6p or 7p. Otherwise it would be a great place to hit up after work. The closest approximate is the Hi-Dive...which does not really scratch my itch nearly as well.
author: Cameron K.

description: If I had a prescription for Lipitor, i'd down a few before heading across the street to dine al fresco at Red's.  The food is burger joint faire served up in a funky shack w/ back parking lot patio that overlooks the water and the city skyline.  I find myself drawn to Red's especially on Monday for their Italian Sausage special.
author: Bill T.

description: As everyone before me has said, the location is great. Sit outside if you want to share your table with pigeons and seagulls. Probably not the most sanitary of places to chow down, so don't lick the table. The food is cheap, the french fires are tasty and the burgers are served on bread not a bun (mustard is standard, so be warned). If you're lucky, you'll see the one legged seagull I saw last week. He will break your effing heart, that little guy. He's strong, he's got good balance and he holds his own among the other winged scavengers. Our entire table was enthralled with him the whole  time.
author: Pam D.

description: Good place for some cheap eats, guess the answer for their trivia question and you get some fries thrown in. Last time the question was, "Who sang baby got back", and they weren't just satisfied with the answer, they wanted you to sing it.  Had the double cheese burger, but the fish and chips looked pretty damn good.
author: Mark D.

description: Red's is a cheap, fast, and causual joint to get your fix of burgers, hot dogs, beers, french fries, and the like. The place is brimming with its unique Bay-side character and is really fun to do for lunch, especially after walking from a Giants game. The burgers aren't bad--on the dry side but served on excellent sourdough rolls. There's tons of space to eat inside, out back on a deck, or near the waterfront along the Embarcadero.
author: Patrick G.

description: I've always wanted to come into the little red java house.  The food is what you'd expect, i got a salami sandwich (huge freaking salami and i dig salami) but the sandwich was pretty plain, my big slabs of salami were put on some big bread.  The chili cheese fries were ok, mind you i have big expectations for chili cheese fries, and the cole slaw was good, but soggy.  Outside was really nice, definately a throwback place that'd be great for happy hour and pre-giants game hang outs.  I'd totally go back, but just for the beer and the outdoor patio.
author: Chrammy D.

description: Sure this place has changed a lot from what it was but so has this part of the city. It's not the $1.50 beer (anything you want as long as its Bud) and a burger joint it used to be.
