I remember sitting inside here and talking to Red about Irish Pat Lawler's boxing style. I give it five sentimental stars for all the memories.I'm really glad that this place has survived.
author: Steve N.

description: A great value, a wonderful small business to support, and pretty decent food.  I just love the feel of a place like this ... happy that it still exists, ya know?  They have photos of the piers along the waterfront that depict busier days for sailors and shipping businesses.  If you're a food snob, don't even bother .... not your place.  Regular folks are welcome and will appreciate the humble interior and the friendly people behind the counter.  The hours are kinda limited ... seems like a breakfast and lunch, Monday through Saturday type place.  I really like it though ...
author: Jamie W.

description: great place to grab a great cheese burgar...been coming here for years when the original owner ran it!!! tastes the same... great!
author: Maria R.

description: Ok my first post... the first place I enjoyed when I moved here a year ago. Check it out for breakfast on the weekend for great pancakes and eggs to go with your red beers and football. Lunch time offers good burgers, sandwiches, and fish and chips plus when the weather's nice and wind's down you can't be Red's patio.... 4 stars baby!!!
author: David R.

description: I've been coming here for 5 years now., and it has never disappointed me. Why? because as long as you go with expectations for a good burger and fries, that is what you will get. Their sourdough bread bun is awesome with the burger, but if you want something a little softer they will give you a hamburger bun too. A lot of people love their fish and chips, but if i had to pick, the cheeserburger wins hands down. You can come here for a greasy breakfast sandwich the day after a long night of drinking. Or come for a bowl of chili on a cold rainy day. The best is coming here on a rare hot SF day to have a beer and relax on the back deck. Ahhh.
author: S K.

description: On a gorgeous day, this place couldn't be better for cheap beer, and a fantastic view!  Not many places you can enjoy a beverage or two on the water without having to drop a lot of cash.  Don't expect a fancy menu or bar, but when it comes to basics, this place is perfect!
author: Britta D.

description:
Didn't quite live up to the hype. The burger was a bit of "breadwich" (see Togo's commercials). Even though I like sourdough, the meat/bread ratio was off and even my overly generous addition of ketchup for "lubrication" did not aid the dry taste very much.

Cool atmosphere with the simple menu and the deck out back though. Feels nice and old and has character. Maybe next time I'll ask for 4 patties in the burger or something. Breakfast is probably worth a try as well.
author: Tim T.

description: Great burgers...a little sunshine...free parking. What more can you ask for? One of my favorite hangouts when I'm in the area.
author: Eric G.

description:
Great waterfront location.  Free parking.  Come for breakfast on a warm sunny day, sit outside, and enjoy the view.  Bring your kids and let them chase the birds.  
Those who are uncomfortable in low-key environs need not come.
author: chini l.

description: Breakfast sandwich (eggs, cheese and your choice of meat): $2.95.  Far superior to anything Mickey D's throws at you + a great view of the bay.  Oh did I mention they serve liquor?
author: Jumbo J.

description:
I wish I could have given this a higher rating.

All of the elements were there.

Divey appearance? Check... Patio overlooking the water? Check... Free parking? Check... Bustling locals with smiles plastered on their faces? Not so much. The place was empty save for two moms and their baby strollers.

I went there a little early, about 11:15 so I thought I would be getting a made to order burger. I was just a little off...

Ordered the double cheeseburger and watched with horror as the grill master tossed some precooked patties on the grill and lazily slapped on some cheese. 

After it was warmed up a little they put it on a delicious piece of french bread. But what good is a nice and soft crusty piece of french bread when the fillings are premade crap?

I regret not demanding a freshly made burger but hey, if that's how they do it I suppose it's good I found out early on. Will not go here again. The fries were nice and fresh seem to be on par with In n Out fries if you like that style.

I give this place 2.25 and that's after adding half a point for location on the water and in close proximity to the stadium.
author: E S.

description:
Sick of the way, overpriced, less than 12 oz, $10 microbrew at the overpriced bar up the street...I mean Pac Bell or whatever giant corporation it is named after. 

Sick of the walking Banana Republic, BeBe ads at Americano where you squeeze for a spot on a nice day

Red's Java House is your alternative!

There is plenty of parking, on a pier that plays hosts to the Warp Tour. You can get a double burger fries and a drink for under $8 and you get a view. Of course it might be looking up at the Bay Bridge or peering over the dock into dirty bay water, but who cares!

Service is always friendly. Women at the counter reminded me of a super nice Aunt. And they have great pitcher specials during Happy Hour. I would come to Red's any day of the week!
author: David B.

description:
Old waterfront dive
Enjoy cheap drinks on the deck
The burgers need help
author: HaikuReview X.

description: favorite spot in SF! great bloody mary's, outdoor seating and corned beef hash on the wknds (but get there early, they run out!). and the owner Sean is awesome. Heading there after work today!
author: T A.

description: Great location. Cool historic SF photos on the walls, Willie Mays. Had the double cheese burger combo. It was just ok. It was more like 2 Mcdonald's patties and one little slice of unmelted cheese between a whole loaf of sourdough bread.   Still planning on trying the breakfast.
author: JR. A.

description: Great spot for some drinks and food before a Giants game. The food isn't fantastic, but it's greasy and hits the spot, and much better than paying $8 for a hot dog at ATT park. This place is also ancient (built in 1911 I hear?) and falling apart, and has quite a bit of character. The manager jokingly told me that they should tear it down a build a Starbucks.
author: Sonya Y.

description: so i grab my beer and we sit outside on the terrace area behind the house, it's sunny and warm, i mean are we in SF still?  before i know it, i am drinking another beer, chatting with the neighbors and that's how a great afternoon started.  What's a bar for otherwise?
author: Damien J.

description: I didn't care for the food at all. The "cheeseburger" I had was just awful. And it wasn't cheap enough to make me lenient in this review. If you must go for the view, eat elsewhere and just get a beer.
author: Aaron L.

description: Forget the cable cars. Forget Alcatraz. Forget everything else touristy about this city and if you can only go one place on your visit, go here. It's such a little grungy hole-in-the-bay sort of place with authentic and cheap greasy spoon burgers and beer. What a fantastic place, it's so run down and cramped, it makes you forget about all the dorky tourists floating around.
author: Michael E.

description: Wow... that was a damn good burger.  It totally sucks for me as I work across the street.  (Sarcasm mode on.)  A burger and a beer here, then go to the Hi Dive next door for more drinks.  Life is good.  Thank god I take the train when I go into the City!
author: Chris B.

description: I love this place more for the dot.com memories maybe than the actual quality of the food, but you can't beat the price for a burger and bud.  Then just sit out in the sun and enjoy - totally a great deal.  The burger itself kinda reminds me of lunch cafeteria but I still dig it - I am so yellow trash...
author: Gene X.

description: Cool stop before a Giants game, great way to pig out on burgers and fries for cheap before forking over large amounts of cash for ball park food.  The outdoor seating with the view is worth it alone.  Go for the experience, not necessarily the food.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Really good location and cool, old-time San Francisco feel.  However, I'd have to say it was a bit dirty and the food was average.  Its fun, but nothing special.
author: Aaron M.

description: It had been many many years since I had seen a beer-yramid , and I think it was with Natural Light not PBR.  Head to the deck out back and you might see one yourself! Can't beat the view and price of beer (especially PBR) Great for pre-Giants game.
author: Sarah B.

description: One of my favorite old-school SF hangouts along the water. Find things here like a real BLT, grilled cheese, and hamburgers with your beer. See old black and white photos. Spend under $5. Be amazed this placed is still standing.
author: Risa F.

description: Nothing fancy here, just good cheap burgers (served on sourdough roll with pickles and onions), excellent fries, and cheap beer on the waterfront. My preferred place to stop in for a burger and a beer before a Giants game. It's a nice walk down the Embarcadero, and you'll save a bundle compared to the prices in the park.
author: Brian H.

description: Excellent location right on the water, my dad's maritime friends hang out here and tell sea stories, younger crowd can appreciate the beer and sourdough cheeseburgers (if not the salty conversation)
author: Christy M.

description: Want to eat cheap with the fisherman and dock workers?  This is the place.  Crusty looking outside, no frill, good food at cheap prices and beer!  The burger isn't the greatest, but its good and cheap.
author: Kathryn F.

description: Good breakfast sandwiches, mimosas in a plastic cup (so I can take one for the walk home) and $2 PBR..PLUS they don't mind if I bring Molly and sit on the patio out back. All the things we look for in our weekend!!
author: Erin A.

description: Yup. Another dive that I love. It's not about the food... it's about the Bloody Mary's and the patio. Bring a few friends and enjoy.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I tried to go here for happy hour, at the recommendation of some friends.  Apparently, happy hour ends at 6.  We slid right on over to Hi-Dive when the closed door refused to change its mind.  Try, try again...
author: Jay M.

description: It's all about being by the water here.  Get the fish and chips and wave to the fishies while you eat their kin.  Red's is awesome.
author: Valerie D.

description: Mmm Pancakes :D and coffee! MMM nice place to have some breakfast. Is it me or do there portions seem larger then most? Anyways I like this place and when I'm in the neighborhood and carving some breakfast ill go eat here
author: Kristina S.

description: Reds Java House is an institution and my go to lunch spot on a sunny Friday afternoon in downtown San Francisco. Burger, Bud, and Fries out on the deck looking at the Bay Bridge and telling the world to kiss your butt, all for about the price of well, I cant think of anything else cause its so cheap. The food is great, the beer is cold, and the blue collar feel of why order a beer when you can order a pitcher keeps me coming back.
author: Michael G.

description: Dont waste your money at STC (Some Telephone Company).  Ask Rob for a corona special or get a bucket on the cheap.  The food is right on par with the drinks: simple and perfect for a game day.
author: Porfirio R.

description:
Arrived with a friend late in the morning (10:30) on a weekday.  The guy behind the counter wasn't very friendly and our orders came up at different times.

My breakfast plate came up long after others who ordered after me.  When the guy called out my order for pick up, he still had not changed his attitude.  When I asked what took so long, he could only repsond with asking if the plate is what I ordered.

There are other places close by for a basic egg, bacon and toast, without the attitude!
author: Derek N.

description: I had high expectations of tasting a FATTY and awesomly tasting burger and what I experienced was a tasteless patty. Totally not worthy of being on Anthony B's show!
author: Kristy A.

description: This place is a legend.....one I can't stop visiting.  I'll find just about any excuse to spend lunch at Red's.  At least my friends know where to find me when in SF.  Good hearty burgers, fries, coffee and just about everything.  Oh, if you must have table service.....forget it.  Wait in line just like the rest of us!  On a warm summer day, it is great to look out the window and watch the waves slowly move under the pier.    Better yet, sit out front and watch the joggers work out while you feast on a fat burger....doesn't get any better.
author: Don L.

description: cheap place to get drinks before a giants game. the burgers really aren't that great. it's dift with the sourdough roll, but the meat's pretty dry and tasteless.
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: "Great breakfast for around $6.00. Nice bar behind building with $2.00 draft on tap for happy hour. Nice place to go when it's sunny and plenty of parking."
author: Buddy R.

description: On a sunny, clear day, you cannot beat a Red's double cheeseburger and onion rings.  Sit outside, chomp on your meal and enjoy a little noontime escape from your desk.
author: Marcus C.

description:
When me and my friends are looking for a quick bucket of Corona's after work, what better place than the conveniently located Red's?  Icy beer on a sunny day outside in the back over conversations of fisting and the smell of 2nd hand-smoke.  Pure bliss.
Only one complaint - why only 1 frickin' bathroom?  He who holds the spoon wields great power...
author: Marcel C.

description: The food is moderately priced, but of average quality.  The menu consists of mainly hamburgers and fish and chips, but they also have daily specials including chicken Parmesan and Ruben sandwiches.  There is a decent tap selection and seating outside on the pier facing the bay, even though the view is a little less glamorous and there much fewer tourists than at Fisherman's Wharf.  Pay very close attention during peak lunch hours if you're ordering a burger to go that you're getting the right one since they usually have a bunch stacked on the side of grill with the buns closed and the wrong one might be grabbed inadvertently.
author: Rick E.

description: How could you go wrong here, well you just can't- everything is yummy and satisfying- from the breafast sandwich that could feed a small army to their burgers- it's great! The rolls are crunchy and fresh- my favorite thing is when they call your name to let you know your food is ready, last week my name was "Candy". "Candy your eggs are ready"-
author: Ricquel N.

description: Tasty cheap eats at this place. Plenty of free parking, rare for the city, right on the water and they also have cool daily trivia game where you can score free food.
author: Steve B.

description: Burgers were good... served on a chewy sourdough roll, decently priced. Extra star for the view!!! Sits right below the bay bridge!! Will come back for sure.
author: athena k.

description: Why does Red's close so early??!!   This is the best place to drink a beer on the pier as the sunset comes near.  Cheaper, better attitude, and not as packed as Pier 23, this place could be one of my favorite spots in the city.  Alas, they close at 6PM and my dreams are dashed.
author: Val U.

description: Indeed Old School San Fran. Sourdough burgers for cryin' out loud.. This place has been around ever since I can remember. It actually used to just be the front room (it's expanded quite a bit). A total must... 5 stars!
author: Natas N.

description: This is the best value place in the city to have a beer and a burger on the waterfront and be outdoors.  You can't beat $6 for a burger and fries, and the clam chowder is pretty legit.
author: Eric S.

description: I love this place!  Great food & cheap drinks!  The patio is dog-friendly too... which is a find or maybe the people working there are so awesome that they didn't kick us and the dozen or so pit bulls we had with us out. :)
author: Stitchy M.

description: I came here for lunch today for two reasons and two reasons only: (1) Anthony Bourdain visited on "No Reservations;" and (2) it's literally 3 minutes walking from my place.  Unfortunately, I was more than a little disappointed.  The cheeseburger lacked flavor and was definitely on the dry side (though points should be given for using sour dough bread as the bun).  The french fries were, quite frankly, a little sad looking + soggy.  The ketchup tasted a bit funny too--almost like it was watered down.  However, what bothered me most wasn't the food but the FLIES!  OMG!  So many flies...  Also, let's not forget about our other friendly pests in the sky--the pigeons (also known as sky rats to some), two of which were brave enough to march into the kitchen and no one seemed to mind.  Am I weird for being a little weirded out?  For the first time in my life, I didn't finish my burger.  I literally lost my appetite as I was eating!  Sad :(
author: Sandy W.

description: I've never met a single person who didn't like Red's.  It's exactly what a greasy spoon shack on a pier should be: fast, cheap, greasy, tasty, and sunny.  Oh, and 10 more cool points for the sense of humor of the staff and the owner.  There's a sign on the wall that says "Reds NEVER serves lettuce and tomato.  Ever.  Don't even ask"!!!  Love it!  Eat the breakfast sandwich but switch the bread to something besides the baguette (it is usually too hard to bite into).  Order a cheap beer (was it $2?) and sit on the patio outside.  Hangover killer!
author: Kris N.

description: This place should be declared a landmark, and soon.  If it ever gets bumped due to the cruise ship terminal I keep hearing about, I would be bummed out.  The guy at the counter cracks me up one way or another every time I go there.  You can get breakfast with your beer and start any hangover properly.
author: jimbo r.

description: If you're looking for some authentic SF funky charm , this is the place. Super cheap prices for greasy spoon menu. Very amusing staff.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
Perfect spot for nice weathered Friday beer lunch with coworkers or friends.

Their fish and chips are delicious.  You can run around to the back and grab a pitcher for you and your buds.  Outdoor seating right on the water.  Great view of the Bay Bridge, and the bay when it's not too foggy.

I'm only knocking it a star because sometimes, when the weather is just right it can be hard to find a spot during lunchtime hours.  Also there's a couple mental looking pigeons that can be disturbing.

I've had the fish and chips, chicken parmesan, egg salad sandwich, and chili cheese fries.  None of them have let me down.  And washing it down with a cold one is always refreshing, and recharging before hitting the office for the rest of the afternoon.

(If you're really lucky, you might be able to see a pirate ship on the water! No seriously.)
author: clare t.

description:
cheap cheap overlooking the bay bridge on a gorgeous sunny day ... NOT

when does sf ever get to be gorgeous....*snickers*

it is what it is.

this place looks a bit shacky but honestly it's cute the way it is... others may consider this a divey kinda place and honestly if this is what "divey" is, i ain't complaining.... id rather hang out at THIS KINDA DIVEY place than zeigeist (click! http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=EKdyI4jpUF29YtPkKiCtcg&q=zeigeist)

they have your usuals like any typical american joint: burgers, fries, breakfast, and every other uberly eats. its one of those "walk in, glance at the menu (give or take, 2 secs) and order" just do yourself a favor and dont waste your time by asking, "whats good or whats not" because the other folks will not be happy .... 

i dont recall paying more than $3.

great place for happy hours (not the classy type, just "get drunk and burp and be happy") kinda place.

great place to chill before the giants game since it's just up the street. 

lots and lots of free parking.

a MAJOR downfall: the bathroom. ONLY one. AND you have to share with *coughs* men...
author: Jennifer S.

description: this place isn't that bad i pass this place many times but never ate here afther watching anthony bourdain go here i found my self in san francisco the other day and was near here so i had to go try it out . i had a double cheeseburger and chili fries and it was pretty good the burger comes on a sourdough bun i would come here again this place was alright nice view of the bay and and bay bridge staff was freindly can't complain .....
author: Jose C.

description: One of my friend's favorite bars, and becoming one of mine as well. Greasy ,cheap  food (like juicy  hamburger on a sourdough baguette) and cheap beer make it a great place to have a few before a Giant's game or to simply sit on the outside patio and stare off into the bay. It isn't a looker, but a great no nonsense joint.
author: m p.

description: Oh my gosh, best darn San Fran Greasy Spoon Ever!!  Great location, and don't miss their sourdough breakfast sandwiches.  Never had lunch, this is an out of the way morning spot to just enjoy the bay from  Try it You'll just love it!
author: Michael B.

description: Reds is the premier pre-Giants game destination.  Their no-frills, relaxed, sun soaked back-patio offers an economical pre-game forum of $9 pitchers, water views, and excellent people watching.  It's hard not to wear a smile when reclining on one of Reds patio chairs.
author: Sonia R.

description: Here is a little known fact about Red's that sets it apart from the rest: they have free parking.  What other restaurant in downtown SF has free parking?  None.  For this reason alone, Red's is a winner.  Add on top of that the sunny back patio that always seems to have an open seat and the great prices and this classic is hard to beat.
author: Robert G.

description: Here;s the way I see it as a ttourist. First of all free parking, and in this city that's a big plus. Going's to Red's, the hamburger is the way to go. If you want a salad or a buffet on yours, this place is not for you. It's all about the beef and the bread. Simply dressed with pickle and mustard this is delicious. Onion rings are also hot and crispy. Sit outside if the weather permiits.
author: Brian P.

description: Cheap, tasty, good with a small group of people. A little run down, but it has character.
author: John S.

description: My first experience at Red's Java House was a late breakfast on a misty Saturday morning just before a Giants game against the [hated] Dodgers. It was awesome! Good old fashioned diner eats. Great family-like atmosphere with a dockside Old San Francisco feel. Herb Caan would be proud. Seagulls are optional, Giants gear a must. :-)
author: Tim M.

description: This is the only place to go before a Giants game. They have a full bar, cheap beer and great food. What more can you ask for?
author: Chris M.

description: I can not belive Anthony on tv actually said anything good about this place. I think a McDonalds hamburger is actually on the same level. That is not saying much. The place is flithy!!!!! You can not even see out of the windows because of all the pigeon crap. YUKKKKK!!!!!! A little hard to stomach.
author: Lorraine C.

description:
OK, so I get a funny look when I order but:
egg salad/tuna salad combo on wheat with mustard, pickles and onions

Seriously, give it a chance.  I don't know why it tastes so good but it does.

Free parking plus the fact that my dog can hang out back with us make this a place not to be missed - and the prices aren't bad either.
author: d l.

description: oh red's, its been a family tradition for as long as i can remember. and the funny thing is i've only been there once, but my dad would sometimes work in the city and we'd look forward to him bringing home red's. burgers are supremely good, bigger (and better!) than your average burger. only downside is no ketchup and it needs ketchup or otherwise it's a tad dry. i've heard the place has gone slightly up in price so there's a disappointment there. but to me it will always be beloved
author: Kaitie D.

description:
terrible

only went here since bourdain was biggin it up - i want to return to prove myself wrong - dude - a dbl cheeseburger shouldnt taste sooooo bad
author: Stuart g.

description: Sorry to be blunt but the burgers were tasteless. I'm still wondering how you can mess up a burger.  The chili tastes like it came from a can. One redeeming value was the fish and chips. That was actually good. Took off a star for the cashier who overcharged us.
author: AndyBoy V.

description: Nice little place to eat if our looking for something quick. I'm not going to say it has the greatest burgers or food bit it gets the job done, good prices, good portions. Great place to go before or after a game, or even during lunch breaks. Their breakfast is pretty good too, better than lunch in my opinion
author: John G.

description: I dont give a damn if Anthony Bourdain came here, dont get me wrong Ive read most of his books and I find him quite funny but I liked Reds on its own with or without the show. I work in the restaurant industry (kind of a nice one) and when I'm off i like to go to places where i can just chill. It is so nice to grab a bucket of beer hang out with your friends (and hear them) as the sun sets. The view under that bridge can be nice at sunset, who would have thunk it? I didn't. Then i get a burger or a dog before kitchen closes then put all my own touches on it. It is a nice beginning or an end to a night for me. fin (ha ha ha)
author: cheyne i.

description: I used to go to Red's years ago. We were on the Embarcadero and decided to try it for lunch.  We had our dog with us so we went out back on the deck. We should have left when we saw the porta potty in the eating area.  The back deck and bar area were filthy.  The food was mediocre at best.
author: Robert G.

description: this place has awesome breakfast sandwiches.  always a good place to come after a long night of drinking.  cheap, huge, greasy breakfast sandwiches.
author: Michael N.

description: cheap but good!  that's the best way i know to describe this place.  lunch is good - burgers, fries, sandwiches.  its a great option when the weather is nice, and you can sit outside and admire the water, bridge, view, etc.  i have also been for happy hour on the back deck which is fun.  pitchers for everyone!!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Minus one star for slathering EVERYTHING in mustard. Cheeseburgers, turkey sandwiches, hot dogs -- everything is doused in the yellow stuff.
author: Mia L.

description: ..a great breakfast place that serves the right amount of food for its inexpensive price! enjoy the traditional early morning cravings- eggs, pancakes, bacon, coffee, etc - and daily specials. casual environment with outside seating by the water...top that off with staff who are down-to-earth..what a great way to begin your mornings!
author: Beignet W.

description: Fantastic view. Good music. TASTY food.... but mustard was slightly heavy for me in their burgers. Sourdough bread makes a great hamburger bun. YUM.
author: C E.

description: great lunch spot, food is so basic not even worth noting, but its fun place to hang once in a while.
author: tommy p.

description: nothing to write home about, the burger is so so and doesn't come with a bun but a roll.  great place to have a burger and beer and have a view of the bay.
author: Pickle R.

description: crispy bacon.  such a simple concept yet plenty of restaurants fail to either understand this simple concept or fail to execute it.  i detest limp bacon.  but if you come to red's, they get it, they really do.  came here on a rainy day off from work with my best friend to take in the sights and grab breakfast.  its a limited menu but its all delicious and quite cheap. i got a breakfast sandwich with CRISPY FING BACON for under $4 and it was pure happiness.  the service is very friendly - because the menu on the chalkboard has no descriptions, the cashier kindly went through every breakfast item in detail.  the common theme is you get eggs, a breakfast meat (if youre smart you will get the crispy bacon) and then some type of bread product.  either way, you cannot go wrong because crispy bacon is the best!  have i mentioned i enjoy crispy bacon?  because i do.
author: Cathy L.

description: I love this place.  My friends and I have a regular Sunday networking session where we just hang on the patio and who ever shows up shows up.  You can sit in the sun, enjoy the incredible view and drink bloody mary's or buy buckets of beer.  The food is good an inexpensive.  And there is free parking.  Where does that every happen in SF.
author: Robin T.

description: This place is one of the best holes in the...wharf? pier? Anyway, Red's is freakin' money and has been here so long it's probably a certified historical site, or it should be. The old-school memorabilia covering the walls and tables is charming. Their breakfast is cheap and simple: some eggs, bacon and potatoes. Also, they have a great bar and a waterfront patio. Remember, no lettuce or tomoatoes. Don't ask and they won't tell.
author: Alexandra O.

description: I have been coming to Red's for almost 20 years. You used to get a burger and a long neck bud for $2.95 back then. Red's was still full of working class folks in those days, dock workers construction tradesmen and the like. It changed ownership a handful of years ago and they expanded the kitchen and and added a bar and outdoor seating In the back with nice views of the bay, sea birds, and the bay bridge. Actually, in the old days, they didn't even have a fryer so you could only get your burger with chips because fries were not an option. They also used to have a small coffee roaster in the front dining room, but that has been removed. For the most part, the changes have been for the better and the food is still great. But it's not really a cheap working class spot anymore. It's also not nearly as packed at noon on a weekday as it used to be. I was there just yesterday at 11:45 and had a double chili dog. The service was fast, the food was great, but the place was a little desolate. The chilidog comes on a crusty sourdough roll and was heaping with chili. Impossible to eat with my hands, it was almost impossible to eat with the plastic utensils provided. But all in all, I enjoyed myself. I am sure I will be a Red's patron for years to come.
author: shane w.

description: great place to grab a beer and a nice burger for lunch on a nice day. i don't work too far from here so getting here is pretty easy. it's a small place with a great atmosphere and good fast service. so if you need a place to grab a quick bite go and try this place.
author: cj b.

description: Came here last Saturday for some good ol afternoon drinking.  It was a beautiful day out so we were very happy that we could sit outside.  Drinks were reasonably priced.  You don't have to worry about any pretentious people here, everyone we saw/met was very friendly and the staff there was the same.  I did not eat, but my friends got a couple burgers and said that they were very good.  We will definitely be coming back here again
author: Matt B.

description: Red's is just a stones throw from my boyfriends loft so it's the easiest and quickest breakfast when you don't feel like cooking.  I've only had breakfast and always to go so my review may be a bit limited...... My boyfriend loves this place while I find it only good.  They make a good pancake!!!  The bacon, sausage and eggs leave me wanting.  The eggs are usually Very cooked while I find the bacon to be generally undercooked (for my liking) and rather limp.  The bacon and sausage remind me a bit of something I would find on my McDonald's McSomethingforbreakfast.  Too put the breakfast in simplest terms...it's a great hangover breakfast joint.  The atmosphere seems pretty cool every time I am there.  It's laid back and yet not slow.  There's always an eclectic crowd.  You can find local construction workers grabbing coffee and a bite and business men in suits.  I've noticed the outdoor patio in the back and it looks like a great place to sit for a meal during the summer so I'd suggest trying it out if you eat your meal there.  Other than that all you have to know is that the girl behind the counter is sure to flirt with any man while he's ordering, even if his wife or girlfriend is standing right there next to him, although I think it's more compulsive than it is ill intended. :)
author: Talia L.

description: This is the best place to goto on a Friday when it's not raining or foggy and when you want to walk down by the water on a sunny day during your work lunch break kind of place.  I bought their fish and chips and burger (they got the burger done in seconds; I guess they pre-made them?), and it was all good.  What's great is that this is built on the pier so you are right by the water!  How could this place get any better?
author: Jim N.

description: I have been going to Red's Java House since I was a small kid with my father back when The Waterfront was really a "Waterfront". I always LOVED this place. Recently I went there after my brother told me how terrible the hot dogs have become. Since I found it hard to believe, I decided I'd go see for myself. OMG!. they were HORRIBLE!. Red's used to use the old fashion style hot dogs that had a snap when you bit into them ( much like the Evergood/Schwarz brand ). The hot dogs on my visit were undoubtedly Oscar Meyer's that have that god awful flavor and the distinct pointed ends. I might add they were skinless as well, since there was no "snap" as well. I heard that they hads changed owners and the owners was cutting costs to make more profit ( I really don't know how true this is ), and it was quite apparent who ever is in chagre hasn't a clue of what Red's Java House is all about...STAY AWAY until someone gets their stuff together!!!
author: Joe R.

description: This place is a breathe of fresh air in city full pseudointellectual hipster wimps and pretentious restaurants.  Long live Red's Java House!!!
author: Sam T.

description: The location is awesome and the prices are reasonable.  The patio is incredible, you feel like you're sitting on a raft out in the bay.  The food is decent, it can be a little greasy but the patio more than makes up for it.  The people are laid-back and friendly.  A great place to have a beer with some buddies and relax.  I'd recommend Red's to anyone.
author: Matt D.
